column1: Improve List Views
column34:
_As a user, I want all Lists in Colony to behave more consistently._

+Acceptance Criteria:+
* Move the List Command controls on Mice, Litters, and Breedings lists into their own partial view, frozen above the data independent of scrolling (does not include Kendo grid column header).
* The existing Javascript includes for list functionality need to be evaluated to be sure they are handling events bubbled up from the new UI 

+Note to Developer(s):+
* Explore opportunity to disassociate Search from the list view

+Note to QA:+
* Do not worry about testing the button to toggle between list view and cage view as part of this story.  That functionality will be covered in COMA-2364.
column151:
15/Jun/18 2:29 PM;jjensen;[~tpatterson], [~jcox], For the three lists mentioned, I have been able to break out the icons and place them in the ActionBar (originally exclusively used only by the Cage Workbench).  There are, however, a few issues.

# At this time, only the action icons have been moved up, away from the grid, and into the ActionBar.  It looks like the search input box can move there as well, and it can be made list-agnostic in case the impetus for exploring the relocation of the search bar is to make it more generic.
# When I resize the window to a tablet or phone format, the positioning of the ActionBar icon containers does crazy things.  Please look at the attached pictures for details.  Two specific problems can be seen:
## The ActionBar container does not change in height when the icons stack vertically, and
## The wide container in the mouse list eventually wraps and makes this page look extremely bad.
# Spacing between icons may become an issue when usability problems arise with tablet form factor testing.

 !Screen Shot 06-15-18 at 02.27 PM.PNG|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 06-15-18 at 02.28 PM.PNG|thumbnail!
column152:
18/Jun/18 4:42 PM;jjensen;[~jcox], [~tpatterson] & [~cleduc], this ticket has opened a door to several cans of worms, so I would like to document [a] what will be done with this ticket, and [b] what should be created as other tickets.

First, what will be done:
# The list pages for Mice, Litters, and Breedings will be changed, and none others.
# There are two categories of icons at the top of these lists: Actions and Item Actions.  The Actions are mostly the same and are drawn with the color $a0a0a0 (gray).  The Item Actions are colored white with a blue background.  Item Actions bear a relationship to the items selected in the list, whereas the Actions are independent of the list.  These two groups of icons will be moved into the pre-existing ActionBar div used previously only by the Cage Workbench.
# The gray "x" in the Actions icon list will be made white.
# Options available only under certain conditions in the Actions list will remain visible but disabled.
# The Actions icon list will shrink to a hamburger icon when the browser width shrinks to the bootstrap medium size or less.  Clicking on that icon will drop down a vertical list of the icons and their names as currently seen in the tooltips.  This menu will also be colored blue with white text/icons.

What should be done:
# A generic Epic Jira ticket needs to be created to hold all UI/UX tickets.
# A ticket should be generated (at least the shell of one) for these issues:
## Search design and functionality
## "Add" icons and their related pages (if needed) for each relevant list
## Make the icon changes for the rest of the lists as well
## List page template design (i.e. standardizing the look and feel)
## Card design
## Editable item design
## Overall visual standards and branding

I think you get the idea.  Ted mocked up something as well:
 !Selected_Items_Options.png|thumbnail! 
 !Ted_UI_Concepts_2018-06-18.jpg|thumbnail!
column153:
19/Jun/18 8:04 AM;jjensen;[~tpatterson],[~cleduc], When Ted and I discussed the mockups, we thought the option on the far right was preferable to the others.  The plan for dropdowns is this:  Retain the colors (#1c75bc, which is a saturated steelblue in the case of selected items actions), provide a drop-down chevron icon to indicate the ability to show a menu, drop a vertical menu with the same coloring scheme, show only the available actions, replace the drop-down chevron with a drop-up chevron during menu display, and pull the menu back up on the chevron click.

@Carrie, there is a question on whether or not we should show all actions and have the unavailable ones disabled. However, that leads to a logical conclusion whereupon the menu should be available and shown when there are no items selected in the list as well, displaying all actions as disabled.  [~tpatterson] feels this is patently wrong and flies against the norms found elsewhere in web-based applications.  I agree with him, but we need your input on this as well.
column154: 19/Jun/18 8:22 AM;cleduc;[~jjensen] [~tpatterson] What if, when nothing is selected do not show the menu related only to things selected. When one thing is selected I would like to see that menu, when more than one, I would like to see the same menu with the unavailable single options gray but still in the bar. Might help avoid the "where'd it go, I could do this before, was I somewhere else, do I click somewhere else" rabbit hole. Thoughts?
column155: 19/Jun/18 9:07 AM;tpatterson;I'm all for this approach [~cleduc]. While we don't have the real estate or need to show the selection actions at all times, showing disabled options will definitely help us curb confusion and push people to experiment.
column156: 29/Jun/18 10:28 AM;jcox;[~bwinter] [~jjensen], I added a note in the Description to instruct QA to ignore testing the view toggle button as part of this story's requirements.

column151: 01/Jun/18 7:31 AM;jjensen;[~bwinter], The 500 Error is a generic error thrown by IIS when something bad happens at the server.  In this case, when the code on the server side was attempting to build the sort tokens, one of the mouse names broke the algorithm:  "999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999".  The fix was made and it now works, albeit via the COMA-2452 branch.

column152: 06/Jun/18 9:42 AM;rwilliams;[~bwinter] Yesterday I was finally able to look a little further into your reported issues, and the only thing left was the issue of seeing the litters from the import showing up in cages. Well, after I fixed the bug with the OffspringSettings not being created that I mentioned yesterday, these litters do not show up in cages. As far as I understand it, with the import, we are not creating litters unless they already have physical pups, and we are setting up the imported litter and pups as weaned, and therefore I would not expect to ever see an imported litter in a cage.

column155:
07/Jun/18 11:12 AM;rwilliams;[~bwinter] There was one place you missed (gene card) that needed to be updated from Transgene Advanced to KIS. See this image:  !updated text on the gene card.png|thumbnail!

See:  !GeneResults for a Transgene Advanced.png|thumbnail!  !GeneResults for a Transgene Advanced X sex-linked.png|thumbnail! 
I am considering now the other change about moving the "X/" to the "/X". Let me know if you have any feedback. I think Nate favored the "/X" (always at the end).

column1: Mice List filtering on Genotype is not working
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Go to Mice List
# Filter on Mouse Details > Genotype > select a genotype 
# UI does not indicate with a check which selection has been made <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
# Filter does not return mice with selected genotype <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen:

* When I select a genotype to filter on, I expect the UI to show me which genotype I selected in the filter list
* After selecting a genotype to filter on, I expect the Mice List to filter on mice with that genotype.

column157:
16/Aug/18 11:09 AM;bwinter;[~cleduc], [~apacio], heads up!  [~jjensen] fix for genotypes works really well!  There are a few unexpected things that happened that are not problematic at all, but I just wanted to let you know about.  See screenshots below.

 !UNEXPECTED - Filtering on a genotype that is common across multiple genes (eg XX, Inconclusive) shows list of mice for all matches not just for matches within that Gene - 2018-08-16 10_39_39-.png|thumbnail! 
 !UNEXPECTED - Filtering on mice with WT as genotype for Gene1 returns all mice from any gene with WT found in the genotype - 2018-08-16 10_36_33-.png|thumbnail! 
 !UNEXPECTED - Filtering on mice with Inconclusive as genotype for Gene12 returns all mice with Inconclusive as genotype regardless if Gene12 is in mouse strain -2018-08-16 10_35_20-.png|thumbnail!
column158:
16/Aug/18 11:16 AM;cleduc;[~bwinter], [~apacio], [~jjensen] Thanks Bryan! Looks like we need to be sure that we say they should first filter by strain and then by genotype. They will expect to be filtered by both if they select under a strain and genotype but that's OK. This is a quick learn. 
There is utility for searching for a specific genotype and wanting to see all strains that contain it...so that's good in a way!
column159: 16/Aug/18 11:52 AM;jjensen;[~bwinter], [~cleduc], this is all due to the fact that the filtering is done on text, not values.  There is no context on the filter in the Kendo grid.  Instead, it only asks if the text in the column contains the text selected from the list.  In pointing this out, you have revealed a feature that cannot be anticipated, but could be implemented within the C# code behind the update to this kind of page that will happen sometime in the future.  :)
column160: 17/Aug/18 11:04 AM;bwinter;Retested after silent QA push on 2018-08-17 @ 9:47 AM.  Testing still passed.

column1: Production Issue - MouseList performing poorly and occasionally appears to be throwing sql timeout errors
column34:
On my initial look into this issue, looking at dev tools, it appears that the mouselist page is duplicating the ajax call used to populate the list. For customers with 2500+ mice the sql view is taking from 5 seconds up to 9 seconds just to get the data from the database. As I was watching these two calls (which both return the same results and a pretty large set of data), I noticed that on occasion one of the calls would fail with a 500 and I believe that failure was a SQL timeout. As best as I know the page should not be making two calls.

column1: Keep Dates consistent between iOS and Web
column34:
_As a user, I want dates displayed consistently between the web and iOS._

+Acceptance Criteria:+
* User always sees dates relative to their Group's timezone and those dates should match between web and iOS.
* Include timezone identifier whenever datetimes are shown.
* For example, currently if a user saves data on the web after 6 PM central on 1/11/2018, then it gets recorded as 1/12/2018 UTC, and then presented to the user moving forward as 1/12/2018.
column151: 15/Aug/18 2:52 PM;cleduc;[~admin] Should this get reassigned since you’re on other stuff or do we think the iOS ticket will cover it? The most important date to never vary is mouse DOB.
column152:
15/Aug/18 3:16 PM;admin;[~jadhikari]

This is the Date/Timezone ticket we discussed. The commits on this branch are the common methods to convert UTC to locality adjusted date and vice versa. Let me know if you need any clarification on the goal.

column1: Breeding card: Litters tab Sort litters
column34:
_As a user, I would like the sort of litters in the Breeding Card > Litters Tab to match on both the web and iOS, so that I can easily identify litters._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Order litters chronologically with most oldest at the top

Example:
Litter CALR2-M1 in production sandbox has 2 litters
should be listed 
2/5/2018
3/14/2018 (date doesn't match iOS because of the date issue.)

column1: Retire/Unretire Mouse functionality not working quite correctly
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Go to Breedings
# Select Breeding where neither parent is retired
# Click Parents tab
# Click 3-dot menu for one of the parents
# Click Retire/Unretire
# Click save to retire parent
# Click 3-dot menu for same mouse
# There is no way to UNRETIRE mouse <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
# User allowed to RETIRE breeding but other parent will be marked as UNRETIRED <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen:

* I expected that clicking "Retire/Unretire" menu option from 3-dot menu would allow me to retire mouse and UNRETIRE mouse.
* I expected that retiring a breeding would automatically retire all breeders in breeding.


------------------------------------------


h2. Scenario:

# Go to breeding list and select a breeding so that you get the breeding card modal (for this scenario, there are 2 parent mice, neither are retired, and both of these parents are only parents on this one breeding)
# Click on the parents tab and then click the 3 dot menu for one of the parents and choose the "Retire/Unretire" option
# The dialog will give you the option to set the retire date for that mouse, but it won't let you retire the current breeding because there are currently two non-retired mice on the breeding. Set the retire date and then click save
# Next, for the same mouse as before, click the 3 dot menu and choose the "Retire/Unretire" option again
# Problem #1: The dialog looks very similar as before giving you a date to set the retire date on the breeding parent; there is now no way to unretire this mouse
# Problem #2: The dialog also now surmises that there is only 1 non-retired mouse on the breeding and therefore it gives you the option the go ahead and mark the breeding retired. The problem here is that the 1 non-retired mouse is the OTHER parent mouse on the breeding and not the mouse that you clicked on to retire. This would allow the breeding to get marked as retired, but leave the other parent as not retired.

h2. So, how should it work?

* For problem #1, if the selected mouse is already retired, the dialog should somehow allow the user to unretire the mouse.
* For problem #2, the count that the dialog is looking at to determine number of non-retired breeders on this breeding needs to exclude itself from the list of other breeders on this breeding and then the count of other non-retired breeders on this breeding it should check for is 0 before it lets the user check the box to retire the breeding.

h2. BA and DEV NOTE!! 

This retire dialog is the breeding/retiremouse dialog. There is an alternative "Retire Mouse" dialog at mouse/retiremouse. I think we need to consider modifying this dialog to look/work like the other one or modifying the other one to work in the context of the breeding. I think the other dialog is more clear about what is going on and I think it actually works correctly. The difference is that the mouse/retiremouse dialog runs for a mouse only doesn't consider the particular breeding that is popped up like the dialog at breeding/retiremouse. You can get to the mouse/retiremouse dialog by opening up a cagecard that has a breeding mouse in it, click on the 3 dot menu and you will find the retire/unretire option there.

 !breeding-retiremouse dialog.PNG|thumbnail!  !mouse-retiremouse dialog.PNG|thumbnail! 

h2. NOTE to SQA:

* I modified the mouse/retiremouse dialog so that if a breedingId was passed to it, it would show a green label that says  "Selected Breeding" after the breeding name in the retire mouse dialog. That way we get a reused and fully functioning retire/unretire mouse dialog but in the context of a particular breeding, that breeding is highlighted in the mouse's list of breedingparents/breedings.
* I moved some common business logic for breedings from views to the breeding business object - CanEditBreeding, CanDeleteBreeding, CanAddLitter, and a reason why those tasks may not be available. Updated some of the views to use some of these new properties to make them behave consistently. This allows us to reuse the logic across the entire application and stay consistent across the application

column1: Include Breeding Offspring Strain when filtering cages by strain
column34:
Currently, when filtering cages by strain, only mice and litters are included in the search. We would like to add the ability to show cages whose breeders are producing an offspring strain other than their own strains. If a litter exists in the cage then the cage will be returned by the filter, but if no litter is present, then the filter will not show the cage.

Example: Male breeder is Strain 1. Female breeder is Strain 2. Breeding.OffspringStrain is Strain 3. Both mice are in the same cage (cage ABC). When filtering cages by "Strain 3", "Cage ABC" will NOT be returned in the results. After a litter is added to cage ABC, then the cage will be included in the filter results.

Note: I've attached some images from a production account (Levine, Michael at UCLA). They have several breedings with offspring strain of "(Line 31000...". 2 of these breedings do not have any litters yet and they are unable to find them when filtering cages. The iOS app had the same issue but has recently added that query when filtering cages by strain. See CMI-261.

*Logic from iOS (pseudo code because the actual code is harder to read because it is very specific to the data storage on iOS)*
When filtering cages by Strains (\[theStrainIds\])
* Include cages that have an associated litter with that strain (where any cage.litters.offspringstrainid IN \[theStrainIds\])
* Include cages that have an associated mouse with that strain (where any cage.mice.strainid IN \[theStrainIds\])
* Include cages that have an associated breeding with that strain (where any cage.mice.breedingParents.breeding.offspringstrainId IN \[theStrainIds\]).
** The iOS app does not currently exclude INACTIVE breedings because we couldn't figure out how to do it. However, it seems unlikely that a breeder would be in multiple breedings of different offspring strains AND it is not common to keep a breeder alive after they are retired. Generally they are euthanized after being retired. 

h2. *+Web Implementation Note:+*
Per instruction above the web DOES NOT exclude Inactive breedings either, *BUT* if needed or wanted, the web can only filter on Active breeding offspring strains.

column1: Modify OmProbes Query for Probes to use the "WT" suffix naming on the PredefinedProbeName
column34:
Modify existing OmProbes queries in Colony to use the suffix "WT" naming convention on the PredefinedProbeName instead of the ProbeName.

[~jmedlock] got the go ahead just modify the existing OmProbes query in Colony so that it uses the PredefinedProbeName to determine WT probes. After looking into the code we found that the OmProbes query was already rightly using the predefined probe name. But we still need to implement the IsWildType flag and make all of the needed changes that go along with that.

column1: Modify Inconclusive Help Text for Omitted and Incomplete Samples
column34:
Omitted and incomplete samples show an inconclusive reason of "probes not run". This inconclusive reason needs to be more descriptive for these scenarios.

Display the following language for omitted samples:
"Reason for Inconclusive Result:
Sample was omitted from processing."

Display the following language for incomplete samples:
"Reason for Inconclusive Result:
Sample has not finished processing."

Any sample that is omitted should have "Omit" as the probe result for ALL probes. It will never be compounded with another inconclusive reason/impossible result.

Any sample that is incomplete (samples w/o probe results on partially completed orders), should have "N/A" as the probe result for all probes. Any valid (+ or -) results will not be released until all probe results for the sample have completed processing. If one of the probes on the strain was Not Run, still only display the incomplete sample help text.
column151:
18/Apr/18 2:45 PM;qevans;Omitted messaging has been updated (screenshot-3).
Incomplete samples show new messaging by itself (screenshot-4) and in conjunction with a Not Run probe (screenshot-5).
QA verified.

column1: Disable Assign Genotypes to Mice until Order is Completed
column34:
_As a user, I should not be able to assign genotypes from the results view until my order is fully completed._

Disable the Assign to Genotypes button on the results view until order is in the Complete status.
Button should appear gray, with hover text:
"Genotypes can be assigned once this order is Completed. Please contact customer service with questions about the status of this order."

Once the order is in Genotypes Asssigned status, the hover text should not be displayed.

column1: Warn User of Discrepant User Input Sex and Y Probe Result
column34:
For sex-linked mutations, a sex is needed in order to calculate the genotype. Sex of the mouse can potentially come from 2 places- whatever the user inputted when creating/editing the mouse, or the Y probe result. 

If the Y probe result (+ or -) and user inputted sex (male or female) do not match, user should be warned on the results view.
* Y = +, user = female
* Y = -, user = male

If Y probe result is UND or user inputted sex is unknown, do not display any warning.

Warning language:
"The user inputted sex and Y probe calculated sex conflict for this sample.
Y probe results were used to inform the genotype result.
Please contact customer service with questions regarding your results."

Also shows in conjunction with inconclusive/impossible messaging (screenshot-2). Warning incorrectly appears when gender is unknown and will be handled in COMA-2545. QA verified.

column1: Calculate Sex-Linked Genotypes (Y Probe)
column34:
For sex-linked mutations, a sex is needed in order to calculate the genotype.

* If Y probe run on order, use Y probe result to calculate genotype.
* If Y probe result UND, or Y probe not run on order, use user inputted sex to calculate genotype.
** If user inputted sex is unknown, calculate Inconclusive genotype.

Results engine should differentiate between genotypes calculated with the Y probe result and genotypes calculated with user inputted sex, so that UI can display appropriate messaging (COMA-2529). Per Rich, "Some indication that the engine used the passed in gender as opposed to a probe result determined gender."
Also create new inconclusive reason (to be displayed in UI help text COMA-2527) to indicate "No sex information available".
column151:
11/Apr/18 4:05 PM;rwilliams;[~qevans] How do propose we do this: "Results engine should differentiate between Y probe result and user input genotypes so that UI can display appropriately."

If I am not mistaken, if there is no Y probe on the strain, then the Y probe will not show up in the results (I think). And if the Y probe is there and the result is not valid, like "UND", I think that the results page will show the bad result in the Y probe column. And if the Y probe is there and the result is valid it will show with the result in the Y probe column.

But, if there is no Y probe and the gender for the mouse is used, there is currently no indication that the mouse gender as set in Colony was used to determine the results.

column1: Unexpected Genotype Results on Order Results page for a strain with Y Probe and other probes for Y-Linked Gene (1 MUT / 1 WT)
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Linked to QO strain with Y Probe, MUT probe, and WT probe (for Y-Linked Gene - 1 MUT / 1 WT)
# Placed order
# Received order
# Submitted possible results
# All results were "Inconclusive" <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen

When submitting these results for {{<Y Probe>}}, {{<MUT probe>}}, and {{<WT probe>}}, I expected to see these {{<genotypes>}} for these mouse with this {{<sex>}}.

|| {{<sex>}} || {{<Y probe>}} || {{<MUT probe>}} || {{<WT probe>}} || {{<genotype>}} ||
| {{?}} | {{+}} | {{+}} | {{-}}  | {{X/Gene11<KO>}} |
| {{M}} | {{+}} | {{-}} | {{+}}  | {{X/Gene11<WT>}} |
| {{F}} | {{-}} | {{-}} | {{-}}  | {{X/X}} |

h1. Note to Testers
* The results engine does one main thing , the translation of probe results into generesults, however, it also provides an additional function. The additional function is the generation of the results matrix that is used on the Strain Linking Review page which shows all possible permutations for a given set of probesets (mutation/probe combinations). Obviously, the results matrix function uses the results translation function to get it results. All of that to say, what I found with this issue is that the results matrix function was using the results translation function slightly differently that Order Results page was using it and that is why the Strain Linking Review page looked fine for the scenario, but the Order Results page did not. All of this was just FYI.
* I also wanted to mention that while I was working on this ticket I noticed that the Genotypes were being displayed differently on the Order Results page than they were on the Strain Linking Review page. So, while I had this ticket open I also changed the display on the Strain Linking Review page to match the Order Results page. I mention this just so you will be aware in case anything strange comes up on the Strain Linking Review page. I don't anticipate anything, but I just wanted to let you know.
* IMPORTANT: I also added in some validation functionality for results, meaning that the string result must match one of it's predefined possible results. Then, for Sex-Linked mutations, I updated the check for a valid Y probe result to determine if the probe was run and if it had a valid result or not. If it wasn't run or if it was invalid, the results engine should now return "Results returned with an undetermined code" instead of using the sex of the sample that was being tested for the gender
*

column1: Remove Multiple "Assign Genotype" Buttons from Multiplate Orders
column34:
_As a user, I should only have 1 option to assign genotypes to all samples on my order, regardless if it is a multiplate order._

On results view, multiplate orders display an Assign Genotypes to Mice button per well plate. If selected for 1 well plate, it applies to all samples (on all plates) on the order. Users may mistakenly apply genotypes for samples they have not yet seen or reviewed.

Remove multiple instances of the Assign Genotype to Mice button from results view. Only display one of these action buttons per order (not per well plate). See order 50209 in QA for example.

column1: Do not allow user to Edit Order after an Order has been submitted
column34:
_As a Transnetyx stakeholder, I do not want a user to be able to edit an order after that order has been submitted, because it will make a big giant mess._

+Acceptance Criteria+:

* When a user submits an order, do not allow them to edit the order.

Technical Design:
A new view has been created (ViewOrder.cshtml), that displays the wellplates in a read only state. When an order is in a status other than Incomplete, the readonly view will automatically be returned by the server (instead of the editor).

This view uses the existing wellplate partialview that the wellplate edit page uses, with all data controls removed / disabled.

The breadcrumb at the top of the Edit Order route has been changed to say "BIOPSY SAMPLE ASSIGNMENT", since that would be a valid context for both ReadOnly and Edit view states.
column151:
06/Apr/18 5:33 PM;bwinter;[~jmedlock], [~jcox], [~cleduc], based on today's stand-up and prior conversations with [~admin], I have created a ticket for stopping a user from being able to edit an order after it has been submitted.  I am not sure what all to put in here, so feel free to make changes to it including its priority, which is currently set to Critical.

I assigned to [~admin] so he can take it or delegate to another dev.  

In case, [~admin] has to make some drastic changes like not allow user to even navigate to the Edit Order page after an order is submitted, I created COMA-2514 as placeholder for a feature where a user could at least see a read-only view of the order in Colony after it has been placed.

All orders placed in Colony are at least visible from Quick Order.  However, until COMA-2464 is completed, users may not be able to match the sample GUID back to the original mouse.

column1: Fix Add to Cull List? when Assigning Genotypes
column34:
OrdersResultsItem > Test Results > Add to Cull List?

If a user selects mice to add to cull list from the test results view and hits the Assign Genotypes to Mice button, the add to cull list modal will appear correctly and the view refreshes, but genotypes will not be assigned to the samples (and view is not historical/read-only as would be expected).

This was tested and passed in COMA-2279, but has since regressed.
When hitting the Assign Genotypes to Mice button, genotypes should be assigned to mice once the add mice to cull list modal is saved. The results view should then be read-only.

Steps to reproduce:
1. place an order and simulate results through testing harness
2. view results in OrdersResultsItem
3. select a mouse/sample to add to cull list
4. hit Assign Genotypes to Mice button
5. Confirm list on modal
6. observe page refresh > navigate back to test results
7. observe results view is not read-only and genotypes can still be assigned
8. observe from mice list that genotypes were not assigned

column1: Add 'groupIds' parameter to /GetSyncPayload
column34:
Currently, the /v1/sync/GetSyncPayload only has 1 parameter: lastSync. This means that every sync operation must sync ALL groups that a user is a member of. This works perfectly fine for most users who are only part of several groups but we are now seeing some users who are part of many groups and their sync performance is degrading. With the addition of the 'groups' query parameter, the client application(s) will be able to sync specific groups and improve the sync experience.

# Add 'groupIds' query parameter to the /GetSyncPayload method
# Make sure 'groupIds' is optional
# Parse the 'groupIds' parameter as a comma-separated list of GUIDs
# In the absence of the 'groupIds' parameter, default to the current functionality, which is to first obtain a list of all groupIds the user is member of.
# It seems prudent to first make sure that the user is a member of the groups being requested.
# If the API call requests to fetch a groupId that the user is currently not a member of, I am okay with either an error (403) OR just ignore the offending groupId(s) and process the rest of the valid ones.

column1: Display Mosaic Genotypes
column34:
OrdersResultsItem > Test Results

In step 2 of the strain linking wizard, users can select the "mosaic" option, allowing impossible results to be genotyped as mosaic.

The Test Results view should display these genotypes as "mosaic" rather than "impossible" (current functionality).
column151:

This ticket may need more requirements and a decision on how exactly to handle mosaics.
Mosaic results were never part of initial results scope, but it came up today when I reported COMA-2501 to [~rwilliams], who probably needs to be in on this convo.
column152:

column153:
04/Apr/18 3:30 PM;jmedlock;[~jcox][~rwilliams][~qevans] I remember we added that as a last minute item to accommodate for the FL/EX condition that technically would allow more than 2 mutations to be detected depending on where in the animal the sample was collected.

I think what Quincy has above is accurate. For a mosaic option. The Mosaic text would display instead of impossible but only if they have marked the mutation as mosaic.

Rich, if you can give us insight into time frame, we can decide if this is critical for 1.1.
[~cleduc]
column154: 05/Apr/18 10:01 AM;rwilliams;[~jcox] [~jmedlock] [~cleduc] [~qevans] [~bkoch] The Results Engine and the Strain Linking pages are already coded to handle the Mosaic scenarios, therefore the only changes that need to be made are to the Order Results page. Basically the a result can return as Mosaic, Impossible, Inconclusive or the actual selected genotype. All of those are already handled on the Order Results page with the exception of Mosaic. On top of that, I don't think that the UI will be behaving much differently than it currently does for Impossible. So, based on all of that, I think this would be a quick hit to modify the Order Results page to make it handle Mosiac. Brad, do you agree with my assessment?
column155: 05/Apr/18 10:47 AM;bkoch;[~rwilliams], if this is returning a genotype as mosaic, then would I have to modify the results page?  I would think I am just grabbing whatever genotype ID you are sending back, is this not the case?
column156: 05/Apr/18 11:03 AM;rwilliams;[~bkoch] You are correct that the Engine returns Mosaic as the result string, so nothing may need to be changed there, otherwise you just need to treat a "IsMosaic" result just like a "IsImpossible" result. There is also the question about help text and whether it should be different from what is displayed for Impossible (or whether any help text should show for Mosaic). [~qevans], can you help us out with the help text for Mosaic?
column157:
05/Apr/18 3:31 PM;qevans;[~rwilliams] [~bkoch] the only issue I'd bring up with treating this like impossible, is that while "impossible" is shown in the results view, it does not assign a genotype. To my understanding, if mosaic is the genotype, it should actually apply that to the mouse. There may be more work around that part of it.
Also, if a user has selected the mosaic option, they wouldn't need a help text if they get that result back; they'd be perfectly aware of what a mosaic genotype meant. So I don't think anything additional is needed there.
[~jmedlock] [~jcox]
column158: 05/Apr/18 4:27 PM;rwilliams;[~jcox] [~jmedlock] [~cleduc] [~qevans] [~bkoch] Someone will have to decide what needs to be done. There is no way for us to automatically suggest or assign a genotype because the results do not translate into one of our results. My thoughts are that this would work just like impossible, where the user is able to manually assign genotypes if they want to. I'm not sure that there is much else that we can do.
column159:
05/Apr/18 5:02 PM;jmedlock;[~rwilliams][~qevans][~cleduc][~bkoch] Rich is correct the genotype structure does not allow for a string mosaic to be inserted. We would need to build a structure for mosaic now that we know it is a thing.

I see this as an advanced transgene option for mosaic genes. This would allow for different genotype possibilities for mosaic selected mutations.

Is that a big change? Sounds like it would be for this release.

I am going to get an answer from Nate regarding a solution for 1.1.

thanks,
column160:
05/Apr/18 7:52 PM;cleduc;[~rwilliams] [~jmedlock] [~qevans] [~bkoch]  Unless there is something I don't know about the percentage of mosaics genotyped by transnetyx (maybe increased due to crispr?) my guess is this is too rare a need for 1.1. When we have a few more users we can get the requirements and put something specific in a later version.   
If based on "mosaic" gene type / expectation and "impossible" results we can warn or label the result easily great. If not, we rely on the user to interpret "impossible" as a likely mosaic in that set of genotyping and look into it.
As it stands now, can the user get to the "impossible" raw data call themselves or do they have to call customer support?
column161: 05/Apr/18 8:01 PM;jmedlock;[~cleduc] I think you are spot on. It is likely rare and even in the cases it exists the user wasn't expecting it. The raw data can be downloaded from quick order of they are approved from CS already. We could likely add a note Mosaic for that mouse in 1.1 and move forward with a plan to implement later
column162: 05/Apr/18 8:13 PM;cleduc;That sounds good to me.
column163: 05/Apr/18 8:56 PM;rwilliams;[~jcox] [~jmedlock] [~cleduc] [~qevans] [~bkoch] So what is the verdict? What do we need to do for 1.1 for this ticket? It would be easy to report the mosaic and treat it just like an impossible result, which means no auto selection of a genotype, but the user can manually apply genotypes if they want or do nothing. Or, we can just hide the mosaic selection from the strain linking screens. Just let us know.
column164: 05/Apr/18 9:24 PM;jmedlock;[~rwilliams] do what you have in the above comment. Treat as impossible and the user can select.
column165: 05/Apr/18 9:26 PM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock]  Thanks!!  [~bkoch]  We have direction for this ticket.
column166: 06/Apr/18 7:22 AM;bkoch;[~jmedlock] [~rwilliams] [~cleduc], sounds good, but then what should we display for the help message?  The same as the impossible message?  Or say something similar but replace the impossible terminology with mosaic, like "Based on the genetics of this strain, Transnetyx suggests this allelic combination is a mosaic. Please contact customer service for more information regarding this genetic possibility."  Or do we want something different?
column167: 06/Apr/18 8:14 AM;cleduc;[~bkoch] [~rwilliams] [~jmedlock] that language looks great - thanks!
column168: 06/Apr/18 8:57 AM;bkoch;[~cleduc] [~jmedlock] [~rwilliams], cool, then which takes priority, the impossible message or mosaic message?  So if there is one genotype that is regular, one that is impossible, and one that is mosaic, which one shows up?  Impossible message?
column169: 06/Apr/18 9:17 AM;jcox;[~bkoch] [~jmedlock][~rwilliams] I will totally defer to [~cleduc] on this if her opinion differs, but my vote would be to display only the mosaic message if mosaic is present (super rare) and only display the impossible text if impossible is present but no mosaic present.
column171: 06/Apr/18 10:34 AM;bkoch;Cool, so Mosaic > Impossible > Inconclusive (multiple).  Will do, thanks!

column1: Fix Mosaic Genotypes on Strain Link Wizard Step 3
column34:
Strain > Link Wizard > Step 3

If the mosaic option is selected on step 2 of the linking wizard, step 3 will list most of the genotypes (for the mosaic gene) as "Mosaic" rather than their actual genotype.

column1: Order Results - Partially Completed and Omitted Samples
column34:
_As a user, I want to see partially completed results and omitted samples displayed the same way I'm used to them in QuickOrder._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Display "N/A" as the result for samples with partially completed results.
* Display "Omit" as the result for samples that were omitted.

Attached screenshot of how partially completed results are being handled.
column151: 06/Apr/18 7:46 AM;bkoch;[~jcox] [~jmedlock], Does this mean we should display the genotype result as inconclusive for omitted samples?  Or how do we want to handle the genotype generation/help text/etc. for the omitted and partially complete?
column152:
06/Apr/18 8:37 AM;jmedlock;[~bkoch] The genotype would not be selected at all. The help text for omitted can be nothing since the result is omit for that sample. The not run can just be help text "Order still in progress."

[~cleduc] If you have changes to this language please feel free to trump my responses :)


Thanks,
column153: 06/Apr/18 9:41 AM;cleduc;[~jmedlock] [~bkoch] Language looks fine to me
column154: 06/Apr/18 10:55 AM;bkoch;[~jmedlock] [~jcox], this is proving to be a bit difficult to distinguish between partially completed results and ones that were just not selected to be run, is this an important distinction?  I can definitely put the omit text in though.
column155:
06/Apr/18 11:15 AM;jmedlock;[~bkoch] [~jcox] Brad and I discussed. The difficult portion was determining the difference between probes that were intentionally left out and those that had not run yet.

For 1.1, our assumptions are these: If 1 or more probes on the sample have a result, show NOT RUN for the other probes. If 0 probes on the sample have a result, show N/A. All samples should contain at least 1 probe to be run, if they have 0 probes that were selected to be run (need to confirm if this can/should happen), then N/A will always be the default for samples with 0 probes run.

Omitted samples will have a result of Omit.

column1: Store enough data to reconstruct strain and probe linking information at the time of order creation
column34:
_As a user ordering genotyping, I want my orders to to be based on strain and probe linking information at the time of the order, so that if I change strain or probe linking later it does not affect orders in progress._

+Acceptance Criteria:+

* When a user creates an order, the user can edit the strain linking wizard at any stage or order status, and previous order are not affected by the change.
* A user can start an order > the order status can change to any status > the user at any point can edit the ordered strains linked probe/strain information > when the order is completed > the user goes to the genotype results > the user will see linked probes from the probe information at the time of the order was created

h1. Testers Take Note!!
I wanted to let you know what all changed to make sure you tested all of the functionality:
* We are now taking (and keeping) a snap shot of the strain/probe linking information at the time the order is created based on the existing strain probe linking setup
* I removed the strain/probe linking locking functionality that we added a couple weeks back because with this new snap shot we should no longer need to lock it
* The linking info snap shot is created when an order is created, however you should also understand that whenever strain/probe linking information is updated, the snap shot information is deleted for all orders in Incomplete status and therefore the next time the user opens any of those orders or submits them, it will get a new updated copy of the snap shot.
* After an order is out of Incomplete status, the linking snap shot information should remain as is for the life of the order
* The results view has been updated to only use the linking snap shot instead of the live linking data
* The results view has been updated to handle the "Y" probe and the "IsMosaic" scenarios.
* The Probe/Results columns on the Order Results view have been reordered so that the Y probe always appears first in the list of columns if present and the rest of the probes are order by Gene Name, Allele Name and then Mut/WT. After that, any duplicate probes are removed (shared WildType Probes). It is *+{color:red}important {color}+*to understand that the Columns will no longer match those in the testing harness

h1. Dev Notes

* When creating an order, add enough data into required tables so that Colony can reconstruct the strain/probe linking information at the time the order was submitted. 
* Change the Results view to use the strain/probe linking information from the order instead of from the current Colony Strain.  
* See [~rwilliams] comments in COMA-2474.

column1: Mice can be genotyped many times from only ONE biopsy
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Biopsied mice (or litter) only ONE time
# Added biopsied Mice to shopping cart 
# Started Order
# Go back to Mice List (or Litter List)
# Add those biopsied mice (or litter) with only ONE biopsy back to shopping cart
# No required action thrown to create new biopsy for mice -> {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen:

* I expected mice biopsies to be consumed\* once an order is started.
* For mice (litters) with one biopsy already used in a previous order, I expected the need-biopsy icon to be thrown under the required actions column in the shopping cart.
* I expected deleted orders to release biopsies to be available for future orders.

\*By consumed, I mean a biopsy is no longer available for new orders and new biopsies will need to be created for new orders.
column69: 13/Apr/18 6:25 PM;bwinter;PASSED - Creating second order on 1 biopsy for multiple mice created autosamples on first order - 2018-04-13 18_23_09-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/26655/PASSED+-+Creating+second+order+on+1+biopsy+for+multiple+mice+created+autosamples+on+first+order+-+2018-04-13+18_23_09-.png
column70: 13/Apr/18 6:18 PM;bwinter;PASSED - clicking save on second order with same biopsy creates AUTOSAMPLE in first order that originally has first biopsy - 2018-04-13 18_12_02-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/26654/PASSED+-+clicking+save+on+second+order+with+same+biopsy+creates+AUTOSAMPLE+in+first+order+that+originally+has+first+biopsy+-+2018-04-13+18_12_02-.png
column151:
29/Mar/18 10:23 AM;bwinter;[~jmedlock], [~jcox], [~cleduc], [~admin], please take a look at the description of this card to make sure that expected behavior of biopsies is handled correctly.  After discussing with [~admin], if we do not nail this behavior correctly, it could cause serious bugs.

The main requirements are captured in the "What I expected to happen" section.  I have also re-worded as Given-When-Then below.  Please make sure these agree with the bullets in "What I expected to happen" section.

+Scenario+: _Biopsies only available to one order at a time_
*Given* a user is placing a genotype order 
*When* a mouse or pup's biopsy is placed on an order (regardless of order status)
*Then* that biopsy is no longer available for future orders

+Scenario+: _Biopsies only available to one order at a time_
*Given* a user is placing a genotype order on a mouse who has a biopsy in a previous order
*When* a mouse or pup is placed in the shopping cart without a new biopsy
*Then* throw the neeeds-biopsy icon in the required actions column of the shopping cart
*And* do not allow that mice to be check-able for an order until a new biopsy is created.

+Scenario+: _Deleting an order_
*Given* a user has an order started
*When* the user deletes that order
*Then* all the biopsies in that order becomes available for new orders.

At the moment, orders can ONLY be DELETED if the order status is INCOMPLETE.  {color:#d04437}If the above third scenario (_Deleting an order_) is accepted AND if we ever change what status allows an order to be "deletable", then we will need to carefully consider how to handle releasing biopsies.{color}
column152:
02/Apr/18 8:20 AM;cleduc;This seems correct. 
There is a scenario where they could take two biopsies at once - send one to Tyx and the other their own lab for other testing but  as this is rare I think it is OK if in that case they are prompted as in the second scenario and a new biopsy task is created. Keeps it simple.
Question: What happens if when deleting the order they would also like to delete the biopsies - determined they are not usable, or they lost the plate etc.
column153:
09/Apr/18 1:13 PM;admin;[~bwinter]

This was corrected by implementing an automatic biopsy for mice that have had their only existing biopsy sample assigned to a wellplate. This functionality will likely be enhanced in future iterations.

For the MVP, the testable scenario is:
1. Add a mouse that has not been biopsied to the cart.
2. Biopsy the mouse and add it to an order, but do not assign the available sample to a well.
3. Add the mouse to the cart again.
4. Add the mouse to an order and assign its sample to a well, save the wellplate.
5. Open the previous order and confirm that an auto-generated biopsy now exists (preventing an error).
column154: 09/Apr/18 2:45 PM;bwinter;Ah!  Fantastic!  Thank you for elucidating the test case, [~admin].  I see now the error you were explaining to me the other day!

column1: Modify Impossible Result Help Text
column34:
OrdersResultsItem > Test Results 

When an impossible genotype is returned for a sample, the help text is currently worded to explain why the genotype is inconclusive.

For impossible genotypes, modify this text to reflect that no genotype is suggested by TYX because the probe result combination is impossible (rather than inconclusive).

Text to use:

“Based on the genetics of this strain, Transnetyx suggests this allelic combination is impossible rather than improbable. Please contact customer service for more information regarding this genetic possibility”
column151: 29/Mar/18 4:19 PM;jcox;[~bkoch] Added the text we want to use to the description above.
column152: 03/Apr/18 11:38 AM;bkoch;[~jcox], how do we want this to be displayed if we have impossible and inconclusive results in the same genotype?
column153:
03/Apr/18 2:37 PM;jcox;[~bkoch][~rwilliams][~ssandor] Great question.  I'm including Stephanie and Rich in this reply in case they can help clarify.

column1: Handle Retest Data in Results
column34:
_As a user, I need test results to work more intelligently with retest data so that my results are manageable._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* When a retest is run prior to assigning genotype to an order, then the user will always see the latest test results available.
* When genotype has been assigned to an order, do not show any more recent re-test results in Colony.  The user would need to go to QO to see more recent results, and then would need to manually update the genotype of any mice in Colony.
* Updated message on Test Results screen (see screenshot) tells users to see QO system for full test results.  "If  you have previously requested a retest of results, a full record of your test history can be found in QuickOrder."

+Nice-to-have+: _Not a requirement; up to dev to decide if it can be squeezed in_
* When a retest is run prior to assigning genotype to an order, show a notification of some sort that indicates the results shown are from a retest.  

h1. Notes

* Retests were not in scope for Colony 1.1 Release - Ordering and Results.
* Retests results are nonetheless being sent to Colony, so Colony needs a way to handle them in some way.
* When retests are sent, the results columns genotype results page does not handle them as expanded (see attached screenshot).
* This story is a minimum feature story just to resolve the issue above.
* COMA-2470 is  placeholder for a full feature story for handling retests.
* For Colony 1.1 Release
** there is no auto population of partial genotype results.
** when genotype has been assigned to an order, the results page for an order is "frozen" and the user can only read the page
** assigning genotyping happens for the entire order all at once and cannot be edited from the results page (but genotypes could be edited one-by-one by going to the mice.

column151:
26/Mar/18 11:04 AM;bwinter;[~cleduc], [~jmedlock], [~qevans]  This ticket describes how results from retests will be handled.  In a nutshell, here are the acceptance criteria:

* when genotype has been assigned, the genotype results page is frozen, and do not get any updates about retested results.
* when genotype has not yet been assigned, then the results page will show the most recent results.

This story is a minimum viable feature for handling retests.  COMA-2470 is a placeholder for a full-feature story of handling retests.

column152: 28/Mar/18 10:08 AM;bkoch;[~bwinter] , I agree we should handle this, but what would be the correct option? Locking mice that have an open order? Not displaying mice that have been deleted? I know this should never happen in a real world example because who would genotype a mouse then delete it before the results come back, but if they did Joe should we handle it?
column153: 28/Mar/18 10:09 AM;bwinter;[~bkoch]  Great questions!  Thank you!  [~jmedlock] can you provide clarity on how this should be handled and add [~mbender] and [~bkoch] to your reply?
column154:
28/Mar/18 10:28 AM;rwilliams;[~bwinter] [~bkoch] [~jmedlock] My opinion is that you don't lock the mouse. Also, as far as the display goes I don't know if it makes sense to actually allow for the assignment of genotypes on a deleted mouse therefore I would say that if this ticket is important enough that we lock that row so that genotypes can't be set and then put some indicator on the mouse showing that the mouse is dead. We do this current on the Mouse list by putting a black heart icon that has a white x on it beside the name of the mouse. Alternatively we could just show the dead mouse and allow the genotype to be applied. Might the customer want this for historic purposes? I am not sure what the implications might be for the second scenario because pretty much everything that we do on the server side automatically excludes deleted (and dead and transferred) mice. In fact, you may want to go ahead and account for those scenarios as well.
And, yes, I would assign this to Brad (unless he has a lot of heartburn about it ;)).
column155:
02/Apr/18 4:14 PM;cleduc;[~rwilliams], [~bkoch], [~bwinter], [~jmedlock] 
This may be a done deal but my two cents: I would warn the user if they are trying to DELETE a mouse with samples taken or offspring. If they want to continue with the delete then we need to know what to do regarding that associated data "delete associated litters and genotypes?" - and/or could display that data with a mouse deleted indicator as said above.  Delete indicates an error was made in either creating the mouse or naming it or an error is being made now in selecting it for delete (I've done the latter). 
For a mouse now Dead or Transferred, I would not do anything to up or downstream data and would not send an error. The data is still relevant, but if users have asked, I would indicate it's dead with an icon or popup maybe.
(I know I'm not on the ticket but I'm looking at every single one for release notes so ...  happy to talk about this with Brad or whoever doesn't have heartburn :P).
column156: 06/Apr/18 5:22 AM;bkoch;[~rwilliams] [~cleduc], I think I'll take your advice and not assign downstream data to dead or transferred mice, so I'll just exclude them from the results screen.  Thanks!
column157: 06/Apr/18 8:19 AM;cleduc;[~bkoch] [~rwilliams] Sorry - making sure of which way the stream is running...Dead or transferred mice do still need the genotype assigned.
column158: 06/Apr/18 8:28 AM;bkoch;[~cleduc], oh, ok, I'll keep them on the results screen then.
column159: 06/Apr/18 8:40 AM;rwilliams;[~cleduc] [~bkoch] We need to get some clear direction for this ticket. There is some confusion with it currently. First off, the ticket really is not about deleting mice and what to do in that scenario. If we need to change that then we need another ticket. I think we got off the rails with earlier comments and questions. So to get back to the reason this ticket was created in the first place, the issue is that when the user gets to the OrderResult page, if a mouse that the user sent a sample in to be tested was deleted (and probably same for transferred or marked dead as well) before the OrderResults came back, then the page throws an error. I am 99.999% sure that the reason for that is because on the server side, when we look up the mouse in the database to match to the sample in the order, we are not getting the mouse back because we are automatically filtering out mice with those statuses. So, I think the immediate fix for this ticket is to change the query for mice for the OrderResults page so that it doesn't exclude those mice in the query. I think you can allow for the assignment of the genotyoes as well without any issues, however, going forward, it may be difficult or impossible for the user to see that mouse or its applied genotypes because we so often filter out mice that are in these statuses. If we want/need to do more than this then I think we need additional tickets that specify those additional requirements.
column160:
06/Apr/18 9:47 AM;cleduc;[~rwilliams] [~bkoch] Thanks for bringing me back on the rails. I like your solution of removing the filter. Is more needed from me?

It is fine that the user needs to work a little harder to see genotypes of dead/transferred mice and certainly fine for deleted.
column161: 06/Apr/18 10:53 AM;rwilliams;[~cleduc] [~bkoch] Carrie, I think we are good on this ticket. Thanks for your help.

column1: Colony counts omitted AND controlled samples against number of control samples but QO does not -> mismatched order pricing between Colony and QO
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Started genotyping order
# Marked some samples as 
## control, 
## omit, and 
## control and omit
# Finalized well plate order
# Colony marked controlled AND omitted samples against count of free control samples, but QO did not <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
# -Colony charged a higher price for order than QO -<- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}{color:#14892c} [Functions As Expected] -cs{color}

h1. What I expected to happen:

I expected Colony and QO to compute the same price for the order.  I expected Colony not to count controlled AND omitted samples against the count of free control samples.
column69: 23/Mar/18 4:42 PM;bwinter;FAILED - Colony counts omitted and controlled samples against number of control samples, where QO does not - 2018-03-23 16_31_01-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/26393/FAILED+-+Colony+counts+omitted+and+controlled+samples+against+number+of+control+samples%2C+where+QO+does+not+-+2018-03-23+16_31_01-.png
column151:
07/Apr/18 3:05 PM;admin;[~bwinter] [~jmedlock] [~jadhikari]

As discussed Friday, this ticket exposes a difference in the way that Colony and QO are evaluating the number of used control samples for a strain. QO still performs this calculation per strain per order, Colony implements (the intended future behavior of QO) by calculating free samples across all orders of this strain.

Thus, a displayed pricing mismatch between the two systems will exist until QO is updated (Colony, in some cases, will appear to be more expensive when compared side by side since it's not granting free controls so liberally).

This will be classified as a known issue and "functions as expected".

Jwala has a good approach planned to solve this issue permanently, by converting the free control sample FR17 code to a standard user discount which acts exactly like all other discounts. 

In my estimation, this is a low risk issue (Custom Service manual intervention mitigates, when necessary).

So there wont be a good testable output, but we also shouldnt cancel the ticket. I'd move it along with this discussion and call it good.

column1: Strain editing is allowed even when order status is in {NotReceived, Received, InProgress, PartiallyCompleted, Completed}
column34:
h1. What happened

# Place order in any of these statuses:

column156:
28/Mar/18 2:51 PM;bwinter;[~rwilliams]  Thank you for bringing this up.  I apologize for the confusion.  I will need help from [~jmedlock] or [~admin] for help on answering your question.  

_I am adding bold emphasis below to make it easier to scan the highlights._

The Parent ticket - COMA-2323 -  for this rework states that *strains linking should NOT be editable* when an order is in one of these statuses:

* *NotReceived*
* *Received*
* *InProgress*
* _*ProbeArrived*_ \*
* *PartiallyCompleted*

*I accidentally added these 2 order status* to the description in this rework:

* Completed
* GenotypeAssigned

[~admin], [~jmedlock] Should we allow strains to be editable when an order status is in *Completed* status or *GenotypeAssigned* status?
_____________________________________________________________________

\* _*ProbeArrived*_ is not a status that an available status to send from the testing harness.  We will need to discuss with [~rjonakin] if that is something that needs to be tested.
column157:
29/Mar/18 11:03 AM;bwinter;[~jmedlock], [~admin], as you guys are working on getting feedback for this ticket, I wanted to mention that [~qevans] coincidentally messaged me today that editing strain linking, _while_ an order status is complete _but before_ genotypes are assigned, changes the results view on the gene results page.

Here is the trade-off as I understand it:

* If we *add completed* status to the list of order statuses that lock strain linking wizard, then linked strains with orders left in completed status will not be editable via strain linking wizard
* If we *do not add completed* status to the list of order statuses that the lock strain linking wizard, then a user could inadvertently change the results view for all orders of that strain with a completed order status.

column1: Add well plate ID validation
column34:
_As a user ordering genotyping, validate the well plate ID that I enter, so that my order can navigate through the ordering process without any unexpected errors or behavior._

+Acceptance Criteria+:

* Validate the string entered by the user for the well plate id at the well plate page.
* If string fails validation, give a concise yet informative red-growler-error-message of why validation failed.
* Throw validation error after user clicks Finalize Order button on the well plate page.
* Wellplate is invalid:
** if the wellplate does not exist in LIMS.
** if the wellplate Has Been previously used on another order that is finalized (Which includes completed by default), AND is not cancelled. (If an order is cancelled, the wellplate from that order is reusable).

h1. Notes to SQA

h2. Testing ideas

This ticket originated from some unexpected behavior occurring when placing orders in Colony.  After speaking with [~rjonakin], the observed behavior may be do to well plate ID.  Below are some additional tests to verify behavior.  If the tests below fail, contact [~bwinter] for further investigation.

* Verify validation and appropriate validation error messages
* Enter valid well plate ID > submit order in Colony > Verify that order status changes to "NotReceived" in Colony
* Start order in Colony > stop at pricing page (do NOT submit) > open order in QO > go to first step (with the well plate page) > verify that QO allows you past Step 1 with same well plate ID assigned in Colony

h1. DEV Notes

h2. Validation Criteria for well plate ID

* String must be -14- at most 15 characters
* First character must match element in this set -\{"T", "Q"\}- , {"T", "B", "E"}
* Remaining -13- 14 characters must be integers [0-9]

10/Apr/18 3:14 PM;bwinter;[~qevans], [~mbender],  Below are new requirements for Well Plate IDs:

[~rjonakin], [~admin], Let me know I am erring anywhere in the below requirements for well plate IDs.

+New Well Plate ID Requirements:+

* Must be 25 characters or less\* 
* Must start with B, E, T (case-sensitive)
* Remaining characters must be integer
* Must be assigned to group owner's QO account \*\*

\* To create well plate IDs longer than 15 characters, follow these instructions\*\*\*:

# Log into ORMA
# Click Shipping Tab
# Click Supply Requests from fly-out menu
# Make sure you are on the Supply Requests tab
# Enter your email into Start New Supply Request field just below the Supply Requests tab
# Enter FedEX Tracking #
# Select FedEx Packaging
# Select Well Plates from Supply drop-down
# Select number to send from # To Send drop-down
# Click Add to Shipment button
# Enter a bunch of well plate barcode numbers
# Click Fulfill Request

\*\* When the group owner is a member of an organization with a TAGCenter, the well plate ID could also be assigned to any user who is NOT the group owner but who has the role of Central Shipper for that organization.

\*\*\* Instructions saved at https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TSA/pages/441155611/How+to+Place+a+Genotyping+Order+in+Colony

column1: Orders started in Colony and completed in QO, do not update NotReceived order status in Colony
column151:
22/Mar/18 11:48 AM;bwinter;[~jcox], [~jmedlock], [~admin],  I added this bug to Colony and assigned it for 1.1 release.  However, it may not be likely that someone starts a order in Colony but completes it in QO.  So please feel free to move this bug ticket to another release.

The main risk at the moment, is if this ticket is not resolved, a user, who does start an order and Colony but completes in QO, will be allowed to place the same order again even though the order is already marked in QO.  This throws a hard YSOD error.  Confer with [~admin] if this will cause any other downstream effects.

[~jcox], if we decide to keep this ticket in 1.1 release, can you escalate the ticket to BACKLOG status?

column154:
04/Apr/18 11:38 AM;rjonakin;[~admin] [~jmedlock] [~bwinter] [~jcox]

Good catch on this error. I didn't think of this problem before, but reading this ticket I know exactly why this is not working.

The gist of it is QO and OM do not update the order status of "Not Received" thet same way it handles the updating of all other order statuses. Both apps just set the order to "Not Received" in the code that is tied to the Finalize button click event in both applications, instead of using the LabSupport method of updating like every other order status....

It will take me about a day (maybe a little less but more than half a day) to fix this in QO and OM.

Jim, do I need to tackle this issue asap?
column155:

Definitely a great catch.

21/Mar/18 3:41 PM;bwinter;[~rwilliams], [~admin], [~jmedlock], [~jcox],
 
* I created this card to record that Colony does not appear to correctly allow the creation of strains with Advanced Transgenes, which are those transgenes that have a WT probe associated with them.  
* I discovered this when trying to recreate transgene scenarios from Rich and Nates Spreadsheet for COMA-1836 in Colony 1.1: Ordering and Results.  
* I placed this ticket in Unplanned Release.

column152: 21/Mar/18 3:57 PM;rwilliams;[~bwinter] [~admin] [~jmedlock] It looks like it isn't right to me, but this part of the application was built a while back and tested and approved back then (and there were some wonky requirements as I recall). I don't know if there were reasons to not create those gene results or not, so I defer to [~jmedlock] on that. I hate to mention this, but if you edit a TG Adv Gene (gene card), the "Advanced" option doesn't seem to show that it is on - AND if you turn it on and save, it appears to duplicate some of the gene results. That may explain how to create the duplicates you see in your screen shot. Also, there was a conscious decision to not allow for Transgene Advanced Sex-Linked Y back then. I think Nate said it was extremely rare or that it didn't make much sense, I can't remember, but that was done on purpose at the time. I added a couple screen shots to show what GeneResults the application currently generates for Transgenes Advanced (not sex-linked) and for Transgene Advanced Sex-linked X just so it was clear on what is currently being generated versus what is expected.

I've created COMA-2471 to reflect the additional bug that Rich pointed out in a previous comment, where the Advanced option toggle can lead to duplicated results listing.
column158:
03/Apr/18 2:41 PM;bwinter;[~jmedlock], [~jcox], the testing passed for creating advanced transgenes.  Thanks, [~rwilliams].  I just wanted to mention, that creating sex-linked-Y advanced transgenes still has that feature where selecting the Y checkbox switches OFF the "Show Advanced Options" switch and changes sex-linked advanced transgene to sex-linked (simple) transgene.

 !CONCERNED - Colony will not let user create Advanced Transgenes sex-linked to Y chromosome - 2018-04-03 11_12_38-.png|thumbnail! 

One consequence of this is that we cannot technically test the Gene Results Engine for sex-linked-Y advanced transgene, which is a scenario in Rich and Nate's Possible Gene Results spreadsheet.

After discussing the background with Rich, it sounds like sex-linked-Y advanced transgenes is rare anyway, but I wanted to bring this up in case we wanted to create a future story about changing this in Colony.  If we do create a new story, let's add a note to SQA to test Gene Results Engine and possible reference this comment in this ticket.
column159: 03/Apr/18 2:47 PM;rwilliams;[~bwinter] [~jmedlock] [~jcox] Just to add... The original specification for Colony did not call for implementing the Transgene Advanced Y Sex-linked scenario. So nothing has changed, this was never implemented. From what I remember of my conversation with Nate, this scenario could happen, but it is very rare.
column160: 03/Apr/18 2:49 PM;jmedlock;[~bwinter] [~rwilliams] [~jcox] [~cleduc] that is because it was unintentionally left off. The requirements were there for MVP. Somehow we tested and passed the adv. Transgene y sex linked option without it being functional. It actually may have been an option at 1 point though and was removed in a bug.
column161:
03/Apr/18 2:54 PM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] I remember looking at the original spec and it was confusing at best. It was like the scenario was listed, but then when you went to look for the details there were none in the spec. Also, with the way that the UI works, it appears that it was designed to work that way. In other words, it doesn't look like it was an accident or a bug that caused it to work the way that it does.
The original spec is attached here:  [^Transgene Compilation.pdf] 
If you look through that document it has every scenario except for the TG Advanced Y Sex-linked.
CC: [~bwinter] [~jcox]
column162: 03/Apr/18 3:09 PM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] [~bwinter] [~jcox] [~cleduc] By the way, I don't know for sure, but I don't think it would take that much to add this scenario. All of the needed parts are already in place. The UI would have to modified to allow for it to be selected and then the backend would need to be checked to make sure that it would handle the creation of GeneResults appropriately and the edit screen for the Gene Card would need to checked to make sure that it would work as expected for this scenario as well. The Results Engine should already account for the scenario.
column163:
03/Apr/18 3:36 PM;cleduc;[~jmedlock][~rwilliams][~bwinter] 
I'm afraid this isn't helpful but I'm trying to catch up on this one. Straighten out my thinking...I'm guessing advanced isn't an option as actual Y linked will not be homozygous, unless an animal has two Y chromosomes.  We can have that Y linked gene inserted (transgene) on a different chromosome and therefore have a homozygous result but then it isn't actually Y chromosome linked anymore. If we insert it multiple times on the Y we wouldn't be looking at zygosity but at copy number... 
All that said, it is OK to give all functionality and let the user figure out what they want to call things.
column164:
03/Apr/18 3:53 PM;jmedlock;[~cleduc] [~rwilliams][~bwinter] Carrie i think it is very helpful, it puts the priority of fixing the y linked adv option into perspective. It literally is a very risk low case. Not something we will likely be asked to do very soon.

The bug currently exists and so we need another ticket to fix that bug down the road just so we cover all options.

Thanks!
column165: 04/Apr/18 9:46 AM;rwilliams;[~cleduc] Excellent comments! I knew there was something about this scenario that made it extremely rare, but I hadn't thought far enough through it. Thanks!!

column1: Display Y probe in Bulk Edit Probes when linked strain contains Y probe in QO
column34:
_As a user with a strain in QO that contains a Y probe, I want the Y probe to be a part of the probes available for bulk edit at the well plate page, so that I toggle Y probe ON/OFF for my order like I can with the other probes in my my linked strain._

+Acceptance Criteria+:

* -When QO strain contains Y probe, let user toggle ON/OFF the Y probe.-
* -Let Y probe be listed under a "gene" group with label name "Y chromosome"-
* -Let Target label say "Sex"-

 !Y-chromosome - 2018-03-20 15_13_36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Tech note:
* If the linked QO strain has a y probe at the time it was linked, the y probe id will be stored in the Strains table in the column: LinkedOrderManagerYProbeId

Design note: The Y probe is a strain level probe (as opposed to StrainGeneAllele level), and thus displaying it as a mutation isn't feasible from the code side. Instead, it will display as a probe only, and always first if it is present on the Strain level.
See attached image.

column1: Mouse ID Sorting
column34:
_As a user I need to be able to sort Mice based on Mouse ID and see results that make sense for both alpha and numeric._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* User is able to sort Mouse list on Mouse ID and the sort should use {alpha}{numeric} priority.

+Example+:
Currently the sort is purely alpha-based so sort order would look like:
1, 11, 2, 20, a1, a11, a2, etc.

That same list should sort:
1, 2, 11, 20, a1, a2, a11, etc.
column152: 22/May/18 4:22 PM;jjensen;[~rwilliams], nvm.  I done figured it out an' stuff.  Had to change the Aggregates section...d'oh!
column153:
23/May/18 8:07 AM;jjensen;On development, in Dev Group, after sorting with the new algorithm, the following can be observed:
 !Screen Shot 05-23-18 at 07.54 AM.PNG|thumbnail! 
This is the mice in "a whole new strain" strain, ordered by the Mouse Id column.  Note how "2sdf" is followed by "153".  This is due to the way the Mouse.Name values are split into numeric and string segments and then ordered.  Numerically, 153 follows 2, because the numeric values in front are ordered in a numeric fashion.  Likewise, 12343234234 follows 9961-2xxxxx, because 12343234234 is numerically greater than 9961, which is the first numerical segment of 9961-2xxxxx.

Please also note as shown in Ethan's New Strain, the way the ordering works with mouse names that begin with non-digits and then are followed by digits:
 !Screen Shot 05-23-18 at 08.04 AM.PNG|thumbnail! 
Here, "p512" follows "p54", as requested.
column154:
23/May/18 8:50 AM;jjensen;Only one spot found that seems odd, but explained by looking closely at the names:
 !Screen Shot 05-23-18 at 08.44 AM.PNG|thumbnail! 
This is from strain "JawalaTestStrain1".  The name "Jwala's Room Rack 1 Cage2 Mouse 4" comes before "Jwala's Room Rack1 Cage1 Mouse 2", when it _looks_ like it should be listed after.  But, it is the presence of the space character in "Jwala's Room Rack 1 Cage2 Mouse 4" after the word "Rack" which makes it sort earlier.

-So, the question is: should spaces be ignored?-

Edit:  Spaces should not be ignored.  The algorithm is correct.
column155:
29/May/18 8:26 AM;bwinter;[~cleduc], [~jcox], judging by the attached screen shots from [~jjensen], it looks like he NAILED this ticket!  Go Jim!  I plan to test when the Mice List gets fixed In QA.

In the mean time, I just wanted to give you a heads up that the requirements of this card state that user wants to be able to sort by mouse ID which implies the Mouse List.   After users see the Mouse List is sortable by Mouse ID, I imagine they will expect Mouse IDs to be sorted accordingly elsewhere in Colony.  However, everywhere else Mouse cards or List rows are sorted alphabetically "string-wise" instead of alphanumerically.

So I created COMA-2598 to list all the places in Colony where we could apply [~jjensen]'s alphanumeric sort method.  I placed it in *Unplanned*, but you may want to consider placing it in* Colony 1.2*.

CC: [~jmedlock]
column156: 29/May/18 8:55 AM;cleduc;[~bwinter] [~jjensen] [~jmedlock] [~admin] How much effort would it be to apply across all the areas? That will help know where to put the ticket.
column157:
29/May/18 4:33 PM;jjensen;[~bwinter], [~cleduc], [~jmedlock], [~admin]:  I spoke briefly with Bryan about this and mentioned then that "across all the areas" may include a significant effort, especially since the ordering is currently done specifically for the grid control on the Mouse List page.  There was some discussion around moving the sorting farther down the call chain, ideally at the SQL Server level.  Having the special character-numeric ordering done in SQL Server, however, is impossible without creating a special routine via C# code which can be called by the SQL Server engine (normally called a "CLR Assembly").

The bottom line is that an analysis must be done to determine the best location for code which can be shared, and I think no one currently has any idea of what the real impact would look like.

column1: Warn User of Duplicate Mouse ID
column34:
_As a user I need to know if I'm manually setting a Mouse ID to one that is already taken by a currently living mouse._

+Acceptance Criteria+:

* User is given a visual indicator/warning that they are setting a mouse to an ID that is already used.
* User is still able to save the mouse with the duplicate ID anyway.
* This affects Litter Workbench, Add Mouse (dashboard), Add Mouse (cage), Edit Mouse, -Mouse Import-

----
Technical Design
This should be a post save validation check and delivered with the POST response (We fully support duplicate mouse Id's already, no need to add ajax validation complexity). \-cs

column75: 25/Jun/18 2:57 PM;bwinter;PASSED - duplicate mouse id symbols in add mice modal - 2018-06-25 14_47_18-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/27069/PASSED+-+duplicate+mouse+id+symbols+in+add+mice+modal+-+2018-06-25+14_47_18-.png
column76: 25/Jun/18 2:57 PM;bwinter;PASSED - duplicate mouse symbols in add mice to cage modal - 2018-06-25 14_48_28-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/27071/PASSED+-+duplicate+mouse+symbols+in+add+mice+to+cage+modal+-+2018-06-25+14_48_28-.png
column151:
23/May/18 4:01 PM;jjensen;Problem:
Not enough information in ticket on how to handle messaging for multiple mice.  Refer to screenshot:
 !Screen Shot 05-23-18 at 03.55 PM.PNG|thumbnail! 
When the mice are added to the list on the bottom portion of the modal, there is no POST action, only data manipulation and display at the client layer.  Each mouse *could* be checked with a separate $.get call as they are added, or a singular message *could* be displayed after the Save(post) which would only say something to the effect that "some mice in the save operation have duplicate names".

Which, oh which one, is best?
column152:
30/May/18 8:50 AM;jjensen;Update: Mouse names in lists seem to be updated in batches.  Thus, the best solution in these cases is to $.get() a boolean indicator from the server.

Because mice names are entered in several places, a central script was chosen to house the $.get() function: MouseItemFunctions.js.  This script is bundled and then referenced in _Layout.cshtml, making it a great candidate for housing this kind of function.

column155:
13/Jun/18 2:00 PM;wwyatt;I started with the Add Mouse (dashboard) feature, and I was able to create and save two mice with the ID "1999" without a notification or warning. !2018-06-13_13-43-21.png|thumbnail!  !2018-06-13_13-46-13.png|thumbnail! 

Same results when using the Add Mouse (cage) feature. No notification.
 !2018-06-13_13-51-17.png|thumbnail! 

Also, no notifications in the Edit Mouse and Import Mouse features.

The Litter Workbench does not give a warning, but it will not update the information entered, instead returning to the original number.

column1: Fix Add Existing Mutation Drop-Down
column34:
Strain > Genotype Settings > Add Existing Mutation

After selecting an existing mutation to add, the drop-down will go blank and extend much longer than previous size. User can click out of drop-down and back in to return to expected drop-down options, but should be able to use the drop-down to select multiple mutations without it clearing.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Pick a strain and navigate to Genotype Settings
2. Choose Add Existing Mutation
3. From the drop-down, select a mutation
4. Verify drop-down blanks out and extends to bottom of screen

This is an issue in IE and Edge, but fine in Firefox and Chrome.
