column1: Y probe is not being ordered for strains that contain Y probe
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Created a QO strain including the _Y probe_.
# Linked QO strain to a strain in colony
# Placed samples in wells
# Y probe not shown to in bulk edit probes list, so user can toggle ON/OFF -> {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
# Submitted order
# Additional Y probe was not present on Pricing page -> {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
# Y probe not present in QO/ORMA order -> {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen:

When placing orders for strains that contain the Y probe, I expected 

* the Y probe to be available to toggle ON/OFF in the bulk edit probes list
* the Y probe to be charged for on the pricing page in Colony and 
* the Y probe to be ordered for testing in the order submitted to QO and ORMA
column69: 19/Mar/18 3:51 PM;bwinter;FAILED - Y probe not showing in bulk edit probes when linked QO strain contains Y probe - Y probe is not being ordered - 2018-03-19 15_42_05-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/26333/FAILED+-+Y+probe+not+showing+in+bulk+edit+probes+when+linked+QO+strain+contains+Y+probe+-+Y+probe+is+not+being+ordered+-+2018-03-19+15_42_05-.png
column70: 09/Apr/18 11:11 AM;bwinter;PASSED - Y probe is being ordered for strains with Y probe - 2018-04-09 11_06_57-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/26570/PASSED+-+Y+probe+is+being+ordered+for+strains+with+Y+probe+-+2018-04-09+11_06_57-.png
column151:
19/Mar/18 12:23 PM;qevans;[~bwinter] I would add to this ticket that the Y probe should be in the list of probes the user can toggle on/off (under Assay Options). That way the user can decide if they want the Y probe to run just like any of the other probes on the strain.
Also, this should probably only be for sex-linked genes that have a Y probe in the linked QO strain. We wouldn't want to automatically add a Y probe when it wasn't on the QO strain to start with. I don't know how often that would even happen even, but could be an edge case.
CC: [~admin]
column152:
20/Mar/18 3:32 PM;bwinter;[~qevans] I created a change request, COMA-2457, for adding Y probe to bulk edit probe list, so that user can toggle Y probe ON/OFF.  

I spoke with Nate yesterday (Mar 19), and he said strains with sex-linked genes may not necessarily need Y probe.  However, sex is necessary to determine a genotype for a sex linked gene.  Furthermore, strains may have Y probe added for situations where the mice's sex cannot be phenotypically identified, e.g., embryos.

In summary, it appears that if the QO strain includes the Y probe (whether or not the underlying gene is sex-linked), then the Y probe should be available for toggling ON/OFF.

I am still new to all this, does this make sense?  Let's discuss more if I have misunderstood your comment above or if I am misunderstanding the use of Y probe.

column1: Multiple well plate orders made in Colony are being consolidated to 1 well plate in QO
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Create a genotype order
# Add well plates to genotype order
# Spread sample placement across multiple well plates

column1: Cage Grid # Not Visible On Cage Map (Once Cages Are Added)
column34:
This appears to be regression from the latest QA push, specifically COMA-2385.

When a user goes to view the cage map, the cage grid numbers i.e. 1A 2B 3C etc., are not visible once a cage has been added.

column1: Remove Parent Mice from Breeding when the Breeding is Deleted
column34:
Current on the web interface when a Breeding is deleted, if any mice were associated with that breeding they are not also being disassociated (Soft Deleted) from the Breeding.  This is affecting the iOS app as it is now able to handle that process correctly but the app is syncing down data that was handled incorrectly by the web interface.

How it should work:
+Scenario+:
*Given* I am deleting a breeding that has parents but no litters
*When* The breeding record is removed / marked-as removed
*Then* The association between the parent mice and the breeding should also be removed
*And* The Offspring Settings for the breeding should be removed
*And* If the parent mice are not a member of any other breedings, then their Use should be set to Available

We will also need a SQL script written+executed to fix the Mice records in the DB that are set to an incorrect Use value due to this bug.  Per [~jmedlock] the logic should be:

IF Mouse Use = Breeding 
    AND all Breedings for that mouse have been soft deleted
    OR mouse is dead
    OR mouse is transferred
THEN set Use = Available
column69: 29/Mar/18 6:17 PM;bwinter;PASSED - remove parent mice from breeding when breeding is deleted - 2018-03-29 18_13_08-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/26483/PASSED+-+remove+parent+mice+from+breeding+when+breeding+is+deleted+-+2018-03-29+18_13_08-.png
column151:
14/Mar/18 9:56 AM;jcox;[~bkoch], could you look at handling the fix to the Breeding wizard for this issue?  [~jmedlock] suggested that [~rwilliams] could possibly help as needed with the SQL to fix existing data where Mouse Use is set incorrectly.

Please let me and/or [~fdobjenschi] know if there are any questions or issues with this and we'll help clarify.
column152:
14/Mar/18 12:08 PM;fdobjenschi;Sounds ok for me. [~tposchel] can you take a peek ?.
Only one thing when the script is executed on all entities affected by this the date modified should be updated in this way all changes will be processed by the mobile app at next sync.
column153: 14/Mar/18 12:26 PM;tposchel; I would be explicit that the “BreedingParent” records should be soft-deleted when the Breeding is soft-deleted. We also need a one-time SQL script to soft-delete any BreedingParent records whose associated Breeding is already soft-deleted and ensure that either the dateDeleted or dateModified is set to DateTime.Now on those BreedingParent records.
column154: 14/Mar/18 2:53 PM;bkoch;[~jcox], is there a reason you removed me from this ticket?  I can definitely do it yet today most likely if needed.
column155: 14/Mar/18 3:26 PM;jcox;[~bkoch], Sorry that was a complete accident.  I must have accidentally hit the "assign to me" link without noticing.  Just sent it back to you.
column156:
29/Mar/18 6:22 PM;bwinter;[~jcox], [~jmedlock], [~bkoch], Some of this ticket appears to be untestable.  I have passed it based on what I was able to observe.  See attached screen shot.  For full disclosure, here is what I tested:

* When breeding is deleted, mice not in another breeding has use = Available.
* When breeding is deleted, mice in another breeding has use = Breeding.

These two acceptance criteria appear to me to be untestable from the UI:

* *Then* The association between the parent mice and the breeding should also be removed
* *And* The Offspring Settings for the breeding should be removed

Please let me know if you disagree.  I am open to other suggestions about testing this ticket further.

column156:
06/Apr/18 10:27 AM;admin;>I expected the timezone for the newly created group to be (UTC-06:00) Central Time (US & Canada) instead of UTC-12:00.

This ticket is predicated on a flawed expectation. Auto-detection of browser timezone is notoriously flawed and not a good practice for web applications. We shouldn't spend time on this.

column1: Sync iOS and Web counts
column34:
Reported by [~jmedlock]:
We still have 2 potential problems with counts of active/alive mice/litters. We almost have this!!!

Staging environment/Bush group

In the web, 326 mice are reported alive on dashboard and list. The counts on the strain cards state 327. iOS states 327. The total mouse count for bush group in staging is 906 (matches iOS list). The database says 906 total. The mouse list in web states with 0 filters, 900 mice.

Staging environment/Sandbox group

The iOS shows Litter 20 has 18 pups, 7 dead, 11 missing. 2 male, 2 female. The male and female mice are marked dead or missing but the iOS counts this litter as active. The web does not. The number of mice dead or missing = the total born, this litter should not be active.

column159:
19/Jun/18 4:33 PM;cleduc;[~bwinter] UCSF sees different counts in dashboard mice in cage graph vs. cage page filter on 6+ mice. 
Do you see this as fixed in staging? 

Here is their recent statement and then the steps. Confirmed this is still an issue. Using the exact same steps I looked at the data for the Wilkerson group and it doesn't match up either. The dashboard is showing 7 cages with 6+ mice, while I could only find 1 on the cage map. My guess would be that cages containing pups over a certain age (21 or 28 days) are throwing the data off from the dashboard. Criteria for what constitutes an adult mouse should be the same on the dashboard and cage map. 

Steps:
from Dashboard, within "cages" red box...hold mouse over one of the bars in the "mice in cage" graph...I see "6+ mice (9)"...which I understand to mean I have 9 cages containing 6+ mice. I want to see information about these cages, so I click on the cage tab at the top. Firstly I can only see my cages one rack at a time. So I filter the first rack to see cages containing 6+ mice, and I see one cage come up. i select a second rack...I have to reset the filter for 6+ mice, 0 cages come up. I select my third rack, reset the filter for 6+ mice, and 3 cages come up. Total of cages with 6+ mice=4. Where is the 9 coming from from the dashboard??

column1: CLONE - Shopping Cart Item Count Does Not Update In Real Time (When starting with an empty cart)
column34:
When a user goes to add a sample to the cart via the litter/mice list, the item number count does not update in real time if they have no other items in the cart at the time.

If there is at least 1 item in the cart then the item count updates in real time. This does not occur when the first item is added to an empty cart.

Steps to recreate:
1. Clear cart of all items.
2. Navigate to the mice/litter list.
3. Add a sample to the cart.
4. User will not see the cart icon change, no numbers present.
5. Hard refresh the page and the icon has changed with the respective number of samples added.
6. If user adds another sample the icon will begin to update in real time.

*Dev Notes:*
* Added some jquery code to the layout and header to act on all ajax calls and automatically update the cart count; fixed the cart page  in cart total so that it updated as you removed items from the cart;
* Reworked the get cart items to reduce some of the database calls and to reuse calls that where previously modified to remove dead/deleted/transferred mice and litters from the shopping cart
* Consolidated code - reused the GetCartCount method from the header on the call that also updates the count on the header; Updated the GetCartCount method to reuse the GetLitters and GetMice calls that were already eliminateing the dead/deleted/transferred mice and litters

column1: Colony to OrderManager Order Record data issues
column34:
h1. What happened

# Successfully submitted an order
# Opened ORMA
# Found order in ORMA (using well plate id)
# Marked order as received in ORMA
# Order status in Colony said "Not Received" while ORMA said "Received"

h1. What I expected to happen

I expected orders in ORMA marked as Received to show same order status in Colony


h2. *+Technical Dev Task+*

To fix this issue:
* Wire up Colony Order submit button to send orders to Lims and save the Lims OrderId to the OM order record.
* This will fix or enable the OM to Colony status communication, and the OM to Colony results propagation.
column39: Marking orders as received in ORMA is now marking orders as received in Colony.  Thanks [~rjonakin].  This test has been confirmed by [~jmedlock], [~qevans], [~mbender], and [~rjonakin].  Thanks guys!;22/Mar/18 11:08 PM;bwinter;300
column69: 05/Mar/18 1:05 PM;bwinter;Order status in Colony not the same in ORMA - 2018-03-05 12_56_00-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/26144/Order+status+in+Colony+not+the+same+in+ORMA+-+2018-03-05+12_56_00-.png
column151:
05/Mar/18 2:58 PM;bwinter;[~admin], I was speaking with [~jadhikari], and she discovered that my account did not have a billing and shipping address selected by default.  For some reason, this information is needed to generate a LIMS Order ID.  

Until I manually added a default address in QO on QA2, none of my orders submitted via Colony had a LIMS Order ID.  An order not having a LIMS Order ID is somehow related to throwing YSOD whenever one clicks the view order button from ORMA.  New orders placed in Colony since selecting default billing and shipping addresses are now showing order details (instead of YSOD) when clicking the blue view order button.  However, orders placed before selected default billing and shipping addresses are still showing YSOD when clicking the blue view order order, presumably because the LIMS Order ID was never created for these past orders.

I see your account has an order in ORMA QA2 for well plate C2005000, which is also throwing YSOD when clicking the blue view order button.  I imagine future orders will be fixed after selecting default billing and shipping addresses in QO QA2.

I am not sure if this issue will happen in STAGING/PROD or not.
column152:
08/Mar/18 10:01 AM;admin;[~rjonakin]
I think this is a side effect of what we've been looking at / talking about the last couple days. Dig in and see where CM is dropping the ball on inserting well-formed data.
column153:
09/Mar/18 1:51 PM;rjonakin;[~admin]

You are correct. This is a side effect of NOT having a LimsOrderId. Status updates are done through Labsupport and that works off the LimsOrderId for finding orders, and that value is null for colony orders currently. So there is not a correct order status update happening in the background.
column154: 22/Mar/18 11:08 PM;bwinter;Marking orders as received in ORMA is now marking orders as received in Colony.  Thanks [~rjonakin].  This test has been confirmed by [~jmedlock], [~qevans], [~mbender], and [~rjonakin].  Thanks guys!

column1: Show mice marked dead (or transferred) in sample list when mice are marked dead (or transferred) after order placed
column34:
_As a user who has already started a genotyping order, I want to see all the mice in the sample list even if I have marked them dead or transferred them after starting an order._

_As a user who has already started a genotyping order then marked some mice as dead, I want to be able to distinguish the alive mice from the dead ones and transferred ones, so that I can know which is which._

+Acceptance Criteria:+

* When an order is started and some mice in the order have been marked dead, continue to show all mice in the sample list (alive, dead, and transferred).
* Show mice marked dead with a black-heart-with-x symbol next to Mouse ID _similar to mice marked dead in the Mice List_. 
* Add tool tip to black-heart-with-x symbol that reads "This mouse is dead".
* Show mice transferred with black-right-arrow next to Mouse ID
* Add tool tip to black-right-arrow symbol that reads "This mouse was transferred".

*Dev Notes*
* I went ahead and added an icon and hover text for deleted mice as well even though it wasn't called out because we decided that even if a mouse was deleted, that if it was in the order that we would leave it in the order. See the attached images to see the different icons and tool tips

column151: 06/Mar/18 9:56 AM;rwilliams;[~admin] I'm going to take this ticket if that is ok.
column152: 07/Mar/18 3:12 PM;rwilliams;[~bwinter] [~jmedlock] I'm still looking at the Cart/Orders screen dealing with the mice count (which is off when there are dead/deleted/transferred mice). I think in our initial conversation that we concluded that while litters and mice are in the cart, we don't want to see (include) deleted or dead or transferred mice. For example, if a user adds a litter of 2 to the cart and then weans one mouse and marks the other one dead, when you then look at the cart the cart only shows one weaned alive mouse - correct? However, once the user adds the litter/mouse to an order, if that mouse gets marked as dead or transferred we still want to show it in the mouse/sample counts and as part of the order and even the sample on the well plate - Correct? Lastly, what happens to mice that are deleted after they are added the order? Does it disappear from the order and the well plate? Or do we leave it on there? Last we talked I think we were saying that if a mouse was deleted we would want it to go away, however, I think that makes things messy on the order as things will automagically disappear, even from the well plate. So, after thinking through this and talking to [~mbender] about it, I think we need to just leave the order/samples alone (meaning that we do not filter out mice that were added to an order but have since been marked as dead, deleted, or transferred). If the user deletes, marks dead, or transfers a mouse after it is in an order then they will have to manually not exclude that mouse sample from the well plate if they don't want to pay for it. Thanks for listening to me think this through. Let me know your thoughts.
column153:
07/Mar/18 4:02 PM;jmedlock;[~rwilliams] I did not read all of that. 

The short response is that users may want to genotype animals that got marked dead, transferred, or went missing after they were clipped.

We need to handle mice and samples differently, if mice went missing/died before clipping, we cant genotype them, we need to handle that also from the litter standpoint.

[~cleduc] I may be unfairly bring Carrie into this conversation but who said software development was fair. Carrie anything to add here.
column154: 07/Mar/18 4:10 PM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] [~bwinter] It makes sense that we should handle samples and mice separately, The issue though is that the user is adding mice to the cart, not samples. I already worked on another ticket last week that then led to this ticket this week because as it turns out, when you add an unweaned litter to the cart and then wean the litter and mark some of those mice as dead, the dead mice do not get IDs and because of that, the litter gets stuck with the required action of "needing to be IDed". To fix that, last week I just excluded all deleted, dead and transferred mice from the cart.
column155: 07/Mar/18 6:15 PM;jmedlock;[~rwilliams] sounds like u got it under control
column156: 09/Mar/18 9:43 AM;cleduc;I missed the party on this one but it seems all worked out. My two cents: if the sample is in the plate/order and then the mouse is marked dead, we leave it on the order. This is because the info on the genotype of the mouse may still be relevant to the user - most especially if the animals are sampled at 2 weeks but don't make it to wean and it is a certain genotype not making it. They can make the determination to omit it if they want. For new plates/orders I think it is good to have the dead mice not show. There are use cases where we genotype tissue saved from a dead mouse. We do need to create a sample from a dead mouse but that process is not the norm.
column157: 09/Mar/18 10:30 AM;rwilliams;[~cleduc] Thanks for your input. I think we made the right decisions at this point and we will modify for other scenarios as they become needed.
column158: 12/Mar/18 4:05 PM;bwinter;Great solution [~rwilliams]!  Works perfect!

column1: Sync API not returning all GeneResults
column34:
Jim: Several strains clicking from the mouse list then mouse record the add/edit genotype option crashes QA version. It's the same Strains
Tyler: Florin investigated further for me and I have confirmed. As a user who is part of the SANDBOX group, when performing a sync, 6 MouseGeneResult entries are returned whose corresponding GeneResultId == ‘976C1BC9-0F73-414C-9E94-1A900A3817E8’. However, the sync payload does NOT include an actual GeneResult object whose GeneResultId matches. I confirmed that in the QA database there is in fact a GeneResult that matches and is part of the same group and is not deleted so I do not see any reason why it would be excluded from the payload but somehow it is being excluded.
The sync is not sending ALL the GeneResults for that Group and I don’t know why. I’m fairly confident it doesn’t have anything to do with the actual strain.
* Group > Genes/Alleles/GeneResult (issue is here)
* Group > Strains > StrainGenes/StrainGeneAllele

column1: Unable To Add Samples To An Existing Order
column34:
When attempting to add a sample from the shopping cart to an existing order, nothing happens.

Steps To Recreate:
1. Add 2 samples to shopping cart.
2. Start a new order with one sample.
3. Return to shopping cart and select the other sample.
4. Select the new order in the "Add to existing order : " drop-down.
5. Click on the "ADD" button to add sample to that order.
6. Nothing occurs when the button is clicked, it should have added the sample to the selected order.

column1: Available Probes Not Selected By Default
column34:
When a user is in the Wellplate UI in the Assay Options, the available probes for that sample should be selected by default.

Steps To Recreate:
1. Add a litter/mouse to cart.
2. Start a new order.
3. Drag samples to Wellplate.
4. Open the Assay Options by clicking the gear icon.
5. You will see the available probes at the bottom, which are not checked.

column1: CLONE - ID Required Action in shopping cart does not go away when litter has dead or missing pups
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Create a new litter from a breeding with a linked strain
# Add created litter to shopping cart -> shopping cart displays 2 required actions ID and biopsy
# Click ID or biopsy icon from the shopping cart -> user redirected to litter workbench
# Select some of the pups as *missing* or *dead*.
# Click Save and Generate
# ID and biopsy pups -> *missing* and *dead* pups will not be ID'd, which works as expected
# Click Save
# Go back to shopping cart
# Litter still has ID icon listed as a required action for the litter
# Genotyping order cannot be placed for litter even though litter has been ID'd and biopsied.

h1. What I expected to happen:

I expected that after I ID'd and biopsied the litter, I would be able to place an order.

h1. Note

This behavior does not happen when following the steps above with a litter that has no missing pups or dead pups.

*DEV Note*
* It appears that the work done in COMA-2390 fixed this issue.

column1: Biopsy/Id counts and filters: Dashboard count and list filter when navigating to litters list
column34:
_As a user I need the biopsy/ID count on the dashboard and litters list filter to accurate describe what actions have completed on litters_

*Acceptance Criteria*:
* The dashboard biopsy/ID count should not eliminate litters that were weaned and not biopsied
* If all the pups are dead or missing in a litter that needed biopsy, this litter should not be included in the count or show on the filtered list.

NOTES:
The iOS does this already so we need to match what is happening there for "counts" consistency.
The user needs to know which actions were performed on a litter at a glance. Currently the web removes litters that were weaned from the active count and so allows users to "skip" the biopsy step.
Users should be able to wean and biopsy a litter at any time.

*Dev Notes:*
* Existing logic for biopsy count: Count of litters where (litterIsActive & NotBiopsied & BiopsyNeeded)
** litterIsActive logic: NotDeleted & NotWeaned & HasLivingOffspring
* New logic for biopsy count: Count of litters where (litterNotDeleted & HasLivingOffspring & NotBiopsied & BiopsyNeeded)

column1: Display age in weeks when older than 28 days for Dashboard Bar Chart Tooltips
column34:
_As a user, I want to see *bar chart tooltips'* mouse age, litter age, and breeding time ("age") in days until the 29 day, then from 29 days and beyond, I want to see them in weeks, so that I see age in terms of how we normally talk about them when managing the colony._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* The Tooltips that display over bar charts on the Dashboard display time in weeks once they represent an item over 28 days in age.
 !barcharttooltip.JPG|thumbnail!
column151: 21/May/18 2:17 PM;jjensen;[~cleduc] and I spoke about the details in this story and a few changes were made.  First, since Litters should not age beyond 28 days, the current 5-day groupings were left untouched.  Second, we thought it best to have the first aging label for Mice and Breedings to say "0-27 days".  The next categories would then say "4-7 weeks", "8-11 weeks", "12-15 weeks", and finally "16+ weeks".  The function which breaks these numbers down-{{ColonyManager.Core.Business.GroupService.GetDashboardData()}}-was altered to represent these exact week values.

column1: Prompt User To Confirm Deleting A Mouse/Litter if the Mouse/Litter Is Already In Cart
column34:
How it is now:

A user deletes a litter or mouse from Colony, even when that mouse/litter is in the shopping cart/orders lists. 
Which then throws a hard error if you try to validate that mouse/litter.

The Change:

When a user tries to delete a mouse/litter from Colony, warn the user that this mouse/litter is in the cart and will removed there as well if deleted.

*Steps To Recreate*:
1. Add a litter or mouse to cart that has not been ID/Biopsied.
2. Delete the litter/mouse from Colony.
3. Back to shopping cart and click the biopsy icon next to sample.
4. You will receive a hard error. See track trace below.

column1: Change name of "Linked Gene(s)" tab and "Linked Strain(s)" tab in Edit Gene Mutations Modal
column34:
_As a user, I need the wording in the Edit Gene Mutations modal to be as accurate as possible so that I don't make mistakes while confused._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* The "Linked Gene(s)" and "Linked Strain(s)" tabs should be renamed "Gene(s)" and "Strain(s)", respectively.
* Just remove the word "Linked" as it causes confusion around linking data between Colony and QO.

column151:
23/Feb/18 9:40 AM;bwinter;[~cleduc], [~jmedlock], [~nnowak] 

*May need to re-label two tabs*

Now that Colony allows the user to link strains in QuickOrder to strains in Colony, there is a modal accessible from the Gene Mutations list that has two tabs whose labels may need to be changed so not to cause confusion with this new idea of "linking" strains between Colony and QuickOrder.

*Screenshot*

!change name of linked strains tab in Edit Gene Mutations Modal - 2018-02-23 09_09_42-Allele List.png|thumbnail! 

*Labels that may need re-labeling*

The two labels in question are

* *Linked Gene(s)* tab - _lists details about the gene(s) in Colony that contain the mutation_
* *Linked Strain(s)* tab - _lists the strains in Colony that contain this mutation_

*Example of possible confusion*

One example that comes to mind is the user somehow thinking this modal as confirmation that strains have been linked.

*Question*

Can you provide some suggestions for new labels for these two tabs?

column154: 14/Mar/18 2:27 PM;jcox;Just updated the requirements on this to reflect that we just want to remove the word "Linked" from those tabs, and put the ticket in the Backlog (attn: [~admin]).

column1: Strains without orders are being locked from strain linking
column34:
h1. What happened:

+Scenario+: _Linking locked for NEW strains_

# Created new strain
# Add mutations to strain
# Tried to link strain, but {color:#d04437}strain linking locked{color}

+Scenario+: _Linking locked for OLD strains with NO ORDERS_

# Went to previously created strain with no orders (or even mice)
# Tried to link strain, but {color:#d04437}strain linking locked{color}

h1. What I expected to happen

column1: Currency Codes Not Changing For International Users
column34:
When a user has a default billing address outside of the US i.e. AUS and they have the same countries pricing list in Quick Order the total in Colony is still showing USD.

This should only show USD when they have a US price list and a non US billing address.

Steps to recreate:

1. In quick order set your default billing address to Australia.
2. In quick order associate a AUS price list to the user account.
3. Add an order to the cart in Colony.
4. Submit and finalize the order.
5. You will see the total is in USD not AUS as it should be.
column151:
01/Mar/18 10:26 AM;mbender;Failed on Colony QA1 / Order Manager QA2

Same issue as before. 

When a user has a billing address AND a price list from another country the total should show in their respective currencies. 

I.E. if a user has a billing address with a Australian country code and an Australian price list in Quick Order, the totals in Colony should show AUS not USD.

column1: Bulk marking samples as control not marking samples as control in well plate
column34:
h1. What happened:

+Scenario+: _Bulk mark control when only SOME samples from strain in well plate_
# Placed a genotyping order
# {color:#205081}Add some (but not all) samples from strain to well plate{color}
# Click bulk mark control samples in a strain
# {color:#d04437}Samples added to well plate are not marked as control{color}
# Finalize order
# Click continue on unassigned samples prompt
# {color:#d04437}Samples marked as control in sample list are being charged at pricing page{color}

+Scenario+: _Bulk mark control when ALL samples from strain in well plate_
# Placed a genotyping order
# {color:#205081}Add ALL samples from strain to well plate{color}
# Click bulk mark control samples in a strain
# {color:#d04437}Samples added to well plate are not marked as control{color}
# Finalize order
# {color:#d04437}Samples marked as control in sample list are being charged at pricing page{color}

+Scenario+: _Bulk mark control, Save, then refresh well plate page_
# Place genotype order
# Add (some or all) samples from strain to well plate
# Bulk mark control samples in a strain
# Save well plate
# Refresh page
# {color:#d04437}Samples saved as control in samples list are no longer marked control{color}
# When marking samples as control one-by-one, controls are saved after clicking save then refresh.

h1. What I expected to happen:

* I expected samples marked as control in samples list to be marked as control in well plate.
* When saving a well plate, I expect samples bulk marked as control to be saved as controlled after refresh.

column1: ID Required Action in shopping cart does not go away when litter has dead or missing pups
column34:
h1. What happened:

# Create a new litter from a breeding with a linked strain
# Add created litter to shopping cart -> shopping cart displays 2 required actions ID and biopsy
# Click ID or biopsy icon from the shopping cart -> user redirected to litter workbench
# Select some of the pups as *missing* or *dead*.
# Click Save and Generate
# ID and biopsy pups -> *missing* and *dead* pups will not be ID'd, which works as expected
# Click Save
# Go back to shopping cart
# Litter still has ID icon listed as a required action for the litter
# Genotyping order cannot be placed for litter even though litter has been ID'd and biopsied.

h1. What I expected to happen:

I expected that after I ID'd and biopsied the litter, I would be able to place an order.

h1. Note

This behavior does not happen when following the steps above with a litter that has no missing pups or dead pups.

*DEV Note*
* It appears that the work done in COMA-2390 fixed this issue.

column1: Strain Dashboard Cage Count Not Accounting For Transfers
column34:
When a user transfers a mouse from a cage, the cage count on the strain dashboard does not reflect that. *Only* occurs if there is only 1 mouse with that particular strain in the cage.

Steps To Recreate:
1. Choose a strain from the dashboard.
2. Navigate to the cage map and select any rack.
3. Select a cage that does not have a mouse with the selected strain.
4. Add a mouse to that cage with the selected strain.
5. Navigate to the mice list and click edit on the mouse you added.
5. Edit the mouse by adding a transfer date and save.
6. Navigate back to the dashboard and cage count will be the same.
7. Navigate to the strain dashboard page and the cage count will be +1 of the actual count shown on the main dashboard.

column1: User Display Name (Feature Rewrite)
column34:
The user display name HTML element that is populated server side is part of the header partial which itself is an element of the master site layout.
There are known scenarios where IIS will predictively cache layout elements unless manually prevented in its configuration.

Instead of trying to investigate and prevent that behavior, we will instead remove the Razor templating around the display name in the header partial and re-implement that functionality into a Document.Ready Ajax call in the layout template proper.

Acceptance Criteria:
* Remove the server side Razor template for current user display name
* Create a discrete Controller action and Ajax call to provide the user name data post render and apply it to the appropriate element values late. This should side step any server caching issue.

column1: Shopping Cart Item Count Does Not Update In Real Time (When starting with an empty cart)
column34:
When a user goes to add a sample to the cart via the litter/mice list, the item number count does not update in real time if they have no other items in the cart at the time.

If there is at least 1 item in the cart then the item count updates in real time. This does not occur when the first item is added to an empty cart.

Steps to recreate:
1. Clear cart of all items.
2. Navigate to the mice/litter list.
3. Add a sample to the cart.
4. User will not see the cart icon change, no numbers present.
5. Hard refresh the page and the icon has changed with the respective number of samples added.
6. If user adds another sample the icon will begin to update in real time.

*Dev Notes:*
* Added some jquery code to the layout and header to act on all ajax calls and automatically update the cart count; fixed the cart page  in cart total so that it updated as you removed items from the cart;
* Reworked the get cart items to reduce some of the database calls and to reuse calls that where previously modified to remove dead/deleted/transferred mice and litters from the shopping cart
* Consolidated code - reused the GetCartCount method from the header on the call that also updates the count on the header; Updated the GetCartCount method to reuse the GetLitters and GetMice calls that were already eliminateing the dead/deleted/transferred mice and litters

column34:

# Add it to shopping cart

# Select Probe Edit gear from well plate

column39:
SQA Notes:

* This ticket passed for the reason of the original rework: target switches were ON but probes were unchecked.
* [~admin] mentions that his changes would not affect past order but would affect orders made after his code was merged.
* The test for this ticket checks that code is working as expected as of Mar 22, 2018.

column1: Significant Latency When Saving A New Mutation
column34:
When saving a new mutation to a strain there is considerable latency once hitting "Save".

This appears to be regression from 1.1 as this does not occur in Production or Staging, only QA.

*Benchmarks:
Production: 1.63 sec
QA1: 60 sec
Staging: 2.14 sec*

****See screenshots for additional info.****
column145:
Steps to recreate:
NOTE: this seems to be an issue on the QA-Automation group only so far...
1. Open any strain from the dashboard
2. Scroll down to "Genotype Settings" and expand.
3. Click on "New Mutation"
4. Fill in the pre-reqs: MGI ID, Mutation Name, select Gene and Allele Type
5. Click on the "Save" button.
6, The page will hang without the throbber even moving, then the throbber will begin to move, and then the mutation is saved and user will receive a confirmation message.
column151: 08/Mar/18 10:02 PM;rwilliams;[~mbender] Let's get together on this. I can't seem to replicate it. Thanks!
column152: 12/Mar/18 5:04 PM;bkoch;[~rwilliams] [~mbender], this appears to be an issue because in the qa automation group, the QA Gene has 120 different mutations assigned to it, and every time that a new one is added, it is creating permutations of every one of the existing mutations with the new mutation.  I'm not sure if this is ever going to be apparent in the Production enviroment (are there ever more than a couple mutations on one gene), but it's appearing as though for every permutation, it takes about 1/3 to 1/2 of a second to generate (in my local environment), which would make sense that 120 permutations would take 40 to 60 seconds.  If this is an issue to be followed up on, we need to fundamentally change how we are generating the generesult permutations.
column153:
13/Mar/18 8:04 AM;rwilliams;[~bkoch] Good catch!. Because almost all of the mutations that are part of this group all belong to the same Gene, any time that you add a new mutation to that same gene it has to create that many more gene result combinations. 
[~mbender] I would suggest going forward that you try and keep the mutation to gene ratio down to a few mutations per gene to avoid this. If you want I can look at cleaning up some of these mutations in QA to try and get it back to performing better. Let me know what you want me to do on that. Otherwise, I would suggest to [~bkoch] that we close this ticket for now.
column154: 19/Mar/18 10:44 AM;bwinter;[~jcox] [~jmedlock]  Can you read the description and comments for this ticket and provide guidance to [~rwilliams], [~bkoch], and [~mbender], and me about whether to cancel this ticket or take further steps listed in [~rwilliams]'s last comment?

column1: Standardize List Views, Add Cage Grid View to all lists
column34:
_As a user, I want to be able to click on the Biopsy/ID list, Cull list, Wean list, or a Strain list on the Dashboard and be taken to a view of all relevant cages._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* A light weight cage view exists that users will see when clicking:
** The bar graphs on the top 4 block elements of the Dashboard UI
** The Cage number on the Strain Cards on the dashboard
** The Cage number on the Strain Dashboard
** The gray bars for Biopsy, Wean, and Cull lists from the dashboard
** When the user clicks on the top Nav bar links for lists, those lists should *not* include the toggle for cage view
* For everything other than the Cage graph control, if any mice that are shown in the list aren't currently in a cage, then the cage view won't show anything for those mice.  If none of the currently listed mice are in cages, then the cage view should show the user a message saying there are no cages to display.

+Developer Notes:+
* Ensure that the cage grid view exists in its own View
* Keep this functionality modular to facilitate future scalability

This is where we have more room to play with position, color, font, etc. Regardless, I'll send you a message on Teams and talk with you a bit more about this.

Then, the user can click the same icon location and go back to the list.  Please clarify.

column159: 24/Jul/18 10:22 AM;jjensen;[~cleduc],[~admin] I just noticed that the dates which are selected in the Kendo grid filter (e.g. DOB) in the mice list come back notated as Zulu, which is Greenwich.  FYI.
column161:
10/Aug/18 2:42 PM;jjensen;[~cleduc], [~jcox], [~tpatterson], we need to have a conversation on some further refinements to this ticket.  At this moment, the one thing that comes to mind is the need for some kind of indicator on the CGV that tells the user what they're really looking at.  I mean, if a user clicks on any of the dozens of hotspots on the dashboard, walks away to get coffee, then comes back, they need some indicator on the page which tells them how the cages were selected.

Secondly, we need to say something about what actions can be taken on the data.  There are eyeball icons and checkboxes in the mockups.  Generally, I understand these to be drill-downs selectors.  The drill-down destinations are somewhat intuitive, meaning I probably should go to a mouse edit screen if I click on the eyeball associated with a given mouse record...But, the card selectors seem ambiguous in meaning.  Perhaps we could have buttons in the heading area which provide actions for selected cages.  What those buttons would do, however, is unclear.  I'm just speculating here.

And this is why we need to drive out a few more requirements.  Now, we may end up creating new tickets, but I think at the very least we should decide on some kind of title or heading text that describes the collection of cages.  FWIW, I will include the email thread I began Aug 7th.

{quote}Thanks!  I reviewed the text changes and they look great.  I have no great concern about constructing a new page.  My concerns only had to do with a conceptual tracking of where the user is.  In other words, there is currently nothing describing the page.  What the breadcrumbs will probably show for all cage maps, regardless of where one clicks, will be “HOME > CAGE VIEW”.  The URL will be {{host/CageView/Index}} or maybe {{host/CageView/Biopsy}} or something that would indicate the source of the navigational click.  I might be able to get the breadcrumbs to show “HOME > BIOPSY CAGE VIEW” or “HOME > MICE CAGE VIEW” or something similar.  I’d have to research this some more.


From: Jeff Cox 
Sent: Tuesday, August 7, 2018 2:37 PM
To: Jim Jensen <jjensen@transnetyx.com>; Carrie Leduc <cleduc@transnetyx.com>
Subject: RE: COMA-2364 Issue

Hey these are really good questions!

A handful of answers:

•	Search Bar - @Carrie Leduc I believe there wouldn’t be a search bar on this view but I could be mistaken so I’ll defer to you.
•	Description of Parameters of Cage Collection – I’m not 100% sure I follow, but if you mean to show the filter/search criteria that led to that set of cages being displayed, then that’s something we haven’t discussed being present on screen.
•	“New cage grid view exists in its own view” – Yes this means a new page.  Do you have concerns about this?  
•	I think that 2nd bullet point suffered from some poor/hurried editing on my part when we last met to discuss these requirements and I was bouncing all over the text making changes.  I*think* I’ve got it right now, which was to actually delete that point discussing a toggle button, since a subsequent criteria specifies that there isn’t supposed to be a toggle button anymore, compared to our previous thinking on this ticket.  @Carrie Leduc, but please correct me if I’m wrong here.

If you have more questions/concerns, keep them coming.  If we need to jump on a call to discuss in more depth let me know.


From: Jim Jensen 
Sent: Tuesday, August 7, 2018 2:23 PM
To: Carrie Leduc <cleduc@transnetyx.com>; Jeff Cox <jcox@transnetyx.com>
Subject: COMA-2364 Issue

Folks, I think that there needs to be another round of driving out requirements on this ticket.  As I get into it, I realize that there is no actual description of the page, only a vague mention of a “light weight cage view”.  Is there a search bar?  Should there be a description somewhere of the parameters of the cage collection?  When the ticket says “the cage grid view exists in its own View”, that means I am designing a new web page, and the navigation will generally reveal very little—if anything—about where the page came from.

There is also some wording that needs to be clarified with the 2nd main bullet point under Acceptance Criteria.
{quote}
column162:
13/Aug/18 1:41 PM;jjensen;Another issue:

According to the Acceptance Criteria, it states in part:

{quote}o	If any mice that are shown in the list aren't currently in a cage, then the cage view won't show anything for those mice. If none of the currently listed mice are in cages, then the cage view should show the user a message saying there are no cages to display.{quote}

But, there is a case where this criterium makes no sense:  The Cages chart reports, in its first column, the number of cages with 0 mice in them.  This begs the question: what do we do about this condition?

I see two options here:
# Either remove the CGV link from the “cages with 0 mice” portion of the cages chart, or
# Show them anyway, since there may be a need to know which cages are empty.

In either case, the story needs to be edited.

FWIW, this is going to end up being the earliest blocker for me.  I can continue with making sure strains, mice, breedings, and litters all work with the CGV, but if we pick option “2” from the list, I will need to make a fundamental change to the SQL code and then account for 0-mice cages for the rest of the conditions.

column151:
16/Feb/18 3:23 PM;admin;[~bwinter]
I see a bug in this view, but I don't think its that the samples aren't showing (in fact, they probably shouldn't show in the plate in any browser). The bug I see is that the strains are collapsed.

The problem this print view is designed to solve is giving the mouse tech a way to manually fill in biopsy/well plate info (like the TAG center instruction card). I don't know what the use case would be for printing out a filled in well plate.

I should have picked up on this when I heard people talking about gradients and whatnot on the printout (which, to put that subject to rest, we have little to no control over (there is no way to determine in the browser what properties they are changing on the printing device)).

Lets discuss.
column152: 16/Feb/18 4:33 PM;bwinter;[~admin] Roger that.  I modified this the description and title of the ticket based on your comment and our in-person discussion with [~jmedlock].  Please let me know if I forgot anything and I will get it added to the ticket.

The IE doesn't show color in the well plates, but it does expand sample lists across strains and shows controls and omits in well plate.     [^PASSED - sample list expands across strains in print view - IE 11.pdf] 

GREAT JOB!

column1: Litter Sample Validation Giving False Positives
column34:
-When a user adds a litter to the shopping cart needing a Biopsy/ID, once the user clicks on the "ID" icon the sample is then verified ALTHOUGH it has not been ID/Biopsied.  If the user cancels the Biopsy/ID the system still validates that it has been and will allow adding to cart, which then throws a hard error-

The latest QA push fixed the ID, but now the issue is with Biopsy. When a user goes to ID a litter, the system thinks it has been biopsied as well, even though it has not.

Steps To Recreate:
1. Add a litter to the cart that does not have a biopsy/ID (create new from breeding if needed)
2. Navigate to the cart and click on the "ID" icon next to the litter sample.
3. User will be taken to the litter workbench.
4. Add the ID for the litter's pups if not already ID'd.
5. Navigate back to the shopping cart.
6. User will see the litter is now validated and has the checkbox to add to an order.
7. User selects the litter and clicks "start new order"
8. Hard error is thrown, see stack trace.

column1: HotFix: Transnetyx.Authentication UserManager is restricting valid email addresses
column34: The default constructor of Transnetyx.Authentication.Services.Identity.TransnetyxUserManager does not have UserValidator overrides to allow non-alphanumeric characters. This prevents some users from registering.

column1: Discounts Applied In Order Manager Are Not Applied In Colony
column34:
When a user has a discount from the Discount tab in OM, with the checkbox "Automatically apply to the user's next order" checked. That discount is not applied to the order in Colony.

Steps To Recreate:
1. Navigate to user group leaders account in Order Manager.
2. Select "discounts" from the account dropdown menu in OM.
3. Apply a discount if there is not already one, ensuring "Automatically apply to the user's next order" is checked and save.
4. Add a litter/mouse to shopping cart if one not already present.
5. Start new order, setup wellplate, and finalize order.
6. On the pricing page you will see no discounts were applied to the order.

column1: Send Inconclusive Result Code
column34:
Users may receive an inconclusive genotype for the following reasons:
* Not all probes were run
* Results returned with an undetermined code
* Impossible results returned

Send a unique code for each scenario so the proper text can be displayed upon first review of results.
column151:
19/Feb/18 7:59 AM;rwilliams;These are the messages that the Engine returns right now for various situations within the genotype results translation process.

* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mouse gender unknown for sex linked gene";
** Gene is sex-linked and there was no “Y” probe result and the gender of the sample was sent to the engine as “unknown”
** Returns “Inconclusive” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "No mutation probes exist";
** None of the probes in the ResultSets contain a mutation probe
** Returns “Inconclusive” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Probe count mismatch";
** The count probes linked do not match the number of probes in the ResultSets
** Returns “Inconclusive” as a Result string
** (This check likely needs some refinement)
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "No wildtype probes exist";
** None of the probes in the ResultSets contain a WildType probe and the Gene in NOT a Transgene
** Returns “Inconclusive” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Too many positive mutations";
** IsMosaic is false and count of mutation probes in the ResultSets is greater than 2
** Returns “Inconclusive” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Wildtype can't be positive";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 2 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is positive
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut1/Mut2 for Male on Y Linked";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 2 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut1/Mut2 for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 2 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut1/Mut2 for Male on X Linked";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 2 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is positive
** Gene is “X” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/WT for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/WT for Male on Y Linked";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/WT for Male on X Linked";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is positive
** Gene is “X” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/Mut for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is NOT positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "WT/WT for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 0 positive mutation probe results and the 1 wildtype probe is positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "All probes reported as negative";
** This is highly unlikely to occur I would think
** There is 1 wildtype probe, 0 positive mutation probe results and the 0 wildtype probe is NOT positive
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut1/Mut2 for Male on Y Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 2 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut1/Mut2 for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 2 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut1/Mut2 for Male on X Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 2 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is “X” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "All WTs aren't positive";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 2 positive mutation probes and not all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is “X” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Tg+ for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is Transgene “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/WT for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/WT for Male on Y Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is “Y” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/WT for Male on X Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is Transgene “X” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/Mut for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probes and its associated wildtype probe is NOT positive and all the rest of the wildtype probes (those not associated with the positive mutation probe) are positive
** Gene is Transgene “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "Mut/WT for Male on X Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probes and its associated wildtype probe is positive and all the rest of the wildtype probes (those not associated with the positive mutation probe) are positive
** Gene is Transgene “X” sex-linked and sample is male
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "All WTs aren't positive2";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 1 positive mutation probes and NOT all the rest of the wildtype probes (those not associated with the positive mutation probe) are positive
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "WT/WT for Female on Y Linked";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 0 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are positive
** Gene is Transgene “Y” sex-linked and sample is female
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "WTs ain't right3";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 0 positive mutation probes and all wildtype probes are NOT positive
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
* genotypeResult.ResultReason = "WTs ain't right2";
** There is 0 or >1 wildtype probe, 0 positive mutation probes and at least 1 wildtype probe is positive, but not all of them
** Returns “Impossible” or “Mosaic” as a Result string
column152: 20/Feb/18 9:42 PM;rwilliams;[~qevans] [~jmedlock] [~jcox] I think that there might be another reason for not being able to get a genotype – not knowing the sex of the sample when running for a sex-linked gene. This could happen because we didn’t run a Y probe and the mouse is not sexed in Colony. How would you like me to handle that scenario? I don't know that it is likely to happen often, but it could.
column153: 20/Feb/18 10:01 PM;rwilliams;[~qevans] [~jmedlock] [~jcox] Question dealing with "Mosaic". If the user selects the mosaic option the the Engine basically returns "Mosaic" instead of "Impossible" for Impossible results. Do I just need to not send back a reason for those scenarios? If there are no requirements for Mosaic right now I can hide the mosaic option for the time being. Nate brought up the mosaic option in our discussions on genotyping. This really may not be an issue the more I think about it because if the gene is marked mosaic, then the impossible results report back as mosaic instead of impossible. Since mosaic isn't impossible, I think the reason I return will just be empty and that should be fine.
column154: 21/Feb/18 8:19 AM;qevans;[~rwilliams] there aren't requirements around either of those scenarios right now, and I don't know that I can make an informed decision. I'm going to leave those up to [~jmedlock] and [~jcox].
column155:
21/Feb/18 8:37 AM;jmedlock;[~rwilliams] [~jcox] [~qevans] [~nnowak]  Additional thoughts?
In the case of the sex linked gene and not running a Y probe, i see a couple scenarios:

_For now_:
 *We should report inconclusive. Our policy so far has been that we will not a genotype report on partially run probes, the user will need to select it.*

_For the near future:_
*We will also want to check when the user adds a mouse/litter to the plate that is a sex linked gene and then turns off the Y probe or doesnot have the Y probe. We will want to alert them before the order is placed.*
column156:
21/Feb/18 9:40 AM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] [~qevans] [~jcox] [~nnowak] Jim, that's a great thought for the future. For now I am supposed to report back 1 of 3 reasons when I am not able to provide a genotype:
* Not all probes were run
* Results returned with an undetermined code
* Impossible results returned

So the question is, when we encounter the issue of not knowing the sex of the sample when running for a sex-linked gene, which reason should I return? It almost seems to me like there needs to be another reason added to the list for this particular scenario.
column157: 21/Feb/18 12:47 PM;jmedlock;[~rwilliams] [~qevans] Option 1. not all probes were run.
column158: 21/Feb/18 1:41 PM;nnowak;Question. Are we planning to add (at some point) the ability to translate the result if they have sex of mouse filled out? This should be high on a list, as I imagine they will be annoyed that there is no genotype reported when mouse is known male/female.
column159:
21/Feb/18 1:52 PM;rwilliams;[~nnowak] The ResultsEngine is fully functional even for sex-linked genes, so that functionality you were asking about is already built in. The issue is that if the Engine doesn't have a Y probe result or a gender from Colony for a sex-linked gene, then the Engine is not able to calculate a genotype. 
My question is, for this particular scenario, which of the 3 given reasons do I need to show to the user as to why we were not able to return a genotype. My thoughts are that none of the 3 reasons fit this scenario. I think [~jmedlock] has suggested the best reason, if all we have are these 3 to choose from, is "Not all probes were run". I believe that you, Jeanie and Quincy came up with the list of the reasons. Here are the 3 reasons that I was given to report back for all scenarios where the Genotype cannot be translated from the results:
* Not all probes were run
* Results returned with an undetermined code
* Impossible results returned

Based on this information, what are your thought on adding a new reason for this particular scenario? This is only scenario that I have found that doesn't nicely fit into those 3 reasons.
column160: 21/Feb/18 2:13 PM;nnowak;Thanks Rich, now I understand. I agree, that if we are limited to those 3 reasons the "Not all probes were run". However, if we added another reason for this case it would probably help customers understand if we said something like: "Sex of individual not indicated"
column161:
02/Apr/18 10:47 AM;qevans;Tested with COMA-2282: UND + impossible (screenshot-1) and not all probes were run (screenshot-2) are displaying help text correctly as well as in other combinations (screenshot-3, screenshot-4, screenshot-5). QA verified.
Text for "impossible" genotypes will be changed in COMA-2486.

column1: Selected probes not showing selected after receiving green growler and going back to probes gear.
column34:
*What happened:*

# I placed an order for a strain with 4 probes (probes for 3 MUTs sharing a 1 WT probe)
# At the well plate page, I added samples to the well plate and gave the well plate an ID
# I opened the strain probe settings and turned off 2 of 4 probes.   !probes turned off.png|thumbnail! 
# I received green growler that 2 probes are active.  !active probes growler.png|thumbnail! 
# I went back to strain probe settings.
# All probes reset to "select all probes" default  !probes all turned back on.png|thumbnail! 

*What I expected to happen*

column1: Strain Linking Icon is Red When Linked
column34:
How it is now:
When a samples strains are unlinked the "chain" icon is orange.
When a samples strains are linked the "chain" icon is red.

The change:
When a samples strains are unlinked the "chain" icon is red.
When a samples strains are linked the "chain" icon is removed.

Business Impact:
This is consistent with the two other icons on the page and makes more sense from a user standpoint.

column1: Mouse Upload/Import: Worker Process
column34:
_As a user uploading mouse data, I need the Colony system to process the data I have uploaded so that my Mice are added to my colony._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* As the mice are imported, if they have a parent ID, then create the necessary breedings and litters for mice that have the same parent IDs and birthday.  
* Any parents that have a death date should have their breedings retired.
* If we can't match the imported mouse Strain with an existing Strain, then error out to fallout table.
* If parent ID is present but doesn't match an existing Mouse, then error out to fallout table.
* Mouse IDs that we import have to be unique.
* [Todo] Required fields for Mouse, Litter, Breeding, Cage need to be identified and populated by input data, including default values.
* -{color:#d04437}Use the existing Notes table(s) to help the user understand data that was imported but is missing some data.  (for example, a mouse was added that didn't have parents listed){color}-
* If the user imports a mouse with a cage ID and that cage ID doesn't exist in our system, then we need to create that cage without room/rack info.  If the cage already exists then we just add the mouse to that cage.
* Add a flag on the Breedings, Litters, -{color:#d04437}Cages{color}- tables to indicate that records were imported through this process.
* Provides error handling when encountering bad data.  Bad data rows (errored out) are stored in a "fallout" table that is grouped by error type.  
* {color:#d04437}-Notifies user when import is complete.-{color}

+Notes+:
Order of precedence for creating Mice records:
* Start with Mice with blank Parent IDs
* Order by Birth Date and import Oldest to Youngest
* User can view Fallout table and make adjustments for reprocessing those rows.

+Scenario+:
*Given* I am importing mice with this process
*When* a mouse has a parent ID that doesn't exist,
*Then* it should go into the fallout table.
*And* If that parent ID is imported later on during the first pass of processing
*Then* a second pass of importing the fallout table rows will successfully import the original mouse now.

h1. Attachments


* {{Specifications - Mice Import - COMA-2338.xlsx}}
** Titles and description of column names
** Initial Processing flow
** Questions
** Assumptions
** Data Entities to be created from Mice Import
* {{Various Tests - COMA-2338.xlsx}}
** Rows with expected errors are highlighted in red
** Types of tests per worksheet
*** Test for happy case - everything downloaded with no errors
*** Errors thrown when required fields are missing
*** Errors thrown when column type is not correct (e.g., number given for a date field)
*** Errors thrown when for columns expecting data within some range (boundary testing)
*** Tests for behind the scenes logic (e.g., mouse ID must be unique to import data and mice in colony)
*** Checks for date formatting
* {{Genotype Shorthand and Format - COMA-2338.xlsx}}
** Documents which genotype scenarios get simple shorthand (green cells)
** Documents the genotype format for various scenarios.
* {{Genotype Testing - COMA-2338.xlsx}}
** Rows with expected errors are highlighted in red
** Types of tests per worksheet
*** Tests for system generated genotypes for various scenarios (e.g., {{GeneName<ALLELE1/ALLELE2>}})
*** Tests for simple shorthand (e.g., {{HOM, HET, WT, NCAR, CAR, HEM}})
*** Tests for shorthand with gene-base (e.g., {{GeneName<HOM>}})
*** Tests for case sensitivity
*** Tests for spacing around and within genotype
*** Tests for overwriting genotypes

h1. Developer Notes
* 4/3 added initial definition of input file from [~bwinter]  [^Colony Import - Data Definitions - 4-3-2018.xlsx] 
* Assumptions made by Bryan when he create the input file definition:
** That data definitions lists
*** desired columns
*** brief description of what the column is trying to capture
*** input type
*** example input
** There is one record per mouse
** There are NO records for un-weaned pups
** Entity IDs are different from Entity Names 
*** IDs are unique
*** Names are non-unique
*** I listed IDs as possible alphanumeric strings, but this restriction is not necessary
*** I was unsure how to handle strains IDs (user created vs Transnetyx provided)
*** Strain names would be the names the user gives the strains, which may not be unique.
** From this list we can infer litters (same parents IDs) 
*** How will we infer litter name?
*** How will we infer pup counts at birth? Will missing and dead pups have records in the import?
*** Have we captured the minimum set of litter properties needed to create a litter record in colony?
** From this list we can infer breedings (after inferring litters) 
*** How will we infer breeding active status?
*** How will we infer breeding time?
*** How will we infer breeding name?
*** Have we captured the minimum set of breeding properties needed to create a breeding record in colony?
** From this list, we CANNOT infer history of where mice have been physically (previous cages, racks, rooms)
column151:
01/Mar/18 4:30 PM;cleduc;A scenario to consider:
The user imports a table with animals and the parent records are there so it creates a breeding and litters with the animals in the table by birthdate. 
Later the user wants to import more records and this import contains another litter belonging to a breeding already in the system. If they list the parent ID's as they are in the system already will the import logic create this new litter under the previously created breeding or create a new breeding with same parent IDs? 
If it creates a new breeding, that is OK if we have a way to then search for those and / or alert and then adjust whatever they need to. (could be wrong parent IDs second time or could be they need to put under existing breeding in which case they could just create that litter in the system).

# While working through the creation of the mouse importer no one ever defined this feature, In hindsight I should have asked about it, but seeing that this never came up in our many discussions where we defined the desired functionality of the importer I would guess that it ended up not being something that anyone felt was important in the end. We did have some conversations early on about "if we couldn't match the genotypes, maybe we should just add a note on the mouse", but I think we worked through that and added rules and such that make the importer much more robust and complete to not have to add notes for things like no parents. If you find that there is a need for this then let's define it and add it.
# All of the pertinent entities that are created by the importer process have 3 new properties: IsImported, DateImported, and ImportedByUserId.  The specifications document (which needs to be attached to this ticket and old ones deleted), details each entity that is created and will also show these new fields that are associated with the import. In other words, I think we have this one covered.

column1: Strain Link Wizard: Cannot select mutation/gene in step 2, if only 1 mutation/gene is present
column34:
When a user only has one mutation (Gene) and then attempts to link strains via the "Link Strain Wizard", they are unable to select the mutation in step 2.

Steps to recreate:

1. Select the strain you want to link from the "Strains" tab in Colony by clicking on the strain name.
2. Expand the "Genotype Settings" at the bottom of the edit strain page.
3. Verify that either only one Gene/Mutation is present or none are present on that strain.
4. If there are no Genes/Mutations present add a new one from the "New Mutation" button on the page.
5. After verifying that only one Gene/Mutation is present click on the "Link" button to be taken to the "Strain Link Wizard" menu.
6. Select the strain that has one Gene/Mutation and click "Next"
7.  The one mutation listed will not have a checkbox to the right.
8. The mutation SHOULD have a checkbox to the right as long as one Gene/Mutation is present.
9. If user adds a second gene/mutation to that strain and repeats the steps the gene/mutation will now display the checkbox.

 !LinkMutation.PNG|thumbnail! 
 !LinkMutation2.PNG|thumbnail!

column1: Active filter for biopsy and wean counts
column34:
The active litter filter also needs to apply to the biopsy and wean litters count.

On the dashboard the biopsy and wean litters counts includes litters that have been marked all dead or missing. This count should filter out non-active litters.

The litters list when accessed from the dashboard biopsy or wean counts should also take into consideration the active litter filter. If the all the pups in a litter has been marked dead or missing and is no longer active. The biopsy and wean litter counts should not reflect these in the counts.

column151: 13/Feb/18 11:31 AM;rwilliams;[~admin] Just for clarification, the user cannot edit or unlink a strain while the strain is on an order that is in any one of the statuses mentioned above. Correct? In addition, the way we are going to accomplish this is by removing the links for edit and/or delete from the page. Correct?
column152: 13/Feb/18 12:54 PM;admin;Correct. And Correct.
column153: 16/Feb/18 3:22 PM;rwilliams;I goofed on this ticket and checked in all of my work on the branch COMA-2260.
column154: 22/Feb/18 1:09 PM;bwinter;[~admin], [~rwilliams] This ticket limits unlinking strains from the Colony side.  Should there be any constraints for unlinking strains on the QO side once an order is in process?  Or are those constraints already in QO?
column155:
22/Feb/18 5:14 PM;admin;[~bwinter]
No and no.
The user would be warned if the strain they are modifying is a Colony strain. However, regardless of whether they modify it or not, it will not affect an order already in progress. If they are intent on unlinking from the QO side, they just wont get any Colony results.

On the colony side, we're preventing the user from associating a target allele with a different probe while an order is in flight so that we don't give inaccurate results. If they break the link by removing probes in QO they wont get inaccurate results, they should just get no results.
column156: 23/Feb/18 8:39 AM;bwinter;[~admin]  Ah.  Thank you!  I just realized that I have asked this question once before.  Thank you for being patient with me and helping me understand a new facet of it.
column157:
23/Mar/18 3:51 PM;bwinter;[~rwilliams], I just realized that COMA-2463 - _Orders started in Colony and completed in QO, do not update NotReceived order status in Colony_ - blocks this ticket.  This blocker has been assigned to [~rjonakin], so all is good there.  I just wanted to give you a heads up.

Another heads up is that the *ProbeArrived* order status is currently un-testable.  The only order statuses that can be tested are the following:

* *NotReceived* -> by clicking Submit on pricing page in Colony
* *Received* -> by finding order in ORMA and receiving it
* *InProgress* -> by using submitting this status from Testing Harness
* *PartiallyComplete*-> by using submitting this status from Testing Harness
* *Complete*-> by using submitting this status from Testing Harness
* *GenotypesAssigned* -> by assigning genotypes from Testing Results on Genotype Results page

CC: [~jcox], [~jmedlock], [~admin], [~qevans], [~mbender]
column158: 03/Apr/18 10:09 PM;bwinter;Tested. QA Verified.  Unable to test for PartiallyCompleted and ProbesArrived order statuses.

column1: Order Status of "0" when starting a new order from shopping cart.
column34:
When a user selects a sample to start a new order, the order goes to a status of "0". The order cannot be deleted and has an icon that should not be present.

Steps to recreate:

1. From the shopping cart select a sample that has been ID/Biopsied.
2. After selecting the sample checkbox click "start new order".
3. Order will be generated at the bottom of the "orders" section of the shopping cart. (This sometimes throws a hard error. See stack trace below.)
4. Order status will be "0" and there will be a magnifying glass icon to the right of that order.

column1: Transferring Litters
column34:
_As a user I need to be able to transfer litters, even before pups are added, so that I can keep the Colony application in sync with my real world colony._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* User is able to mark a litter as transferred from 3-dot menu of the Litter card view.
* -User is able to mark a litter as transferred from 3-dot menu of the Litter Workbench.-
* -User is able to mark individual pups as transferred from 3-dot menu of the Litter Workbench.-
* -If the user transfers a litter that does not have pups generated, then we have to add the pup records.-
* Transferred litters should no longer show as active.
* When a user transfers litters, litter counts for strains, breedings, and cages should be accordingly decremented (where applicable).

See screenshots of these 3-dot menus for reference.

----

[Transferring pups is not a transfer litter function.] -cs
[Marking a litter as transferred from litter workbench still allows the user to make litter workbench changes (id, biopsy, wean, mark dead, etc.).  See comments for more discussion.] - bw 2018-07-31
[There are conflicts on Litter Workbench so that if you transfer pups from the Offspring 3-dot menu, the litter workbench is not updated of this change, so this req needs to be removed as well.  See comments for more discussion.] - bw 2018-07-31

10/Jul/18 10:58 AM;jjensen;Chris:

Made the changes you noted, removed the ReSharper option that splits lines at certain widths, and pushed the C# code back out to origin.
I will get to the SQL conflict later, but first I must work on COMA-1889<https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/browse/COMA-1889>.
I could also use your help here.

Bryan’s testing says that this ticket fails when a breeding pair has one litter.  I think that the failure criterium is incorrect, due to the way that I test for litters:

                foreach (var parent in BreedingParents)
                {
                    if (parent.MouseId != null)
                    {
                        ParentLitterCount.Add(parent.MouseId, breeding.Litters.Count(l => l.IsActiveLitter && l.LitterParents.Any(lp => lp.MouseId == parent.MouseId)));
                   }
                }

As you can see in the code, I set up a Dictionary to use in the cshtml.  The Dictionary is filled with the parent id as the key and the number of litters where the parent is assigned.
Now, the _test_ comes from the Litter business object via IsActiveLitter.  Here is the definition:

        /// <summary>
        /// Common logic for determining whether or not a litter is "active".
        /// Note, that this is only accurate if we retrieve the litter's mice along with the litter.
        /// </summary>
        public bool IsActiveLitter => !this.DateDeleted.HasValue && !this.DateWeaned.HasValue && this.HasLivingOffspring;

Please note the comment which claims the Mice must be retrieved.

This is where I need help.

I don’t know where or how to retrieve the mice.

Granted, I could run the search for myself and maybe find it today, but I thought you might know where I could find the function or perhaps the best places where I should concentrate my search.

Once I load the mice into the litter object, the test should be accurate.

Can you help?
