column164:
25/Jul/18 4:25 PM;bwinter;[~cleduc], [~jcox] What is the expected behavior if a litter is transferred then the litter is weaned?  Should the weaned pups be able to be placed in cages?

CC: [~jmedlock]
column165: 25/Jul/18 4:29 PM;cleduc;[~bwinter][~jcox][~jmedlock] If a litter is transferred the mom must transfer with it (physically). If not, the litter transferred prior to wean must be being immediately euthanized. The only reason to allow weaning post transfer is for when they made a mistake and do it in the wrong order.
column166:
31/Jul/18 4:11 PM;bwinter;[~rwilliams], could you make a change to this ticket so that Transfer Litter action is not available from the Litter 3-dot menu in the Litter Workbench?

This is the place that is causing the problems.  This change will nullify this requirement, but I have crossed it out in the description with a note.

* User is able to mark a litter as transferred from 3-dot menu of the Litter Workbench.

 !litterworkbench3dotmenuforlitter.JPG|thumbnail!
column167:
31/Jul/18 5:27 PM;bwinter;Okay...  About the Transferring litters...  After a little more investigation, we discovered that this ticket is good to go if we simply remove these two requirements which allow transfer actions from the litter workbench:

* User is able to mark a litter as transferred from 3-dot menu of the _Litter Workbench_.
* User is able to mark individual pups as transferred from 3-dot menu of the _Litter Workbench_.

After talking to [~rwilliams], this is desirable anyway, because the litter workbench can work in conflicting ways.  For example, if you transfer the litter from the litter 3-dot menu while in the Litter Workbench, the litter workbench does not refresh or update or redirect.  Therefore, you can still make litter actions (id, biopsy, wean, etc) on a litter that was just transferred.  

Another example, if you transfer pups from the "offspring" 3-dot menu on the left-hand-side of the Litter Workbench, the "rows" in the Litter Workbench are not updated, therefore you can take litter actions against a pups you just transferred. 

However, transferring litter from the litter list works as expected.  The litter list is immediately refreshed; the litter is made inactive; and the litter no longer appears in the litter list unless you selected the "active = false" filter.

[~rwilliams] will remove the Transfer litter action from the litter 3-dot menu in the Litter Workbench, and we will be good to go. 

CC: [~cleduc], [~jcox], [~admin], [~rwilliams], [~jjensen]
column169:
31/Jul/18 5:51 PM;bwinter;[~cleduc], I made a mistake in my comment above.

When transferring litter from the litter list, the litter list is immediately refreshed, and the litter no longer appears in the litter list. 
 {color:#d04437}However{color}, selecting the "active = false" filter {color:#d04437}does not{color} show the litter again.

It is like the litter is neither active nor inactive from the litter list.  I cannot figure out how to get it to reappear in the litter list.  I can only find it in the breeding card.

{color:#d04437}More slightly bad news{color}, if you click the transferred litter from the breeding card, you are taken to the litter workbench where litter actions can be taken against the transferred litter.

All this seems low risk at the moment, but I wanted to give you the latest news.   Even having said all this, I have passed this ticket with the above caveats.  Let me know if this is not okay.

column170:
01/Aug/18 8:28 AM;jjensen;[~bwinter], after seeing what madness the filtering on these Kendo grid controls can become, I wouldn't put it past the litter filter to somehow contribute to your inability to view it after transfer.  However, your _{color:red}More slightly bad news{color}_ is significant, as it reinforces our belief that the original ticket missed the analysis boat.

In My Humble Opinion, we need to step back and see what needs to be done with Litters in general.  In other words, we need better analysis on a bigger picture.  I think [~cleduc], [~admin], and [~rwilliams] would agree that the awkward synchronization of states like _transferred_, _deleted_, and _weaned_ between the collections (litters) and the individual entities (mice) is proof of a poorly-implemented concept.
column171: 01/Aug/18 5:12 PM;rwilliams;[~bwinter]  and any dev that might work on this in the future... when a litter is transferred we need to treat much like we do when we delete a litter. We need to transfer the mice, remove the mice from any cage they are in, and and possibly delete the litter parent records, and remove the litter from the cage it’s in.

column1: Bar charts on Dashboard link to Filtered Lists
column34:
_As a user, when I see a bar chart on the Dashboard I want to be able to click on that bar and be taken to a filtered list of that object type based on the query that produced that bar on the chart._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* User is able to click on the bar graphs under Mice, Cages, Litters, and Breedings and be taken a filtered list of that object type based on the query used to build the chart. (See screenshot dashboardbarcharts.jpg)

+Scenario+:
*Given* I see a bar under Mice that represents X mice that are of a specific age
*When* I click on that specific bar
*Then* I should be taken to the Mice list with a filter in place that displays those specific X mice.


|| {{objects}} ||
| {{mice filtered by age range [0-28 days, 29-60 days, ...]}} |
| {{cages filtered by  mice count [0, 1, 2, ...]}} |
| {{breedings filtered by breeding time range [0-30 days, 31-60 days, ...]}} |
| {{litters filtered by litter age range [0-5 days, 6-10 days, ...]}} |
| {{litters old enough to biopsy or ID but not biopsied or ID'ed yet}} |
| {{litters old enough to wean and but not weaned yet}} |
| {{orders ready for finalization or with new results}} |
| {{mice marked to be culled}} |


+Examples+:

|| range || thingy || list || criteria || column ||
| 0-28 days | Mice | MICE | 0 <= age <= 28 | Mouse Age |
| 29-60 days | Mice | MICE | 29 <= age <= 60 | Mouse Age |
| 61-90 days | Mice | MICE | 61 <= age <= 90 | Mouse Age |
| 91-120 days | Mice | MICE | 91 <= age <=120 | Mouse Age |
| 121+ days | Mice | MICE | 121 <= age | Mouse Age |
|| range || thingy || list || criteria || column ||
| 0 mice per cage | Cages | CAGES | mice per cage = 0 | Mice per Cage |
| 1 mice per cage | Cages | CAGES | mice per cage = 1 | Mice per Cage |
| 2 mice per cage | Cages | CAGES | mice per cage = 2 | Mice per Cage |
| 3 mice per cage | Cages | CAGES | mice per cage = 3 | Mice per Cage |
| 4 mice per cage | Cages | CAGES | mice per cage = 4 | Mice per Cage |
| 5 mice per cage | Cages | CAGES | mice per cage = 5 | Mice per Cage |
| 6+ mice per cage | Cages | CAGES | mice per cage >= 6 | Mice per Cage |
|| range || thingy || list || criteria || column ||
| 0-30 days | Breedings | BREEDINGS | 0 <= breeding time <= 30 | Breeding Time |
| 31-60 days | Breedings | BREEDINGS | 31 <= breeding time <= 60 | Breeding Time |
| 61-90 days | Breedings | BREEDINGS | 61 <= breeding time <= 90 | Breeding Time |
| 91-120 days | Breedings | BREEDINGS | 91 <= breeding time <= 120 | Breeding Time |
| 121+ days | Breedings | BREEDINGS | 121 <= breeding time | Breeding Time |
|| range || thingy || list || criteria || column ||
| 0-5 days | Litters | LITTERS | 0 <= litter age <= 5 | Litter Age |
| 6-10 days | Litters | LITTERS | 6 <= litter age <= 10 | Litter Age |
| 11-15 days | Litters | LITTERS | 11 <= litter age <= 15 | Litter Age |
| 16-20 days | Litters | LITTERS | 16 <= litter age <= 20 | Litter Age |
| 21+ days | Litters | LITTERS | 21 <= litter age | Litter Age |

column1: Auto-save well plate placement after these events
column34:
_As a lab tech user, I want the placement of my samples in the well plate to auto-save whenever I (1) navigate away from the well plate placement page, (2) click finalize button, or (3) click delete well plate button; so that my effort is reduced._

+Acceptance Criteria+:

-*Save well plate placement of samples whenever user *navigates away* from well plate placement page-
 (This type of functionality depends on browser event's that are unreliable in applications that use layouts and partials. This behavior would be especially side effect prone in the ordering UI, as well. Needs more discussion -cs)
* Save well plate placement of samples whenever user *clicks finalize button*.
* Save well plate placement of samples whenever user *clicks delete well plate button*.

h1. Note to DEV

Currently, clicking the delete well plate button for any well plate, removes all samples from every well plate.

column1: Setting weaned dates correctly
column34:
Somehow litters can get a wean date where the pups do not. IOS checks for adult mice on the cage map by looking at wean date on litter OR wean date on mouse. The web looks at mouse wean date only unless the mouse is already an adult, then how does web handle it? This is causing cage map counts for mice to appear off visually. 

2 things:
In staging and production we need to find how many litters have a wean date where the mice do not and discuss an update to those records.

We need to locate how this is happening where the  litter wean date is set but mice are not. We know the edits forms on both iOS and web will do this but there appears to be another location causing this bug.

the problem in October was that the iOS app wasn’t setting the Mouse.WeanDate at the time of weaning. It was just setting the Litter.DateWeaned. Now the iOS app is setting both dates at weaning (unless the mouse is a runt or dead).


FROM Jim:
* We have been discussing wean date on the edit form and its function. The edit form allows users to set the wean date and thus should apply that date to the pups. We need to change the edit form to allow this with a message above the states “Apply to all alive pups.” 
* Added by Rich: Then we need to update the back end so that anytime the wean date is set or updated, that the wean date for all eligible mice in the litter will also be updated to that same date. If wean date on the litter had a date and the user clears the date, then the date change would not be cascaded to the mice. (this functionality needs to be approved)
* The risk is pretty low that users will be editing wean dates after mice are in future breedings, etc, etc, Also we do not have any logic on the mouse level that prevents them from changing this individually.

One comment you made to me was that you think we want to remove the ability for a user to be able to manually set the wean date on a litter. I will proceed with removing that capability for both the add and the edit litter pages by turning that field to a label instead of a date picker.
column152: 30/Jan/18 8:58 AM;rwilliams;[~jcox] Jim said you had put a query together in regard to this issue. If you still have that query, would you please included here? Thanks!
column153:
30/Jan/18 10:34 AM;tposchel;I now remember that Rich asked me about "manually setting the wean date on a litter" a while back. The iOS app does NOT set the Pups[].WeanDate if the user manually sets the wean date on the litter. That could certainly be the bug.

So it sounds like web is moving forward with removing the ability to edit the wean date manually from the edit form? I suppose iOS should follow suit? OR we could attempt to modify each of the pups whenever the litter wean date is set?
column154:
30/Jan/18 11:37 AM;rwilliams;Useful Queries


{code:sql}
-- Gets litter and mice details where there are wean date mismatches
SELECT l.Name LitterName, l.DateWeaned LitterWeaned, m.Name MouseName, m.WeanDate MouseWened, *
FROM Litters l
WHERE
	l.DateDeleted IS NULL
	AND l.DeathDate IS NULL
	AND m.DateDeleted IS NULL
	AND m.DeathDate IS NULL
	AND
	((l.DateWeaned IS NULL
	AND m.WeanDate IS NOT NULL)
	OR
	(l.DateWeaned IS NOT NULL
	AND m.WeanDate IS NULL))
ORDER BY l.DateWeaned, m.WeanDate
{code}

{code:sql}
-- Gets information on the groups where there are wean date mismatches
SELECT g.Name GroupName, u.UserName GroupLeader MouseName, m.WeanDate MouseWened, *
FROM Litters l
	JOIN Mice m ON l.LitterId = m.LitterId
	JOIN Groups g ON l.GroupId = g.GroupId
	JOIN Users u ON g.LeaderId = u.Id
WHERE
	l.DateDeleted IS NULL
	AND l.DeathDate IS NULL
	AND m.DateDeleted IS NULL
	AND m.DeathDate IS NULL
	AND
	((l.DateWeaned IS NULL
	AND m.WeanDate IS NOT NULL)
	OR
	(l.DateWeaned IS NOT NULL
	AND m.WeanDate IS NULL))
GROUP BY g.Name, u.UserName
{code}

{code:sql}
-- For the scenario where mice have wean date, but litter doesn't, this gives you the litter and number of eligible mice with a wean date and without a wean date
SELECT l.GroupName, l.GroupLeader, l.LitterId, l.LitterName, COALESCE(k.MouseWithWeanDate, 0) MouseWithWeanDate, COALESCE(j.MouseWithOutWeanDate, 0) MouseWithOutWeanDate
FROM
	(SELECT g.Name GroupName, u.UserName GroupLeader, l.LitterId, l.Name LitterName
		FROM Litters l
			JOIN Mice m ON l.LitterId = m.LitterId
			JOIN Groups g ON l.GroupId = g.GroupId
			JOIN Users u ON g.LeaderId = u.Id
		WHERE
			l.DateDeleted IS NULL
			AND l.DeathDate IS NULL
			AND m.DateDeleted IS NULL
			AND m.DeathDate IS NULL
			AND
			(l.DateWeaned IS NULL
			AND m.WeanDate IS NOT NULL)
		GROUP BY g.Name, u.UserName, l.LitterId, l.Name)
				l
	LEFT JOIN 
		(SELECT l.LitterId, COUNT(*) MouseWithOutWeanDate
			FROM Litters l
				JOIN Mice m ON l.LitterId = m.LitterId
				JOIN Groups g ON l.GroupId = g.GroupId
				JOIN Users u ON g.LeaderId = u.Id
			WHERE
				l.DateDeleted IS NULL
				AND l.DeathDate IS NULL
				AND m.DateDeleted IS NULL
				AND m.DeathDate IS NULL
				AND
				(l.DateWeaned IS NULL
				AND m.WeanDate IS NULL)
			GROUP BY l.LitterId)
					j ON l.LitterId = j.LitterId
	LEFT JOIN 
		(SELECT l.LitterId, COUNT(*) MouseWithWeanDate
			FROM Litters l
				JOIN Mice m ON l.LitterId = m.LitterId
				JOIN Groups g ON l.GroupId = g.GroupId
				JOIN Users u ON g.LeaderId = u.Id
			WHERE
				l.DateDeleted IS NULL
				AND l.DeathDate IS NULL
				AND m.DateDeleted IS NULL
				AND m.DeathDate IS NULL
				AND
				(l.DateWeaned IS NULL
				AND m.WeanDate IS NOT NULL)
			GROUP BY l.LitterId)
					k ON l.LitterId = k.LitterId
{code}

{code:sql}
-- script for updating the mice that don't have a wean date that belong to a litter that has a wean date, this updates the mouse's wean date with the litter's wean date.
BEGIN TRAN
UPDATE m
	SET m.WeanDate = l.DateWeaned
--SELECT l.LitterId, ISNULL(l.Name, '') LitterName, l.DateWeaned LitterWeaned, ISNULL(m.Name, '') MouseName, m.WeanDate MouseWeaned
FROM Litters l
	JOIN Mice m ON l.LitterId = m.LitterId
WHERE
	l.DateDeleted IS NULL
	AND l.DeathDate IS NULL
	AND m.DateDeleted IS NULL
	AND m.DeathDate IS NULL
	AND
	((l.DateWeaned IS NOT NULL
	AND m.WeanDate IS NULL))
ROLLBACK
COMMIT
{code}

column1: Add Genotype Validation to Control Samples
column34:
Edit Order > Wellplate UI > Control

When a sample is marked as a control, validate the sample (mouse) has a genotype.
If the sample (mouse) does not have a genotype saved in Colony, warn the user that no genotype exists for the control sample. 
In the prompt, allow the user to set the genotype from the Order page.
If no genotype is entered, do not allow user to set sample as a control.

----
After discussion with JM et al, this will be coded to function exactly as QuickOrder for the 1.1 MVP. The user will be able to select from the Control Sample Results options:
* Unknown
* Carrier
* Non-Carrier
* Het
* Wild Type
* Hom Mutant

This will not accurately reflect a Colony genotype with multiple strain mutations. -cs

column152:
12/Mar/18 4:55 PM;bwinter;Validated all control results are available and can be selected for control results on the well plate UI. QA verified.

Spoke with [~admin], some of the features in the description require more business analysis and considerable recoding.  These features will be postponed to future release:

* when a sample is marked as a control, validate the sample (mouse) has a genotype.
* if the sample (mouse) does not have a genotype saved in Colony, warn the user that no genotype exists for the control sample. 
** in the prompt, allow the user to set the genotype from the Order page.
* If no genotype is entered, do not allow user to set sample as a control.

For Colony 1.1, the main feature will be to allow user to select control type from a drop-down when control is selected.

column1: Add Control/Omit Indicator to Wellplate UI
column34:
Edit Order > Wellplate UI

column1: Warn user about unassigned samples before submitting well plate order
column34:
_As a user submitting a wellplate for a genotyping order, I want to be warned about unassigned samples in the sample list before my wellplate order is submitted, so that I can have a chance to assign samples to wellplate wells in the event that I accidentally left some samples unassigned._

+Acceptance Criteria+:

* When samples are left unassigned in the sample list and the wellplate order is submitted, then display warning message to user notifying them that some samples are left unassigned and asking them to continue with submission or cancel and go back to order
* When the user chooses to go back to order, auto-filter samples list by Unassigned and expand all strain groups so that the user can scroll and see all the unassigned samples across strains.

+Warning Message+:

"Some samples were not assigned to the wellplate.
Continue anyway?"
| Cancel | Continue |

+Scenario+: _submitting order with unassigned samples_
*Given* that I am at the wellplate order page
*And* that I leave some samples unassigned 
*When* I click the button to submit the wellplate order
*Then* I am prompted with the +Warning Message+

+Scenario+: _Clicking Continue from Warning Message prompt_
*Given* that I am prompted with the +Warning Message+
*When* I click Continue 
*Then* I am taken to the Order Finalization page

+Scenario+: _Clicking Cancel from Warning Message prompt_
*Given* that I am prompted with the +Warning Message+
*When* I click Cancel
*Then* I am taken back to the Wellplate Order page
-*And* I am presented with a sample list filtered by Unassigned-
-*And* every strain with Unassigned samples has been expanded-

23/Jan/18 4:28 PM;rjonakin;[~qevans]
[~jmedlock]
[~admin]
[~jcox]
[~tpatterson]

If we fix the Genotype structure here, like fixing the way inconclusive is displayed, we need to fix that else where in the app. So it is consistent throughout the app.

This includes anywhere geneotypes or gene results may be displayed and can include inconclusive. The Mouse List is one place where genotypes are displayed and this can be changed. Another place is when the user assigns genotypes manually to a mouse, "inconclusive" is an option to choose. Should that now become the text that is specified to replace inconclusive? I think it should be the same throughout the application, but I am not sure if the user sees the Gen Name with the Null Zero icon (ban Icon) that they will know that means something like inconclusive.

If a user chooses "inconclusive" as the option to represent that gene result in the genotype, but the see the Gene name and the +*[ban icon|https://www.google.com/search?source=hp&ei=tLNnWuDMIcuCjwOFn5W4BQ&q=ban+icon&oq=ban+icon&gs_l=psy-ab.3..0l3j0i22i30k1j0i22i10i30k1j0i22i30k1l5.2002.4643.0.5033.10.9.0.0.0.0.150.919.0j7.8.0....0...1c.1.64.psy-ab..2.8.1031.6..46j35i39k1j0i131k1j0i20i264k1j0i131i20i264k1j0i67k1j0i46k1j0i3k1j0i10k1.114.5fSHlbju7fI]*+ next to it, I am not sure that is intuitive for meaning the same thing. Also, that icon is used universally as the symbol for banning things (think of no smoking signs).

Also, I may run into trouble trying to stick that ban icon, or any icon, into the input drop down element. So could we stick to a more simple text solution, maybe something like *Gene Name <inconclusive>* (with inconclusive in superscript)?

column163:
07/Feb/18 11:48 AM;rjonakin;[~jcox] [~jmedlock] [~qevans]

Jeff.
Yes, they make sense. I can do this.

I looked into the genotype drop down and I should be able to get that element working with this update as well. Like I was stating before, if we make this change for inconclusive in one place in the application, then I think it should be done everywhere, otherwise it could be confusing. So I will work on the drop down as well.

Another thing is that the "Inconclusive" gene result option *IS editable*. So this poses an issue. First, the way we would have to handle the Icon is different than how we handle the other gene results currently (including inconclusive). If we allow them to change the  result from the new Gene<Null Zero Icon> format, then the code will become very tedious and way more prone to breaking. I suggest if we make this change to showing Gene<Null Zero Icon> for inconclusive, then we make the inconclusive gene result immutable application wide. This will make the code around this feature a lot less brittle, and inconclusive will *always* look the same for every user and group in our application.

column1: Modify Assign Result Functionality
column34:
Order > Test Results

Upon review, user can choose to assign genotypes to samples by checking the Assign box for each applicable row and saving the screen with the "Assign Genotypes to Mice" button.

* Add another column called "Manual Selection". Change "Assign" header to "TYX Genotype"
* Change the "TYX Genotype" checkbox to a radio button, with the user being able to select either "TYX Genotype" or "Manual Selection"
* Auto-select each row to the "TYX Genotype" radio option. "Translated Genotype Result" field will be read-only.
* If the user select the "Manual Selection" radio, change the read-only "Translated Genotype Result" field to the multi-select genotype drop-down. User can then select any genotype from the list.
* Auto-fill the multi-select genotype drop-down with the TYX suggested genotype (including partial/inconclusive genotypes- see below).
* *Add another column called Opt Out, which will add a 3rd option to the radio buttons. "Translated Genotype Result" field will gray out any genotypes from the view, signifying to the user a genotype is not applied.*
* Move "Assign Genotypes to Mice" button to align with the Assign column on the bottom right of the screen.
* Upon selection of "Assign Genotypes to Mice" button, record any "TYX Genotype" selections as genotypes assigned by Transnetyx, and record any "Manual Selection" selections as genotypes assigned by the logged in user. *If the "Opt Out" radio is selected, do not assign any genotypes for that record.*

*Add tool tips for each radio button column header:*
* *Manual Selection: "Selecting this option will allow you to apply a different genotype than the Transnetyx converted genotype(s)."*
* *TYX Genotype: "Selecting this option will apply the Transnetyx converted genotype(s) to the mouse."*
* *Opt Out: "Selecting this option will not apply a genotype to the mouse at this time."*

Side Note on Partial Genotypes:
We are defining partial genotype when a strain contains more than one gene, and a genotype can be reported for at least one, but not all genes on the strain. Genotypes that cannot be reported are due to one of the following: undetermined result, not all probes run, or impossible result.

*When the "Opt Out" option is selected for the row, gray out any genotypes.*
When the "TYX Genotype" option is selected for the row, show the partial genotype as a read-only field.
When the "Manual Selection" option is selected for the row, show the partial genotype in the multi-select drop-down as follows:
* In the drop-down, auto-select any genotypes (per each gene) that can be calculated from the +/- results.
* In the drop-down, auto-select Inconclusive for any genotypes (per each gene) that cannot be calculated from the +/- results.

column1: Add "Help" Icon when Inconclusive Results Returned
column34:
Order > Test Results

Add "Help" icon to the right of any row that displays an inconclusive genotype. Icon should be a question mark with hover text.
Hover text needs to display the reason the user is receiving an inconclusive genotype for a sample. It will be one of the three scenarios:
* Not all probes were run
* Results returned with an undetermined code
* Impossible results returned

Per Jordan's comment below, the hover text should have a bold header that reads:
"Reason for Inconclusive Result:"

column1: Add "Add to Cull List" Functionality to Test Results
column34:
Order > Test Results

Add a new column to the Test Results view so that a user can add any of the samples (mice) run on the order to the cull list.
* Name the column "Add to Cull List?"
* Add a checkbox per row. Automatically set the checkboxes to empty.
* Add a select all box at the top next to the "Add to Cull List?" header. If selected, each row's check box will be selected. If deselected (from selection on), each row's check box will be de-selected. 
* Upon selecting the "Assign Genotypes to Mice" button, if the "Add to Cull List?" checkbox is selected for any rows, pop up the Add to Cull List modal that is used at the cage level (see screenshot-1), listing all samples/mice marked to cull. From this modal, user can deselect/select and Update the Cull List.
* Any mice added to the cull list from this modal should be added to the Cull Mice list modal, accessed from the Dashboard (see screenshot-2).

column1: Reconcile Dashboard Counts with List Counts
column34:
Reconcile counts of items on dashboard with the list counts, both on web and iOS.

I am seeing a discrepancy on the staging server for Bush Lab group. 

Dashboard:
iOS 27
Web 28

Breeding List:
iOS 27
Web 27

*Update the dashboard Mouse count to remove mice that have been transfered. This includes the bar chart counts. They should not include the transfered mice.*


----
*List of changes for this ticket - Rich*
* Dashboard Page
** Reworked the queries for the dashboard: simplified the EF query and eliminated a SQL call to a Ranges view
** Updated the queries for the counts/stats so that they use the same logic as the dashboard and the lists, specifically the Mice count and the Litters count.
**  Updated the Breedings part of the query to get it to ignore breedings without an Offsprings Settings record
** Created a post deployment script to soft delete breedings and litters that do not have an offspring settings record
* Strain Dashboard page
** Updated the queries for the counts/stats so that they use the same logic as the dashboard and the lists, specifically the Mice count and the Litters count.
* Add Breeding and Add and Edit Litter
** Modified the server side code so that when there is an error is trying to save any part of the data back to the database that the application throws and logs an error
** Also wrapped all of the processes for saving data to the database in a Sql Transaction. This will help with data integrity for these processes in the unlikely event that parts of save succeed and parts of the save fail for some reason.
* iOS Sync API for Strains, Breedings and Litters (and OffspringSettings)
** Rearranged some of the code so that for Strains, Breedings and Litters, there is a check to make sure that there is an corresponding OffspringSetting record for every entity to be created

column1: Update Web Sync API to handle Orders/OrderWellplates/OrderSamples
column34:
_As a mobile user, I need my data to stay in sync with the cloud so that my mobile device is as current as possible._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* The Web Sync API includes syncing data in the following tables:
*# Orders
*# OrderWellPlates
*# OrderSamples


+Notes from Tyler+:

* The mobile client will need to fetch/GET these records via the normal DateCreated/DateModified/DateDeleted and GroupId filters.
* The mobile client will also need to be able to create/POST these record types as part of the sync process.
* The DTO objects for these record types will include the GUID (Gid) instead of the integer (Id)


Each of these tables has an integer based primary key. This is different than the rest of the database tables which use GUIDs for PK. To allow for the disconnected nature of the mobile device we must have a GUID on the row. To accomplish this, we are going to have both 'Id' (int, PK) and 'Gid' (uniqueidentifier) on each of these 3 tables. The mobile clients will only use the 'Gid', therefore, when processing sync data for these record types, the sync logic must search by 'Gid' to fetch the necessary relationships and then insert the appropriate 'Id' into foreign keys. 

+Scenario+:
* Sync data includes 1 Order (Gid ABC), 1 OrderWellplate (Gid DEF), and 2 OrderSamples (Gid GHI, JKL).
* The Sync data for the OrderSamples will include foreign keys (OrderWellplateGid = DEF, OrderGid = ABC).
* The web processing will have to first insert the Order (Id 222) to obtain an Id/PK, then insert the OrderWellplate (id 333), and then while processing the OrderSamples, fetch the appropriate Order and OrderWellplate by Gid, so that it can insert the OrderSample with the correct foreign keys (OrderWellplateId = 333, OrderId = 222).

column1: Cannot link strain in Strain Wizard when only one strain available from Quick Order (QO) - Strain Wizard stops at Step 1
column34:
h1. What happened:

# As a Colony user, I had *no* linked strains in Colony
# As a QO user, I had *no* strains in QO (QA2)
# As an ORMA user, I copied *one* strain already in ORMA to my QO account
# As a Colony user, I linked my Colony account to my QO account
# As a Colony user...
# Navigated to Strains dashboard
# Clicked Link Strains button
# Strain Wizard displayed only one strain
** *Note:* when only *one* strain in QO, then Step 1 of Wizard does not display Select Strain drop-down; instead the single strain is displayed in read-only field
# Clicked Next to go to Step 2
# Nothing happened
** *Note:* Rich observed that when only 1 strain in QO, then Colony does not send *SelectedOrderManagerStrainId* via POST method.

h1. What I expected to happen:

* When I only have *one* strain in my QO account, I expected Step 1 Wizard to auto-select the one strain and allow me to click next to get to Step 2 of the Wizard.

Note from Dev: The work for this ticket was completed in COMA2268

column1: Alphabetize Group Names in the group selector
column34:
_As a customer support team member, i need the group list to be sorted by name, so that I can quickly find the customer's group to support them efficiently._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* The group selection list (Area where active group can be changed) per the image attached should be in alphabetical order
* The group list in the account section should be in alphabetical order per section (my groups, the groups I am enrolled in)

+Scenario+:
*Given* I am changing groups
*When* I select the group list
*Then* The list should be in alphabetical order

+Scenario+:
*Given* I am reviewing the account group section
*When* I view the group list
*Then* the group list should be in alphabetical order
*AND* continue to be sectioned between my groups and enrolled in groups


 !Group List.png|thumbnail! 

 !Group List in user setttings.png|thumbnail!
column72: 22/Feb/18 9:33 AM;bwinter;passed - groups in alphabetical order in account mgmt - 2018-02-22 09_13_48-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/25963/passed+-+groups+in+alphabetical+order+in+account+mgmt+-+2018-02-22+09_13_48-.png

column1: Mouse List:  Improved Sorting
column34:
_As a user, I want sorting on the mouse list to be more intuitive so that I can more easily find the mice I'm looking for._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Remove MouseID as the default sort when user selects a column to sort on.
* When the user selects a column to sort on, it now sorts only on that column, NOT on Mouse ID first and THEN that column.
* When the data is first sent to the Kendo grid, have the data sorted by MouseID on the server side and remove default Kendo sort.
column69: 29/Mar/18 5:39 PM;bwinter;PASSED - improved sorting on mice liste - 2018-03-29 17_36_49-.png;https://transnetyx.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/26482/PASSED+-+improved+sorting+on+mice+liste+-+2018-03-29+17_36_49-.png
column151:
21/Feb/18 12:07 PM;bkoch;[~jmedlock], after more research, I found some super wonky behavior with this.  In removing the kendo sort and moving it server side, the resulting functionality is as follows:

1. the majority of mice are sorted correctly by mouseName
2. the second element in the list is moved to the middle of the list randomly
3. the element that was at the middle of the list, was moved to the end

So, we can keep this ticket as removing the default kendo sort and adding it server side, but know there is a bug in the kendo grid that causes this strange behavior to happen.  If you want a demo showing the results, let me know.
column152: 29/Mar/18 5:41 PM;bwinter;Improved sorting on Mice List appears to be sorting as expected: send data to Kendo grid with mice sorted by Mouse ID (sorted from the client side); when sorting a column sort by the column instead of sorting by mouse id then that column.

column1: Mouse List: Search Add visible columns
column34:
_As a user I need to be able to search the mouse list for data in any column visible so that the search is relevant to what I am looking for._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Users should only search the current columns and filters. Do not remove filters on search.
* A Message in the search box should instruct the user on what is being searched. (Message in search box, "Search filtered data and visible columns")
* If a column is added to the view, that column should be included in the search.
column151: 21/Feb/18 4:00 PM;bkoch;[~jcox] [~jmedlock], it seems when we add a decent amount of columns to the search, the performance is slightly worse.  Can we change this to search on blur instead of on keyup?
column152: 22/Feb/18 10:09 AM;jcox;[~bkoch], Yeah if performance on keyup is detrimental to the user experience then let's try using on blur.  As long as the search is performed when the user hits enter, or tabs/clicks out of the field.

column1: Modify Link QO Account Suggestion if No QO Account Found
column34:
Account Management > Profile > Automated Genotyping

If signed-in user's email is associated with a valid QO account, user is prompted to link to that QO account, displaying the email address.

If email is not associated with a QO account, language needs to be changed to prompt user to register for a QO account and should not show an toggle option to link accounts. 

Language to use has been provided by Todd and Jordan and is attached in the Word file on this ticket.  In the situation where an "a" and a "b" text option is provided, they would like to know if we can do some A-B testing with the different versions of the text.  If we can't easily support that, then we need to stick with the "a" option provided in the doc.

Because of this, we may want to put in a change request to 

A. Remove the "Click here to learn more" link that activates the modal that references the toggle switch
B. Change the language for the modal to better instruct the user on how to link their accounts when they do not have a QO account.

I stumbled across this link while testing and asked Jim for clarity before realizing that it was related to this ticket.  I asked him via comments section of this card's parent ticket.   Jim suggested to remove the link (Choice A above).  Let me know if you wanted me to put in the change request.

column1: Add Account Linking Marketing to Strain Dashboard
column34:
Strain Dashboard > Strain Details
Strain Dashboard > Genotype Settings

We currently have prompting language for the user to link their strain inside the strain dashboard, but it assumes the group owner has already linked their QO account. The other scenarios we must consider are:
When the current logged in user is the Group Owner:

* Group owner does not have a QO account, and therefore cannot link on the account or strain levels. 
** Prompt user to register for QO.
* Group owner has a QO account, but has not linked on the account level. 
** Prompt user to link to their QO account.
*** If the Group Owners QO account is found to be disabled during the linking process, notify the user and instruct them to contact Customer Service
* Group owner has a QO account and has previously completed the linking process (current functionality)
** Display the existing strain linking UI cues to ALL group users. (current functionality)

Language to use has been provided by Todd and Jordan and is attached in the Word file on this ticket. In the situation where an "a" and a "b" text option is provided, they would like to know if we can do some A-B testing with the different versions of the text. If we can't easily support that, then we need to stick with the "a" option provided in the doc.

Upon sign-on and active group selection, evaluate the current users account status and display appropriate messaging based on criteria above.

Notes from dev:
* On looking up a user in OM to see if they have an account, we will be querying the OM Users table for the Group Leader's email address. There is an IsActive flag on that table that does enable/disable the user. I am going to modify the look up and the logic on the page(s) to handle if the user's account is there, but is inactive as well. Here is what I have on the the user's Account Management page when the user's account is InActive. The Support link pops up the SnapEngage chat client. !When QO User Account is InActive.png|thumbnail! 
* Also, I spoke the Jim, and for this implementation, if the current user is the leader of the group and the group is not currently linked to QO, then I will update the couple places on the Strain page so that the user is provided a link to their Account Group Management page. That page already includes most of the language and logic on it for handling the user and getting them signed up with QO and linked to QO.

* *_Current logic and Screenshots for a selected Strain (Strain Dashboard Page):_*
** If the current group leader's account is NOT linked to QO, Note that the Learn More button redirects the user to their Account Management (profile) page where the logic below applies based on who the user is an what state the account linking is in.
*** Strain Details section  !10 screenshot strain details Leader account not linked.png|thumbnail! 
*** Genotype Settings section  !11 screenshot genotype settings leader account not linked.png|thumbnail!
** else (the current group leader's account is linked to QO,
*** Strain Details section  !12 screenshot strain details leader account is linked.png|thumbnail! 
*** Genotype Settings section  !13 screenshot genotype settings leader account is linked.png|thumbnail! 

* *_Current logic and Screen shots for the Account Management page:_*
** If the current user isn't the leader for the active group
*** If the active group leader is successfully linked to Quick Order
****  !1 screenshot.png|thumbnail! 
*** else (the active group leader is not successfully linked to Quick Order meaning anything less that leader account linked and email confirmed) 
****  !2 screenshot.png|thumbnail! 
*** if the current user is the leader for any groups
**** the text with the red braces around it in the previous screen shots would show if this is true, else it would not show
** else if the current user is a QuickOrder user (and they ARE the leader for the active group)
*** If the current user's QuickOrder account is active
**** If the current user's account is linked and the email is confirmed
*****  !3a screenshot.png|thumbnail! 
**** else (the current user's account is linked but the email is not confirmed)
*****  !3 screenshot.png|thumbnail! 
**** else the current user's account is active but not linked
*****  !4 screenshot.png|thumbnail! 
*** else (the current user's QuickOrder account is not active)
****  !6 screenshot.png|thumbnail! 
** else (the current user is the leader for the active group and they are not a QuickOrder user)
***  !7 screenshot.png|thumbnail! 

----
Technical Design:

The account management module has most of the account linking validation mentioned above solved for. See the AccountController > UpdateProfle method and CodeService.AccountMethods.GetAccountManagementModel()

The account management page would be the place to handle QO lockout, since they should be in that UI by that point in the user workflow.

column151:
12/Feb/18 8:02 AM;rwilliams;[~qevans] [~jmedlock] I think this ticket needs some additional work. The ticket itself rightly talks about the Group owner and their QO account, however, the attached document provided only talks about the current user and their QO account. The document specifies that their be links for the user to sign up for QO or to link their account, but those scenarios/links are only applicable when the current user IS the Group owner. We need to also know what to do with the scenarios of when a user is NOT the group owner. 
Scenarios:
* Current User is Group Owner (The attachment covers these)
** Current user has a QO account, but it is not currently linked to their Colony Account
** Current user does not have QO account
* Current User is NOT Group Owner (The attachment doesn't cover these)
** Group user has a QO account, but it is not currently linked to their Colony Account
** Group user does not have QO account

In addition, there is  some language about "a" and "b" text options in the ticket. I see a "1a" and a "1b" in the ticket and I assume that is the a/b being referred to, but I don't understand what the difference is and when to use one versus the other. I just need some clarification on that.

column155:

This ticket conflicts with an existing decision to not allow strain linking UI elements when the group owner has not linked their account. If we need advertising on the strain page that Account Linking is a thing, we need to build a story around that problem.
column156:
13/Feb/18 11:22 AM;tpoley;Hey all,

column157:
13/Feb/18 12:11 PM;admin;[~rwilliams]

Most of the changes to this story are about who see's what, when. The new functionality would be group owner only. The existing functionality would continue to be all users.
column158: 16/Feb/18 9:16 AM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] [~qevans] I scratched my head on this ticket for a couple days trying to work through what exactly to do with it and at this point I am calling it completed. I have a feeling that we may want marketing to look at and possibly suggest some changes, but I think at this point we have all the data that we need to be able to modify this for pretty much however we want to handle this in the future. I have documented the way that I have it working above in the details of the ticket along with screen shots to make it easier to see and evaluate what I have done. There are two main parts to the changes, one is the changes made on the Strains Dashboard page, and those changes are pretty simple. The other is the Account Management (user profile) page, where all of the information and logic are intended to lead the user to get the automated genotyping setup. It is fairly complex based on the different scenarios that are possible.

column1: Breedings list filters active breedings by default
column34:
_As a user, I want the breedings list to filter on active breedings by default._

*Acceptance Criteria*:
* When browsing to the breedings list, the listed breedings filter on active breedings only by default.
column151: 16/Jan/18 4:57 PM;rwilliams;[~jcox] [~jmedlock] Is there a definitive definition of Active for Breeding?
column152: 16/Jan/18 5:04 PM;jmedlock;[~rwilliams] and [~jcox] It appears the code that generates the count on the web dashboard and iOS dashboard defines an active breeding. The list of breedings has 3 filter options under status(active, retired, requested) If we use the status (active) filter, this matches the dashboard. If we set the breeding list default filter to status active and remove the current filter on the breeding list which is looking for retired date, then this should satisfy the ticket.

column1: Prompt User to Update Default Strain Settings on First Save of Strain
column34:
_As a new user, when I create the first strain within my group, I want to be prompted to make those settings the default settings for the group._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* When a user creates the very first strain within a group in Colony, they are prompted to save that strain's settings as the group default settings.
column151:
16/Jan/18 11:01 AM;tpatterson;In an effort to not be obnoxious, how do we feel about adding a bit of functionality to our notifications for this situation? Currently we have notifications that fade in and fade out after a few seconds. They only inform and can be dismissed via the "x" button. To demo what I'm talking about, [click here|http://byrushan.com/projects/ma/1-5-2/jquery/notification-dialog.html]. If we could add a button or hyperlink to the end of the notification phrase, it might be the subtle push that could guide the user in a better direction. This is very similar to what Gmail does when emails have been sent. See the picture below for more context. Anyway, thoughts? [~jmedlock][~jcox][~admin]

 !screen shot 2013-12-03 at 7.45.20 pm.png|thumbnail!
column152: 24/Jan/18 2:24 PM;jcox;[~tpatterson] I, for one, REALLY like that approach.  It's unobtrusive but gets the job done.
column153: 08/Feb/18 10:46 AM;jcox;We need more info before moving forward with this ticket.
column154: 15/Feb/18 8:44 AM;cleduc;I like either having two Save buttons to choose from (like Apply to New Records or Apply to New and Update Existing) or what Ted suggested with the functional notification. The issue it might create is users wanting an easy way to see the records that will be updated before deciding but that can be handled later or in training to use existing filtering and views.
column155: 25/May/18 3:19 PM;cleduc;[~jcox] I went back over this ticket in my 1.3 review.  I think I answered the whole cascading updates question in the above comment rather than the exact ticket.  Anyway, I think just a toggle for "use as new strain default settings" is good. We can prompt as Ted suggested but that may not fit in 1.3. No need to cascade anywhere exisiting at this point. What do you think of moving out to 1.4?

column1: Retired Breeders: Breeding record, Breeding list
column34:
_As a user, I need to see all the breeders on the breeding record and breeding list, if they are active or retired/dead._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Active and retired breeder "mouse cell" are visible on the breeding card
* Active and retired/dead breeder mice are visible on the breeding list in the correct parent columns

column1: Offspring Settings: ID toggle switch
column34:
_As a user, when I toggle the ID switch to on or off, the auto serialize option should also toggle on or off, respectively, so that my effort is reduced and the ID toggling ID switch on or off more accurately reflects my selection._

*NOTE*: When ID switch is off at the Breedings > Offspring Settings & Litters > Offspring Settings levels, I expect Auto-Serializing to stop, but auto-serializing IDs still occurs at the ID Stage of the Litter Workbench.

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* A user can turn off the ID feature with a single click from the offspring settings anywhere the offspring settings are displayed to the user.

+Scenario+:
*Given* I am editing the Offspring Settings for a strain, breeding, or litter
*When* I toggle the ID switch to on or off
*Then* The auto serialization switch should also toggle in the same direction as the ID switch.

*This is an area we need to coordinate with iOS functionality* According to Florin, the iOS already behaves according to the above user story and acceptance criteria.

*Offspring task areas to adjust*
* Strains
* Breedings
* Litters

column1: Prompt user to delete empty cage
column34:
_As a user, I want to be prompted to delete a cage whenever I take an action that empties *the last mouse or litter in the cage*, so that my effort is reduced._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* When a user takes an action on the last mouse in a cage, the user is prompted to delete the cage.
* When a user takes an action on the last litter record in a cage, the user is prompted to delete the cage.

+Background+: _selecting last Mouse in a cage from Mice List_
*Given* I select a mouse from the Mice List
*And* this mouse is the last one in a cage

+Scenario+: _Transfer last mouse_
*When* I transfer the mouse to another owner
*Then* I am prompted to delete the now empty cage.

+Scenario+: _Mark Dead last mouse_
*When* I mark the mouse dead
*Then* I am prompted to delete the now empty cage.

+Background+: _Bulk actions from Cage Card_
*Given* I select a cage from the Cage Map

+Scenario+: _Bulk mark dead mice in cage_
*When* I bulk mark dead all mice in the cage
*Then* I am prompted to delete the now empty cage.

+Scenario+: _Bulk transfer mice in cage_
*When* I bulk transfer all mice in the cage
*Then* I am prompted to delete the now empty cage.

+Scenario+: _Prompt user to delete *one* empty cage using a modal_
*Given* only _*one*_ cage has been emptied from transferring or marking mice dead
*When* prompted to delete an empty cage
*Then* the prompt says "Cage <Cage ID> is now empty.  Would you like to remove this cage?"
*And* the user is given two buttons "No" "Yes" (in this order) to choose from

+Scenario+: _Prompt user to delete *many* empty cages using a modal_
*Given* _*many*_ cages have been emptied from selecting multiple mice in Mice List
*And* transferring or marking mice dead
*When* prompted to delete many empty cages
*Then* the prompt says "Cages <Cage ID1, Cage ID2, ..., Cage IDN> are now empty. Would you like to remove these cages?"
*And* the user is given a list of Cages and checkboxes to un-check which ones to keep <- {color:#d04437}NEW{color} (See comments from 07-31-2018)
*And* all cages are checked by default  <- {color:#d04437}NEW{color} (See comments from 07-31-2018)
*And* the user is given two buttons "No" "Yes" (in this order) to choose from

+Scenario+: _Click anywhere outside of modal prompt_
*Given* I am prompted to delete an empty cage
*When* I click anywhere outside of the modal prompt
*Then* I am taken back to the Mice List 
*And* the empty cage is *not* deleted
*And* the cage card map icon can still be seen from the Cage Map in its corresponding position on its parent Rack in its parent Room  

+Scenario+: _Click No to delete empty cage_
*Given* I am prompted to delete an empty cage
*When* I click No from the prompt
*Then* I am taken back to the Mice List 
*And* the empty cage is *not* deleted
*And* the cage card map icon can still be seen from the Cage Map in its corresponding position on its parent Rack in its parent Room  

+Scenario+: _Click Yes to delete empty cage_
*Given* I am prompted to delete an empty cage
*When* I click Yes from the prompt
*Then* I am taken back to the Mice List 
*And* the (selected) empty cage(s) is (are) deleted  <- {color:#d04437}NEW{color} (See comments from 07-31-2018)
*And* the cage card map icon is replaced with the empty cage icon in its corresponding position on its parent Rack in its parent Room  

-----

h1. Housekeeping Notes

h2. Notes to DEV + SQA

This story *clones* a functionality in iOS where the user is prompted to delete an empty cage after taking any action that empties a cage in Colony (see CMI-193).
 
h2. Touch Points where Mouse Record can be Marked Dead or Transferred
Below are all the *touch points* where a Mouse Record can be *Marked Dead* or *Transferred* one-at-a-time.  

  - Breedings > Select Breeding > Parents Tab > Select Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Breedings > Select Breeding > Offspring Tab > Select Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Breedings > Select Breeding > Litter Tab > Select Litter Record (pulls up Litter Details) >Select Parent Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Breedings > Select Breeding > Litter Tab > Select Litter Record (pulls up Litter Details) >Select Offspring Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Litters > Select Litter > Select Parent Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Litters > Select Litter > Select Offspring Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Mice > Select Mice > Mark Dead
  - Mice > Select Mouse > View Mouse Record > Mouse Record Details 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Mice > Select Mouse > View Mouse Record > Edit Mouse > Enter & Save Death date
  - Mice > Select Mouse > View Mouse Record > Edit Mouse > Enter & Save Transfer date
  - Mice > Select Mouse > View Mouse Record > Parents Mouse 3-dots (if available) > View Record > Mouse Record Details 3-dots > Mark Dead 
  - Cages > Select Cage > Cage Details 3-dots > (Bulk) Mark Dead
  - Cages > Select Cage > Mouse Record 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Cages > Select Cage with litter > Litter Record 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Cages > Select Mouse > Mouse 3-dot menu > Delete mouse (if mouse is not in breeding)
  - Cages > Select Mouse > Mouse 3-dot menu > Mark Dead
  - Cages > Select Mouse > View Mouse Record > Edit Mouse > Enter & Save Death date
  - Cages > Select Mouse > View Mouse Record > Edit Mouse > Enter & Save Transfer date
column151: 16/Jan/18 2:51 PM;tpatterson;My initial thoughts on this are similar to that of COMA-2256. If we're not good with what I proposed there, while it could pretty jarring, this might be a situation to use a modal. Either way these need to appear after the user has completed a task on the list and profile pages or after the user has clicked anything that allows them to navigate out of the workbench.
column152: 31/Jul/18 1:22 PM;jadhikari;[~bwinter] Should we consider allowing the user to keep or have an option to keep cages when mice(bulk) are marked dead ? Just like in the Mark Dead modal, we will have list of Cage with options Delete and Keep. I might be overthinking but wanted to see what you thought.
column153:
31/Jul/18 3:50 PM;bwinter;Great idea, [~jadhikari]!  I love it!  Let's ask [~cleduc]!

[~cleduc], when a user takes an action that removes mice from many cages, would you like the user to prompted to remove _all_ the cages or to have a _choice_ (via checkbox) to select which cages to delete?

As is, the requirements are to simply remove all cages (yes or no).  See scenario below.  The user cannot cherry-pick which cages to keep.  [~jadhikari] said it would take about a day more to allow the user to select which cages to keep (vs remove all cages if the user selects yes).

+Scenario+: _Prompt user to delete *many* empty cages using a modal_
*Given* _*many*_ cages have been emptied from selecting multiple mice in Mice List
*And* transferring or marking mice dead
*When* prompted to delete many empty cages
*Then* the prompt says "Cages <Cage ID1, Cage ID2, ..., Cage IDN> are now empty. Would you like to remove these cages?"
*And* the user is given two buttons "No" "Yes" (in this order) to choose from
column154:
31/Jul/18 4:30 PM;cleduc;[~jadhikari] [~bwinter] I went back and forth as I don't know the real reason to leave an empty cage - except to refill them. This would mean they are using them like positions. 
But since Cage name is not unique anyway, this seems OK to me. 
I do like the idea that they are presented with the list and can select all or just some and am fine with a one day add. 

But then, if Jwala is looking for a 1.2 ticket and there are none she fits with...we'll grab one of my other favorites like display cage room rack position on cull and other lists...:)
column155: 31/Jul/18 5:06 PM;bwinter;[~cleduc], Roger that.  And thanks for taking my call to discuss more.  When [~jadhikari] gets to the part about prompting users to delete many cages, she will provide them with a check list to de-select which cages to NOT delete.
column156: 31/Jul/18 5:07 PM;cleduc;[~jadhikari][~bwinter] Nice! thanks so much Jwala!
column157:
07/Aug/18 1:37 PM;jadhikari;[~cleduc] I feel that this ticket is getting larger and larger as I keep working on it since in involves showing the user prompt for any action done on mice/litter/breeding that might empty a cage. 
I was talking to Rich and he shared a few ideas so that we can make this ticket more manageable on both development and testing :
# Break the ticket into smaller chunks

Please let me know what you think.

column158:
07/Aug/18 1:45 PM;cleduc;[~jadhikari] I think having the global setting is fine. We just need to allow for a cage to exist empty - meaning when created, before mice are added.  
We can auto delete cages that had mice which are all now dead, transferred, deleted or moved. 

If we hit a use case for needing the emptied cage we will deal with it. 
We need to look at iOS for functionality matching.

Do we rewrite this ticket?
cc: [~bwinter]
[~jcox]
column159:
07/Aug/18 2:01 PM;jcox;[~cleduc], [~jadhikari], [~bwinter], I'm just catching up on this comment chain and I feel like the scope increase is significant.

* If we want a global setting that deletes cages by default, that's cool, but that itself is a separate ticket.  And is that part of 1.2 (needed for go-live)?
* Selecting *which* cages to delete after a bulk update seems like a story beyond prompting to delete all or none.  If that really is a ~1 day additional effort like a previous comment says then we include it if [~cleduc] is comfortable with it.  Otherwise that should probably be it's own story as well.  

And yes, we definitely need to make sure we're matching up with iOS.

column1: Display Genotypes of Breeders on the Breeding List
column34:
_As a user, I need to see the genotypes of the mothers and fathers in the Breeding List so that I can more accurately set up breedings._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Breeding List displays genotypes of mothers and fathers.
* Sorting by genotypes of parents  (dam or sire)
* Include CageIDs associated with the Breeding (per Jim's comment below)

See attachments for examples from SmartSheet.

(Smartsheet: COMA58)
column151:
11/Jan/18 2:34 PM;jmedlock;[~jcox] we also need to add the list of cages associated to the breeding in a column called cage IDs. Would we include that in this story and change the scope? Basically we are adding 2 columns to the breeding list at this point from what is currently on the list.
Thanks,
Jim
column152:
19/Feb/18 3:14 PM;jcox;[~cleduc], [~jmedlock] and I were just discussing this ticket.  This is based on feedback from Veronica at UCSF and we're trying to figure out the problem that she's trying to solve with this suggestion. 

The complication with implementing the ticket as currently written is that we have a dynamically changing # of columns in our grid based on how many parents are included in the breeding.  

Could you help us better understand the problem so that we can come up with a more targeted solution?
column153:
20/Feb/18 9:02 AM;cleduc;The user wants a way to quickly evaluate what they have set up and how successful it is to determine what to set up next in order to achieve the genotypes they need.  

A few ideas:

* We put in one column where they see Expected Offspring Genotypes in a single column. 
* They click somewhere on the list and pop up all parents and their genotypes listed top to bottom.  
* We display genotypes next to the first two females and single male and beyond that would say view additional parental genotypes here...

A story:
Colony worker is asked to set up more breedings to produce more of a specific genotype. They want a way to view the genotypes of existing breedings to determine what they need to set up to fill the gap and to evaluate productivity by genotype to ensure they get their numbers.  They will use this view to determine what breeds well, large litters, and also what offspring genotypes to expect from the matings.
column154:
25/May/18 3:52 PM;cleduc;[~jmedlock], [~tpatterson]to cover the need right now, without a fancier tool can we 
* have a column for offspring strain 
* hover to display the genotypes of the parents
column155: 25/May/18 3:58 PM;jmedlock;[~cleduc] [~tpatterson] they want separate columns so they can sort and filter. If they are looking for breeders rearranging the breeding should help with this also. The current design of the breeding list is not friendly with this request. They want to see them all in line sort and filter the list by these columns.
column156: 25/May/18 5:53 PM;tpatterson;Without us attempting to redesign the list / table paradigm (one filterable item per cell) and since the user is wanting to filter multiple sets of data, I think that this problem could be solved by having the user drill into a breeding page that could easily display the genotypes applied to each parent. Also, we really want to stay away from important information being displayed in tooltips / popovers that aren't accessible on mobile devices.
column157: 29/May/18 8:34 AM;cleduc;[~tpatterson] [~jmedlock] Ted - when you have some time lets talk about it and then we can propose something to Jim (assuming Jim doesn't have time to talk with us)?
column158: 29/May/18 9:00 AM;tpatterson;Sounds good [~cleduc]!
column159:
30/May/18 9:50 AM;tpatterson;After talking with [~cleduc], we may want to create a set of columns that focus in on dam and sire IDs and genotypes. It could be as simple as allowing users to view "Dam 1 ID" column, "Dam 1 genotype" column, "Sire 1 ID" column, "Sire 1 ID" column, etc. Now, with harem breedings in mind, we might want to offer up the option of displaying another set of columns that would show information on a second dam or sire. In addition, if there was more than one dam or sire, we might want to place an indicator ( "..." or "collection" icon) that speaks to the fact that there is more to see.

Two examples of different scenarios is listed below:

There are more than one dam ID and genotype, but it currently not being shown:
||Mouse ID||Dam 1 ID||Dam 1 Genotype||Sire 1 ID||Sire 1 Genotype||
|[ID]|[ID][...]|[Genotype][...]|[ID]|[Genotype]|

There is more than one sire genotype and ID. They are both being shown:
||Mouse ID||Dam 1 ID||Dam 1 Genotype||Sire 1 ID||Sire 1 Genotype||Sire 2 ID||Sire 2 Genotype||
|[ID]|[ID][...]|[Genotype][...]|[ID][...]|[Genotype][...]|[ID][...]|[Genotype][...]|

Is there anything that would throw a wrench in this approach? [~jmedlock] [~rjonakin]

column1: Change scroll bar width to default width for browser
column34:
_As a user, I would like the scroll bars to be normal sizes so that I can more easily navigate my data._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Scroll bar sizing to be the default size for most browsers.

+Per Ted - Note for SQA+: 
Default browser values:
* OSX (Chrome, Safari, Firefox) - 15px
* Windows XP (IE7, Chrome, Firefox) - 17px
* Windows 7 (IE10, IE11, Chrome, Firefox) - 17px
* Windows 8.1 (IE11, Chrome, Firefox) - 17px
* Windows 10 (IE11, Chrome, Firefox) - 17px
* Windows 10 (Edge 12/13) - 12px
* Updating the scroll bar size to default or 15 px would make the site more user friendly on Kendo grids.

(Smartsheet: COMA146)
column151: 16/Jan/18 3:08 PM;tpatterson;These should be changed to their default appearances across browsers and devices. It makes sense to keep them at default because the user is already conditioned to each environment's scrolling look and feel.

column1: Mutation Genotype Order: Allow user to sort mutations
column34:
_As a user, i need the display order of genes, gene mutations, and genotypes to be consistent on the web and iOS apps._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Genotype sort order is consistent across all locations in both iOS and web apps.
* The gene order is alphabetized by gene name.
* Order alphabetically by gene name, then by zygosity, then by mutation name within zygosity.
* Zygosity = Homozygous -> Heterozygous - > Wild Type -> Inconclusive


+Examples:+
_First Gene_
_Trp53<brd>_ *First mutation*
_Trp53<tg1234>_  *second mutation*

_Second Gene_
_APC<min>_ *first mutation for APC*

+Genotype Order Examples:+
APC<min/min>
APC<min/WT>
APC<WT/WT>

Trp53<Brd/Brd>
Trp53<BRD/tg1234> *mutant1/mutant2*
Trp53<tg1234/tg1234> *second mutation*
Trp53<Brd/WT>
Trp53<tg1234/WT>
Trp53<WT/WT> *wild type/wild type*
Inconclusive *Always last*


+This change affects:+
* The strain dashboard genotype cards
* The genotype view for adding genotypes to:
* multiple mice from the mouse list
* pups on a litter
* The genotype drop down list on the add mouse form/Edit mouse form


(Smartsheet: COMA144, COMA71)

My understanding was that this only affect the order of the mutations on a gene. Other than that, my only other question at this point is where do we do the ordering and what should it look like. I know we talked about a couple options earlier, but I think we need to give a little more guidance in this ticket on that.

column1: Display mouse/litter/breeding age in weeks when older than 28 days
column34:
_As a user, I want to see *mouse age*, *litter age*, and *breeding time* ("age") in days until the 29 day, then from 29 days and beyond, I want to see them in weeks, so that I see age in terms of how we normally talk about them when managing the colony._

+Scenario+: _Display age_
*Given* the age of the {{<object>}} is equal to {{<days>}}
*When* the age is displayed
*Then* the age is displayed as {{<display_age>}}.

+Scenario+: _Sorting by age_
*Given* I am looking at a list with an {{<object>}} age column
*When* I sort the list by the age column
*Then* the age is sorting by the underlying age in days (e.g. this list is correctly sorted: {{1d, 2d, 5d, 6d, 28d, 5w, 6w, 28w}})

+Examples+:

|| {{object}} ||
| {{mouse}} |
| {{litter}} |
| {{breeding}} |

|| {{days}} || {{display_age}} ||
| {{1}} | {{1d}} |
| {{2}} | {{2d}} |
| {{...}} | {{...}} |
| {{28}} | {{28d}} |
| *{{29}}* | *{{5w}}* |
| {{30}} | {{5w}} |
| {{...}} | {{...}} |
| {{35}} | {{5w}} |
| *{{36}}* | *{{6w}}* |
| {{37}} | {{6w}} |
| {{...}} | {{...}} |
| {{42}} | {{6w}} |
| *{{43}}* | *{{7w}}* |
| {{44}} | {{7w}} |
| {{...}} | {{...}} |
| {{49}} | {{7w}} |
| {{...}} | {{...}} |

h1. Notes

* This task will assist the user visually in determining the age of mice in their colony. 
* Ages are generally referred to in weeks not days after the 28th day.

h1. Places that Display Age
Below are pages that display mouse/litter age

* Breedings > Breeding Details
** {color:#14892c}Banner > Active Age (of Breeding) - PASSED{color}
** {color:#14892c}Banner > Active Litter Ages - PASSED{color}
** {color:#14892c}Mouse Record(s) in Parent Tab - PASSED{color}
** {color:#14892c}Mouse Record(s) in Offspring Tab - PASSED{color}
* {color:#14892c}Breeding Wizard > Step 2 > Add Breeding Parents - PASSED{color} 
* {color:#14892c}Litters > Age column - PASSED{color}
* Litters > Litter Details
** {color:#14892c}Age detail in Litter Banner - PASSED{color}
** {color:#14892c}Mouse Record(s) in Parent Tab - PASSED{color}
** {color:#14892c}Mouse Record(s) in Offspring Tab - PASSED{color}
* Litters > Litter workbench 
** {color:#14892c}Age detail in Litter Banner - PASSED{color}
** {color:#14892c}Mouse Record(s) in Parent Group - PASSED{color}
** {color:#14892c}Mouse Record(s) in Offspring Group - PASSED{color}
* {color:#14892c}Mice > Age column - PASSED{color}
* {color:#14892c}Cages > Cage icon with litters - PASSED{color}
* Cages > Cage Details

column1: Add Existing Mice to Cage
column34:
_As a user, I want to add *existing* mice to a cage from the cage details modal, because it is convenient._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* When I open the Cage Details, then I can add existing mice to the cage from a new page that lists existing mice using an interface similar to the Add Breeding Parents view.  
* !addmice.JPG|thumbnail! 
* By default, the existing mice list should be filtered to only show mice that are not currently assigned a cage.
* -User can modify the filter to include mice that are NOT already assigned to a cage.-
* When user clicks the add button on a Mouse row, the row stays visible but indicates that the mouse is added.
* Users can remove/deselect mice that they have clicked Add on.
* -Users can sort the columns visible in this view.-
* When the user completes their selection they are returned to the cage map with the cage details view open to the cage they were just adding mice to.

+Task+: _Change "Add Mice" link to "Add New Mice"_

+Scenario+: _Add "Add Existing Mice" to Cage Details_
*Given* that I have accessed the Cage Details
*When* I click "Add Existing Mice" button
*Then* I am taken to an Add-Existing-Mice Mice List where I can filter by all filters currently on Mice List and search for mice
*And* the Add-Existing-Mice Mice List is -default- filtered by *alive* mice *without* an assigned cage
-*And* I can change the default filer if desired.-
*And* I can select multiple mice from the Add-Existing-Mice Mice List
*And* I am presented with a Add Mice button that adds mice to Cage

----

h1. Notes

h2. Already in iOS

This story already exists in iOS.  Below are the steps to add *existing* mice to a cage.

# from Dashboard, click *Cages* button > user taken to _Cage List_
# from _Cage List_, click *Add Mice* button/link on desired cage > _Actions_ modal pops up (see *IMG_0005.PNG*)
# from _Actions Modal_, click *Add Existing Mice* button > a _Select Mice_ modal pops up with *auto-filter* for _alive_ mice _without a cage_ (see *IMG_0006.PNG*)
# from _Select Mice_ modal, *select a mouse from auto-filtered list* or change filter to find desired mouse.

(Smartsheet: COMA317)

column153: 17/Jan/18 1:32 PM;tpatterson;[~jmedlock] & [~bwinter] - Since this could be a potentially confusing process, I'd recommend that if the user selects "Add Existing Mice" they are taken to another page where they are presented a limited view of the Mice List. From here they could select, deselect, filter, search, and (at the bottom of the page) save or cancel. Also, it would be extremely helpful on both platforms to see how many mice you've selected and, if it's possible, easily see which ones have been selected. Like I mentioned this is where a user may get lost or forget which mice they've selected, having some way to display the collection of mice they're currently considering to add to the cage would takes pressure off the user and keep them moving forward.
column154:
17/Jan/18 2:56 PM;bwinter;[~jmedlock], I second [~tpatterson]'s comment.

[~tpatterson], did you see the attached screenshots below from iOS? What would you keep and change about them to fit your idea?

!IMG_0005.PNG|thumbnail! 
!IMG_0006.PNG|thumbnail! 

[~tpatterson], correct me if I am wrong:  the UI for this card would require these 3 items below.

* use a page for mice selection (as opposed to modal view)
* show count of mice selected
* visualize mice selected---I think this is done in iOS with the left-hand column of circles which are filled when you select a mouse
column155: 17/Jan/18 3:30 PM;tpatterson;I did see those and you've definitely bulleted out what I suggested. I think that the iOS would also benefit from taking the user to another screen and having all real estate set aside to take the user through the adding process. With this approach, we'd have space to allow users to select mice, inform how many are selected, visualize which mice are selected and, finally, "map" or "add" mice to the cage. The only difference between what is currently being done (the users seeing the circle selections) and this last addition that I presented is that once a user has scrolled down enough or started another search, those selected mice will be out of view and could be forgotten or hard to find again. To keep our real estate in check, I think that a "Currently Selected" filter could help people quickly bring all their selections back into view again. I still think that this feature may be too hidden for most people to logically find it, but it could be a good first step.
column156: 07/Feb/18 4:48 PM;tpatterson;I've attached 2 mockups of some potential options for the add mouse to cage view. Clarification: the x icon would be used to clear all selections and the check icon could be used to only show currently selected mice. I'm not quite sure if using the check option is the best route, but the alternative would be to just include "view selected" and "view all" under filters. Thoughts?

column1: Mouse List: Selecting mice in the list, Paging
column34:
When selecting a mouse on the mouse list, the page "jumps" then users must select the mouse again.
* Go to mouse list
* Select a mouse
* The page jumps
* Then you must select the mouse again
Possibly the menu trying to load on the first click is experiencing an error.

When selecting the next page "click page 2", the list loads about mid way down. It should cycle to the top of the list.
* Go to mouse list
* scroll to bottom and click page 2
* The page load should be at the top.

column1: Add cull list filter to Cage Map & Mice List
column34:
_As a user, I want to filter the Cage Map or the Mice List by mice marked to be *culled* but not yet culled, so that I can see which mice are marked for culling but have not been culled yet._

+Acceptance Criteria+:

* From the Cage Map, when I filter cages by "Cull List", I get all the cages with mice marked to be culled but not yet culled.
* From the Mice LIst, when I filter mice by "Cull List", I get all the mice marked to be culled but not yet culled.

+Scenario+: _Filter cages by Cull List_
*Given* that I am on the Cage Map
*When* I filter cages by "Cull List"
*Then* cages are "highlighted" by those with at least one mouse marked for "Cull List" but not yet culled.

+Scenario+: _Filter Mice List by Cull List_
*Given* that I am on the Mice List
*When* I filter mice by "Cull List"
*Then* all mice marked for "Cull List" but not yet culled are displayed
*And* these {{<columns>}} are added to end of the list
*And* {{<columns>}} are sorted by Room then Rack then Position > Mouse ID

+Examples+:

|| {{columns}} ||
| {{Room}} |
| {{Rack}} |
| {{Position}} |
| {{DOD}} |

----

h1. Notes

Filter name: "Mice on cull list"

(Smartsheet: COMA179)
