column1: Modify the Add Mice form
column34:
_As a user, I want to quick-add mice to a strain or cage, so that I can quickly build up my colony to get started with the app._

+Acceptance Criteria+:

* When I click + button from Mice Panel on Dashboard, I want to be presented with a quick-add mice view.
* When I click "Add Mice" from a Cage, I want to be presented with a quick-add mice view.

+Scenario+: _"Quick-add" mice from Mice Panel on Dashboard_
*Given* I am at the Dashboard 
*When* I click the + button in the Mice Panel
*Then* I am presented with a Quick-Add mice page where mice can be added quickly to my colony by strain.

+Scenario+: _"Quick-add" mice from Cage Card_
*Given* I am at the Cage Map
*And* I click a Cage Icon to access the Cage Card
*When* I click Add Mice link
*Then* I am presented with a Quick-Add mice page where mice can be added quickly to my colony by strain.

+Scenario+: _Prompt user with "Quick-Add" page - from Cage Card_
*Given* that I have quick-added mice from Cage Card Panel
*When* I am presented with Quick-Add page
*Then* I can quickly set strain from strain drop-down
*And* I can quickly add mice data per row with 4 columns plus a button: *mouse id*, *genotype*, *sex*, *date of birth*, *remove button*
*And* I can quickly add mice row via "+ Add New Mouse" button
*And* I am presented with "Cancel" and "Save" buttons

+Scenario+: _Prompt user with "Quick-Add" page - from Mice Panel_
*Similar to* _Prompt user with "Quick-Add" page - from Cage Card_ \[differences in {color:#59afe1}blue{color}\]
*Given* that I have quick-added mice from Cage Card Panel
*When* I am presented with Quick-Add page
*Then* I can quickly set strain from strain drop-down
{color:#59afe1}*And* I can select cage from Cage drop-down{color}
*And* I can quickly add mice data per row with 4 columns plus a button: *mouse id*, *genotype*, *sex*, *date of birth*, *remove button*
*And* I can quickly add mice row via "+ Add New Mouse" button
*And* I am presented with "Cancel" and "Save" buttons

+Scenario+: _Select strain_
*Given* that I am presented with Quick-add page
*When* I select strain from from the Strain drop-down
*Then* the selected strain will be the assigned strain for each mouse added via Quick-Add page

+Scenario+: _Auto-fill Mouse ID_
*Given* that I am presented with Quick-add page
*When* I select strain from from the Strain drop-down
*Then* the Mouse ID is auto-filled (or not) according to the Offspring Settings set at the Strain Level

+Scenario+: _Auto-fill Mouse Genotype_
*Given* that I am presented with Quick-add page
*When* I select strain from from the Strain drop-down
*Then* the Mouse Genotype is auto-filled by first Genotype of the first Gene available for the selected strain
*And* the selected Mouse Genotype is displayed in the Mouse Genotype drop-down

+Scenario+: _Default state of Mouse sex is UNKNOWN_

+Scenario+: _Default state of Mouse Date of Birth sex is TODAY'S DATE_

+Scenario+: _Clicking remove button when there's only one row_
*Given* that I am presented with the Quick-add page
*And* there is only one new mouse row
*When* I click the remove button for the only row showing
*Then* the Quick Add page is cancelled
*And* I am taken back to previous page that called Quick-add page

+Scenario+: _Clicking "+ Add new mouse" button to add new mice_
*Given* that I am presented with the Quick-add page
*When* I click the "+ Add new mouse" button
*Then* a new mouse row is added
*And* Mouse ID is auto-filled (or not) according to Offspring Settings at Strain Level
*And* Mouse Genotype *copies previous* row's Genotype
*And* Mouse sex *copies previous* mouse's sex
*And* Mouse Date of birth *copies previous* mouse's date of birth

+Scenario+: _Clicking remove button when there's more than one row_
*Given* that I am presented with the Quick-add page
*And* more than one mouse row has been added
*When* I click the remove button for any mouse row (including the first row)
*Then* that mouse row is removed from Quick-Add page
*And* Mouse ID's for remaining rows are auto-filled again

+Scenario+: _Clicking Cancel button_
*Given* that I am presented with the Quick-add page
*When* I click the "Cancel" button
*Then* I am prompted with a modal to cancel or confirm cancellation

+Scenario+: _Clicking Save when coming from Cage Card_
*Given* that I am in the Cage Card view
*And* that I add mice to the Cage
*And* that I am presented with the Quick-add page 
*When* I click the "Save" button
*Then* all added mice are saved under that strain
*And* all added mice are added to that Cage

+Scenario+: _Clicking Save when coming from Dashboard Mice Panel_
*Given* that I am at the Dashboard
*And* that I click to add mice from the Mice panel + button
*And* that I am presented with the Quick-add page from the Cage Card view
*When* I click the "Save" button
*Then* all added mice are saved under that strain
*And* I am prompted to add created mice to a cage

+Scenario+: _Prompt user to add mice to a cage_
*Given* that I have successfully added mice to my colony from the Quick-add page
*When* I am prompted to Add Mice to a Cage
*Then* the prompt says "Would you like to add these mice to a cage?"
*And* the user is presented with two buttons "No" and "Yes"
*And* the user is presented with a small note at bottom of prompt stating "If no, then mice will be unassigned to a cage and can only be searched from Mice List by removing strain filter and sorting by Cage ID, where unassigned mice have a blank for the Cage ID."

+Scenario+: _Click No to Add Mice to Cage prompt_
*Given* that Add Mice to Cage prompt has been presented
*When* I click No button
*Then* add mice are created but are *not* assigned to a cage

+Scenario+: _Click Yes to Add Mice to Cage prompt_
*Given* that Add Mice to Cage prompt has been presented
*When* I click Yes button
*Then* I am redirected to Cage Workbench with all created mice added to a new cage

+Scenario+: _Click off Add Mice to Cage prompt modal_
*Given* that Add Mice to Cage prompt has been presented
*When* I click off the modal 
*Then* I am redirected to back to Quick-add mice page with all mice data still sitting there ready for me to take an action on it.

+Scenario+: _Clicking to change Mouse Genotype when strain has *{{one}}* gene with *{{n}}* allele combinations_
*Given* that I am presented with Quick-add page
*When* I select one {{<genotype>}} from the Mouse Genotype drop-down
*Then* the {{<selected result>}} is displayed in the Mouse Genotype drop-down

+Examples+:

|| {{genotype}} || {{selected result}}||
| {{Gene <allele combo 1>}} | {{*Gene* <allele combo 1>}} |
| {{Gene <allele combo 2>}} | {{*Gene* <allele combo 2>}} |
| {{...}} | {{...}} |
| {{Gene <allele combo n>}} | {{*Gene* <allele combo n>}} |

+Scenario+: _Clicking to change Mouse Genotype when strain has *{{two}}* genes with *{{n1}}* and *{{n2}}* allele combinations, respectively_
*Given* that I am presented with Quick-add page
*When* I select {{<Gene1 allele combo>}} and {{<Gene2 allele combo>}}from the Mouse Genotype drop-down
*Then* the {{<selected result>}} is displayed in the Mouse Genotype drop-down

+Examples+:

|| {{Gene1 allele combo}} || {{Gene2 allele combo}} || {{selected result}} ||
| *{{Gene1 <allele combo 1>}}* | {{Gene2 <allele combo 1>}} | {{*Gene1* <allele combo 1> *Gene2* <allele combo 1>}} |
| {{Gene1 <allele combo 1>}} | {{Gene2 <allele combo 2>}} | {{*Gene1* <allele combo 1>  *Gene2* <allele combo 2>}} |

column1: Transfer mice
column34:
_As a user, I want to be able to bulk transfer mice that are no longer in my colony, so that the Colony app reflects changes in my real-life colony_

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* User can multi select mice on the mouse list and select to change the status to "transferred" rather than one at a time. 

* When a user transfers one or more mice from the Mice List, those mice are marked as transferred and no longer show in the default filtered view of Mice List or any assigned cages.
* When a user transfers a Mouse from a Mouse Record 3-dot menu, then that mouse is marked as transferred and no longer show in the default filtered view of Mice List or any assigned cages..
* When a user selects bulk transfer for a cage, all *mice* are marked as transferred (removed from cage) and no longer appear on the 
** Cage Card or 
** Cage Icon of the Cage Map List.
* When a user transfers mice, mice counts for strains, breedings, litters, and cages should be accordingly decremented (where applicable).


+Scenario 1+: _Selecting mice from Mice List to transfer_
*Given* I am in the Mice List view
*When* I select one or more mice
*Then* I am shown a transfer button in Mice List Action Toolbar

+Scenario 2+: _Transferring mice_
*Given* I have selected one or more mice from Mice List
*When* I click the transfer button
*Then* selected mice are marked as transferred
*And* no longer show in default filtered view of Mice List
*And* no longer show in assigned cages (if any)

+Scenario 3+: _Filtering Mice List on transferred status_
*Given* that I have transferred several mice
*When* I filter Mice List on mice marked transferred
*Then* I am shown the transferred mice

+Scenario 4+: _Selecting Transfer option from a Mouse Record's 3-dot menu_
*Given* I have selected Mouse Record from {{<view>}}
*When* I click the 3-dot menu for a Mouse Record
*Then* I am presented with an option entitled "Transfer"

+Examples+:

| {{view}} |
| {{Breedings > Parents Group}} |
| {{Breedings > Offspring Group}} |
| {{Litters > Parents Group}} |
| {{Litters > Offspring Group}} |
| {{Mice > Mice Details}} |
| {{Cages > Cage Card}} |

+Scenario 5+: _Transferring one Mouse at-a-time from Mouse Record's 3-dot menu_
*Given* I have selected the 3-dot menu of a Mouse Record
*When* I click Transfer
*Then* that selected mouse in the cage is marked as transferred
*And* I am presented with a prompt to chose a transfer date 
*And* the selected Mouse Record is removed from default filtered {{<view>}}.

+Examples+:

| {{view}} |
| {{Breedings > Parents Group}} |
| {{Breedings > Offspring Group}} |
| {{Litters > Parents Group}} |
| {{Litters > Offspring Group}} |
| {{Mice > Mice Details}} |
| {{Cages > Cage Card}} |

+Scenario 6+: _Selecting Bulk Transfer option from a Cage's 3-dot menu_
*Given* I have selected cage from the Cage Map
*When* I click the Cages 3-dot menu
*Then* I am presented with an option entitled "Bulk Transfer"

+Scenario 7+: _Bulk transferring mice from a cage_
*Given* I have selected a cage
*And* I have selected the cage's 3-dot menu
*When* I click Bulk Transfer
*Then* all the Mice in the cage are marked as transferred
*And* all the Litter Records are marked as transferred
*And* I am presented with a prompt to choose a transfer date
*And* the cage is empty for Mice Records and Litter Records

+Scenario 8+: _Prompt user to select transfer date_
*Given* I have selected to transfer mice and/or litters
*When* I am prompted to select transfer date
*Then* the prompt says "Select transfer date"
*And* the prompt shows a date-picker
*And* the prompt gives two button "Cancel" and "Save"

+Scenario 9+: _Click anywhere outside of modal prompt_
*Given* I am prompted to select transfer date
*When* I click anywhere outside of the modal prompt
*Then* I am taken back to the previous view
*And* the Mice or Litters are not transferred

+Scenario 10+: _Click Cancel to select transfer date_
*Given* I am prompted to select transfer date
*When* I click Cancel from the prompt
*Then* I am taken back to the previous view
*And* the Mice or Litters are not transferred

+Scenario 11+: _Click Save to select transfer date_
*Given* I am prompted to select transfer date
*When* I click Save from the prompt
*Then* I am taken back to the previous view
*And* the Mice or Litters are transferred with transfer date equal to date selected from transfer date date-picker

+Scenario 12+: _Decrement Mice/Litter count after transfer_
*When* I transfer a mice or litters
*Then* the corresponding mice / litter counts are decremented accordingly across strain, breedings, cages, and litters (where applicable).

-----

h1. Housekeeping Notes

h2. Notes to DEV + SQA

Part of this story *clones* a functionality in iOS where the user can bulk transfer mice from Cage Card (see CMI-194).

h2. Touch Points where Mouse Record can be accessed
Below are all the *touch points* where a mouse record can be accessed.  

  - Breedings > Select Breeding > Parents Tab > Select Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Breedings > Select Breeding > Offspring Tab > Select Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Breedings > Select Breeding > Litter Tab > Select Litter Record (pulls up Litter Details) >Select Parent Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Breedings > Select Breeding > Litter Tab > Select Litter Record (pulls up Litter Details) >Select Offspring Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Litters > Select Litter > Select Parent Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Litters > Select Litter > Select Offspring Mouse Record > 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Mice > Select Mice > Mark Dead
  - Mice > Select Mouse > View Mouse Record > Mouse Record Details 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Mice > Select Mouse > View Mouse Record > Bred with Mouse 3-dots (mice who have bred with selected mouse) > View Record > Mouse Record Details 3-dots > Mark Dead --- Note the steps here can be done recursively
  - Cages > Select Cage > Cage Details 3-dots > (Bulk) Mark Dead
  - Cages > Select Cage > Mouse Record 3-dots > Mark Dead
  - Cages > Select Cage with litter > Litter Record 3-dots > Mark Dead

column1: Mouse ID Refactor
column34:
The mouse ID in the current system allows nulls and allows duplicates. This is fine for some users but not ok for other users, such as UCSF.

To accommodate multiple users and different scenarios for use of the mouse ID, we need to implement a system mouse ID that is unique and user friendly. This system mouse ID can be unique across a colony or across the system. (Developer decision)

We need to display the system mouse id:
Mouse record
Mouse mini card
Mouse list
Add mouse form - non-editable

Acceptance Criteria:
System Mouse IDs are assigned in these Add features:
* _Add mouse from Cage Details_
* _Add Mouse from Dashboard_
* _Add pup from litter workbench_
* _Pups generated from litters_
* _Import Mouse_
* _User can set starting ID from offspring settings_

Technical Steps:


(Smartsheet: COMA53)

column1: Edit Strain Link to Transnetyx
column34:
Scenario 1: New strain chosen does not have the probe(s) that are already linked to the mutations of the Colony Strain
For this scenario, prompt the user to add the probe for the missing link to the transnetyx strain. (This is for R1.1) Ideal solution would be to automatically add the probe to the Tyx Strain.
Scenario 2: The new strain has the probe(s) that is linked to the mutations
For this scenario, no action is required.

The link for this should be in the menu option from the Gene mutations combination section of the strain dashboard. There needs to be another option from the edit genotypes menu.

column1: Setup strain for genotyping: Step 1
column34:
The UI for setup for strains to transnetyx needs to be a wizard structure.

It has been decided to link the strain first, then the mutations to probes.

Take the user down a simple step process to accomplish this showing them the result to genotype conversions as the last stage.

Initiate the strain genotype wizard from the strain dashboard in the genotype settings section here:  !image-2017-06-15-08-54-28-179.png|thumbnail! 

A button should launch a wizard for adding a link for strains and mutations.

column1: Cage Map: Filter Active Litters
column34:
Active litters filter on Cage Map does not seem to filter all cages with active litters. Something is excluding a portion of the cages with active litters from being filtered in.

iOS business logic:
* A litter is considered active if date weaned is null and it has living offspring.
* Having living offspring is defined as:
*# No pups recorded or generated
*# The initial pup count value has been recorded, no pups were generated, but the found dead and missing counts add up to the initial pup count, meaning all pups died before being generated
*# Pups have been generated and at least 1 of them is alive (death date = null)

(Smartsheet: COMA154)

column164: 14/Jan/18 8:20 PM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] After a little digging into what constitutes an "Active" litter on the Cage card I see that it is a Litter that is not deleted and that has not been weaned yet. This is different logic than what constitutes a cage having an "Active" litter for the filter on the Cage Map. The Cage Map filter only looks at the mice in the cage for a wean date and doesn't consider whether or not the litter has a wean date. So you tell me how this should work. Assuming that the Active Litters listed in the cage is correct, then should the logic for determining "Active" litters on the cage map be changed so that it ONLY looks for unweaned litters and DROP the check for mice in the cage being unweaned? This is an easy fix, but I just need to know exactly how to handle that little bit of logic. It seems to me that the mice in the cage shouldn't have any bearing on whether or not the cage has "Active" litters in it.
column165: 15/Jan/18 11:34 AM;rwilliams;[~tposchel] Question on the iOS logic for determining Active Litters as described in the body of this ticket. Point 3 talks about a litter being considered "Active" if it has 1 or more live pups. I think we may be missing something here because if we were to change the web app to include this case I believe that there will be many many more litters that will suddenly become "Active". I am thinking that we are missing something here. Currently on the web app we determine if a litter is "Active" solely by making sure that the litter hasn't been weaned. So, whether a Litter has generated pups or not, we look to see if the litter has been weaned to determine if it is active. Based on the logic in iOS, it looks like a litter is active for as long as there are live mice that came from that litter. [~jmedlock] [~jcox]
column166: 15/Jan/18 11:58 AM;tposchel;I spoke with Rich about this and we're all cleared up. iOS does check DateWeaned first and foremost to determine if a litter is active. If the dateWeaned == null (not weaned), then we proceed with checking the living offspring.

column1: Don't Allow Parent Removal from Breeding Wizard
column34:
_As a user, I should only be able to remove breeding parents from a breeding before the breeding is saved or marked as active/has a setup date. Once a breeding has at least one un-deleted litter, the parents should not be able to be removed but instead will need to be retired._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* User is able to remove breeding parents from a breeding when 0 litters exist for the breeding
* User is warned or alerted that they cannot remove breeding parents that are linked to a litter in the system but instead need to retire the breeder.
* Remove the "x" UI element for removing parents from the breeding.

+Scenario+:
*Given* I have a parent I need to remove from a breeding
*When* I edit the breeding to remove the parent
_*AND*_ The breeding parent is the parent of a current litter in the system
*Then* warn or alert the user that the breeding parent must be retired instead of removed

column34:
From the litter workbench, when pups are mark missing or dead BEFORE they are ID'd in the system, they should not receive an ID.

We should continue to track a record was created so we may report on health of breeding later on but the missing pups would not receive an ID.

(Smartsheet: COMA340, COMA84)

column151: 11/Jan/18 3:28 PM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] Part of what is going on with this ticket has to do with the new automatic system generated mouse naming feature that Chris added. These mice are getting assigned a name when they get generated. If you don't want dead or missing mice to get auto Ided like that (meaning you want the ID to be left blank), then I can put in some code that to not auto name the mouse if the mouse is missing or dead. One side effect that could have is that it wipes out the mouse's name if it gets marked dead or missing later in life. I'll have to see if I can code that so it won't do that. But, once I get that done then we will see what the litter workbench actually does when you ID the mice. Let me know if you want me to remove that auto naming code for dead or missing mice.
column152: 12/Jan/18 8:50 AM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] This may also be revealing an issue with the system generated id. It doesn't appear to be handling the unique naming of mice when multiple are created at the same time
column153:
12/Jan/18 10:13 AM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] Actually as I look through the code, the name field is getting populated with System Generated Id of the mouse if the name field is empty. Do we not want to do that for mice that are missing or dead? So what that means is that when the mice were "generated" the system assigned them a SysGenId, then, when the LitterWorkbench loads the newly generated mice back up (missing and dead ones too), because the name is empty, our code automatically fills it in with the mouse SysGenId. We really need to talk through how all of this should work. And we have also discovered a bug with the SysGenId where it appears that it isn't incrementing for some reason... 

Thinking through this a little more... I think that because of the way the application works right now with the name auto filling with the SysGenId that the Workbench will never ID mice like it should because I think it would only ID mice that didn't already have a name, but right now they will always come back with a name. I think we need to talk through this some with Chris to determine how we really want some of this to work. And I am making some assumptions on how the Workbench works, so I may not be right on all of that...
column154: 12/Jan/18 10:31 AM;jmedlock;[~rwilliams] We would not want an ID on missing or dead pups if they were marked as such before pups we generated. The feedback comes in before we added in the system ID though. We may want to discuss this. The feedback is that they do not want those records taking up the next in line auto serialized ID. That is different than the system ID.

12/Jan/18 12:37 PM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] I've made some changes to the name so that it doesn't automatically populate for mice that are dead (or missing). Now the mice are showing in the workbench without a name and the name is disabled so that it can't be edited. All of that is good, however, the live mice are still coming in with the system generated id for the name and I think that the process of automatically naming the mice doesn't do anything because the live mice already have a name assigned. I may be able to clear that name as the mice go back to the workbench and see if that resolves the id issue there, but not sure what will happen if they aren't ided during that session and are saved, because the sysgenid may still slip in there somewhere in the process... I'll keep working and let you know what happens.

Also, I have already mentioned this, but we apparently have a bug with the sysgenid as well because it isn't getting auto incremented. I'll look into that while I am here to see if I can figure out what is going with that too.

column1: Cage Details: Add litter from cage
column34:
The cage details allows for adding a litter from the cage level. Current a mother is automatically selected; however, the harem breeding and trio breeding must account for multiple mothers.

For a harem breeding the user needs to be allowed to select the mother from a list that also includes an unknown option.

For trio breedings, the user needs to be able to select the mother, unknown or BOTH mothers in the trio.

*Message from Veronica:*
"Request a harem mating (or trio but I didn't try this)
Move animals into same cage on workbench
Go to breeding list and activate mating
From workbench separate females into individual cages
Pick one female cage and click "add litter"
Instead of selecting the appropriate mother that is in the cage, leave all the females listed or pick a female that was separated into a different cage"

Green "litter saved" message but litter is not added to the cage.  If you go back to the cage map you will see the litter in the original harem cage if all the females were listed as the "mother", or in a different cage if a different mother was indicated.  There should be an error message if the selected mother does not match who is in the cage, or if possible system should only display the female in the cage (too restrictive?)

From this form can we change the mothers location to a drop down.

For 1 mother breedings:
The drop down should have the mother selected by default, present the user with an unknown option as a second option.

For trio breedings:
Have the mother that was in the cage where the add litter option was selected be the default.
Other options:
* Unknown
* Both mothers in the breeding
* The other mother
For Harem breedings:
Have the mother that was in the cage where the add litter option was selected be the default.

 - if multiple mothers are in the same cage for the trio or harem, which one should we pick for the default selected?
 - Since we aren't limiting the selection of mothers based on if the user selects trio, harem, etc. should we go on the number of mothers selected?
 - If this isn't the case, and we do want to go based on the breeding method, what should we do for "special" and "unknown"?
 - For Harem breedings, you are meaning that you want every mother listed as a separate option, with the one in the cage being selected by default? 

I guess currently I think it makes it the easiest and most straight forward for the end uesr is that you can select any one of the mothers in the breeding whether or not they are in the cage that you add the litter to, and maybe we can just add an "unknown" option to that list.   Maybe we can talk about this a little bit right after scrum?
column157:
27/Oct/17 8:51 AM;jmedlock;* if multiple mothers are in the same cage for the trio or harem, which one should we pick for the default selected?
     The first one in the list of mothers is fine.
* Since we aren't limiting the selection of mothers based on if the user selects trio, harem, etc. should we go on the number of mothers selected?
    If number of mothers = 2 the option for both mothers (dam 1 and dam 2) should be in the drop down list. 
* If this isn't the case, and we do want to go based on the breeding method, what should we do for "special" and "unknown"?
    Your statement below is accurate. The only outlying scenario is the trio where both mothers need to be able to be selected at the same time. 
    For single mother breedings the 1 mother should be selected or have the unknown option.
For Harem breedings, you are meaning that you want every mother listed as a separate option, with the one in the cage being selected by default?
I guess currently I think it makes it the easiest and most straight forward for the end uesr is that you can select any one of the mothers in the breeding whether or not they are in the cage that you add the litter to, and maybe we can just add an "unknown" option to that list. Maybe we can talk about this a little bit right after scrum?
column158:
02/Nov/17 7:32 AM;bkoch;[~jmedlock] [~admin], while looking into this, I'm sort of wondering how we can implement it.  I thought at first (and implemented) a way for an unknown mother to be added to the cage on add litter detail load with just the name as "unknown" and the id as "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", but then when saving the litter it has to validate that mouse is in the system, and goes through the typcial business logic validations.  So my question would be:

1. Should we keep dynamically generating this unknown mouse for each time they want to add a litter, and therefor there are litters with mothers who don't exist in the system?
 - Benefits here are that we don't clutter up the mouse list with unwanted mice, but the negatives are that we'd have a lot of potentially broken references.
2. Should we create a new physical mouse entry with the name "unknown" and the same properties as the next mother mouse in the list?  
 - Benefits are that we are following the same business logic as every other litter and breeding goes, but will create a lot of potentially unwanted mice in the system.
3. Should we not do the unknown option, and just go back to the main point of making sure we create the litter in the cage that it was selected from?

or is there a different option I'm not thinking of?
column159:
02/Nov/17 8:56 AM;jmedlock;[~admin] [~bkoch] After looking through some other tickets and seeing the difficult time you are having, it appears we made the litter mother required somehow in the business logic. Having it required makes things easier for us but may cause issues for users that have no idea which mother the litter came from, scary but that appears to be a thing.

Is that an accurate assumption that the litter mother parent seems to be required in the business logic?

Thanks,
Jim

2. Moved 1 of the mothers to a different cage.
3. Added a litter, verified that all of the mothers were still displayed correctly (even the one that was moved to a different cage).
4. Used the mother from the seperate cage to create a litter, verified that it was created in the cage that was selected to be added from.

One thing I have noticed is that as mentioned previously, the breeding that is selected for a mother is just the first one in the list that is returned from the database, and that the mother is not retired on.  so if the mother is part of several active breedings, it will not work correctly at all. column1: Order Manager: Probe Results Conversion to Genotypes UI/Setup
column34:
How it is now
-----------------
When probes are linked to gene mutations, a conversion from "+" "-" results to genotypes can be assumed. This feature does not exist in Colony.
The Change
----------------
Provide a user interface representation and back end conversion of results of "+" and "-" to genotypes. This conversion setup or translation then should allow results returned from Transnetyx genotyping to assign a genotype to a mouse from the sampleID sent in a previous order.
Results are returned from transnetyx and an indication of new results should be displayed to the user. Once viewing the results and suggested conversions to gnotypes, the user should have a method of approving the results conversion and then the genotypes will be assigned to the mouse/pup.

Transgenes linked to probes will link 1 to 1 and provide a result of "+" or "-" these results will pair to a genotype of present or absent
Genes link to a knock out probe and a wild type probe for detection of zygosity. 

Use this table to determine accurate genotypes from results combinations between the knock out probe and the wild type.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

* Order results "new results display" -- COMA-1303
* Converting the results to genotypes from these conversion settings (translations) -- COMA-1301

Business Impact
---------------------
This change allow colony users to easily place orders from their mice and gives the organization a method to start removing Labfinity from supported applications.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
Gene mutations paired with probes need to have a table setup for user to identify results from probes is equal to specific genotypes for a gene mutation. -Once these conversions are setup for a gene mutation, they should the save across all strains that share the gene mutation.- << moved to later release as of 1/10/18

*Requirements*:
_Special handling of the *SNP* probe type_

column1: Well plate Ordering UI: Samples List - Order Report Assignment/Report
column34:
How it is now
-----------------
-The colony application has should allow users to save and assign an order to a user for sample collection and plate preparation. This is a new feature.-

The Change
----------------
Once a user has selected samples for ordering, the sample list should display. The plate can be loaded or just the sample list could be present. The order then should be able to be completed at a later date. The wellplate ID and the plate should not have to be populated to save and assign the order.

*_A future change should allow for notification about the order assignment and alerts that orders have been assigned an awaiting submission_*

-For release 1.1, saving a responsible user and requested user would be sufficien-t. A PDF report should also be available based on the information from the samples list and wellplate assignments. The PDF should be a samples list, plate map, and area to write notes.

Business Impact
---------------------
This change allow colony users to easily place orders from their mice and gives the organization a method to start removing Labfinity from supported applications. Allowing the order to be completed by multiple users more accurately represents what happens in the field when collecting samples and placing orders.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
Allow users to save to  PDF an order report for printing. Allow users to assign order (sample collection to a user) *_Long term once sample collection has been completed and plate dropped in Tag Center, the requesting user would be notified._*
*Requirements*:
_Portions of this change requires notifications and alerts. These requirements are mentioned for future possibilities and are for design purposes only._

========================================================================

*{color:red}*This ticket was changed to only include a printed report on the wellplate UI page. The report should consist of a list of samples, wellplate assignments and a space for notes.
*{color}*

column1: Well plate Ordering UI: Samples List - Select Tissue Type
column34:
How it is now
-----------------
The system allows users to select tissue type as a setting that filters down from strain to breeding to litter and eventually mouse/pup. For adult mice that are added to the system from a vendor purchase, these mice should recieve tissue type from the strain level.
The Change
----------------
*_Current tissue type in Quick Order is captured on the strain level but submitted on the order level. Long term solution needs to include tissue type on the sample level. This will require changes to the orderbyfile service for orders._*

When animals are selected for genotyping order, the tissue type should be noted and displayed for the user on the sample list. The tissue type can then be changed for the current order if needed from a drop down list on the sample.
Business Impact
---------------------
This change significantly increases the visibility of tissue type for the cleanroom. This update would also greatly benefit QA in the cleanroom and provide information that may result in identifying issues faster.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
Users should be able to change the tissue type per sample on the samples list but default tissue type should be selected from the settings feature in the colony app.

----
Technical Design:

Per voice conversations with [~jmedlock] et al, tissue type is used in the lab to distinguish embryo tissue from other types, since the lysing process is different. Since per-sample tissue types would be inherently allowed by Colony, orders that contain  at least one embryo tissue sample will be flagged as embryonic, as all other tissue type values equate to 'tissue' in quick order.

----

h1. SQA Notes
Created by bwinter on 1/19/2018

+Feature+: _Select tissue type for sample in genotype order_

_As a lab user processing a genotype order, I want the user to specify the tissue type of a sample when placing a genotyping order, so that I can know what tissue type is in which well of a received wellplate._

+Background+: _Genotype order created for mouse or litter_
*Given* that a mouse or litter has been succeffully submitted for a genotype order

This background step assumes that
* the mouse has a linked strain and a biopsy record or 
* the litter has a linked strain, biopsy record, and has been ID's (at least pups generated even if un-sexed)

+Scenario+: _Sample with only one biospy_
*When* I see the sample
*Then* the *one* biopsy record displays as {{<display>}}

+Scenario+: _Sample with more than one biopsy_
*When* I see the sample
*Then* the *most recent* biopsy record is displayed as {{<display>}}

+Examples+:

|| {{<tissue type>}} || {{<biopsy date>}} || {{<display>}} ||
| {{TOE}}        | {{01/01/2018}} | {{TOE 1/1/2018}}          |
| {{TAIL}}      | {{10/10/2017}} | {{TAIL 10/10/2017}}       |
| {{EAR_PUNCH}} | {{12/01/2017}} | {{EAR_PUNCH 12/1/2017}} |
| {{EMBRYO}}    | {{01/01/2018}} | {{EMBRYO 1/1/2018}}        |
| {{ES_CELLS}}  | {{01/01/2018}} | {{ES_CELLS 1/1/2018}}      |
| {{BLOOD}}     | {{01/01/2018}} | {{BLOOD 1/1/2018}}         |

+Scenario+: _Changing biospy record for sample_
*Given* a sample has more than one biopsy record
*When* I click to change the biopsy record
*Then* I see a list of biopsy records for associated mouse sorted descending order by biopsy date (most recent first)
*And* the most recent biopsy is selected by default
*And* I can select another biopsy
*But* I cannot select more than one biopsy per mouse per wellplate order.

column1: Well plate Ordering UI Initial Buildout and Biopsy Sample
column34:
How it is now
-----------------
The system allows users to create multiple biopsy records for a mouse/pup. These biopsy records need to be shown to the user and genotypes need to be allowed to be related to the biopsied sample.

The Change
----------------
When placing a genotyping order for Transnetyx genotyping and multiple biopsies exist for selected samples without genotypes, present the user with options to select the biopsy for each sample. This should be a drop down list from the sample in the samples list.
Business Impact
---------------------
This change allow colony users to easily place orders from their mice and gives the organization a method to start removing Labfinity from supported applications. This is an ease of use feature to allow users the already biopsied an animal but did not add that sample to a plate to quickly add the specific sample to an order for genotyping. This also improves data accuracy for the users colony.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
Users are able to select a biopsy from a drop down. This is an ease of use feature to allow users the already biopsied an animal but did not add that sample to a plate to quickly add the specific sample to an order for genotyping. This also improves data accuracy for the users colony.
*Requirements*:
----
Technical Design:
This ticket/branch will serve as the initial UI build out container, since sample management is the logically first operation in the wellplate population workflow.

column1: Well plate Ordering UI: Samples List - Gene Mutation(Allele)/Probe On/Off
column34:
How it is now
-----------------
The system does not have a method to allow a user to turn off probes or gene mutations(allele) for an order.

The Change
----------------
*_Turning on and off gene mutations/probes should be available on the strain level in the first release, with consideration for making this a sample level function in future releases._*

During the order process, when setting up the plate for submitting to Transnetyx for genotyping, the user should be able to turn off gene mutations(allele). The user should also be able to turn off probes.

If a gene mutation is turned off - all probes detecting this gene mutation (Allele) should also be switched off. Meaning the strain will be submitted to transnetyx without these probes to be run on the samples.

*If probes are turned off individually (meaning the KO probe is enabled for a gene mutation but the WT probe is disabled) and the combination of the probes creates the conversion(translation) from results to genotypes, then the auto conversion and populating for genotypes may need to be turned off?*

Business Impact
---------------------
This change allow colony users to easily place orders from their mice and gives the organization a method to start removing Labfinity from supported applications.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
Users are able to turn on and off gene mutations (alleles) which disables all probes for that mutation. The user should also be allowed to disable individual probes per mutation.

*Requirements*:

column1: Wellplate UI: Samples List - Sample Naming
column34:
How it is now
-----------------

The colony application has settings for a user to supply method of IDs for mice. These IDs can be used to designate a unique sample ID.

The Change
----------------

Once on the samples list for ordering a genotyping test through Transnetyx, the sample IDs should default to the ID method provided in settings that filter down from the strain level, then to breeding, then to litter. If this ID setting is *OFF*, then the IDs for animals should be left to the user to provide. The user could provide these sample IDs by typing them into the sample ID text box or using an "auto increment."

The auto increment should allow the user to type in 2 or more sampleIDs per strain group then auto increment the samples. For example: the user enters abc1 and abc2 and selects auto increment. The remaining samples for the strain group would increment by 1 down the list until reaching the end of samples for that strain group.

Business Impact
---------------------

This change allow colony users to easily place orders from their mice and gives the organization a method to start removing Labfinity from supported applications.

Stakeholder
--------------

Team

Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------

Entering sample IDs should not be a repetitive function for the user. If settings are setup, the system should utilize those settings. If settings are off, an automatic method should exist.

*Requirements*:
Auto increment is a feature of Quick Order, these features should be identical in the way auto incrementing samples is applied.

----
Technical Design:
Litters get sent to the Litter Workbench where auto-naming is already a thing.
Individual mice are biopsied in place, and the sample name is autogenerated based on tissue type and date.

column1: Order Manager: Colony Gene Mutations(Alleles) to QO Probes
column34:
How it is now
-----------------
A user has probes in the account that are "ready for testing?", when in colony application the user should be able to link the probe to a colony allele (gene mutation)
The Change
----------------
Provide a user interface that allows the user to select a strain to link and then select gene mutations to pair with probes.
Business Impact
---------------------
This change allow colony users to easily place orders from their mice and gives the organization a method to start removing Labfinity from supported applications.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
Gene mutations should be able to pair with probes as a "detection method" for the presence/absence of a transgene or the zygosity of the gene.

*Requirements*:
*The strain will need to be linked before these options are presented to the user for R1.1. So the link my probes to a mutation combination will not be available if the strain is not linked that the mutation combination exists.*

_Special handling of the *SNP* probe type_
_Special handling of KO/FL with WT1 and WT2 probes_


Scenario: Pair standard gene mutation KO/WT will pair with 2 probes

Scenario: KO/FL paired with a KO probe, FL probe and (1) WT probe

Scenario: KO/FL paired with KO probe, FL probe and (2) WT probes
*Need User Interface for:* COMA-1973 and COMA-1844
_Pairing probes_ -- Select the mutation to pair to a probe, the user needs to select the probe and select the WT probe to use for that mutation unless the mutation is a transgene.
_Populating the results to genotype conversions_


Need to details scenarios and conversion possibilities for sex linked genes/transgenes and advanced options for transgenes. If this is not possible, we may need to have the user manually select a genotype for these results.
For sex linked genes, if we know the sex of the animal or if the user uses the Y probe we could determine the correct genotypes. Otherwise we will not be able to automatically convert from results to genotypes for these genes.

*Need sex linked genotype conversion tables.*

*Do not allow linking "hidden" probes.*
*Allow linking disabled probes*
*Results conversions will ALWAYS be calculated from probes run on the order. Ex:
For KO Mut the KO prb and WT probe are linked.
If WT is not run because the user does not want to run it, only partial conversions can be made. We will only be able to tell the customer KO or WT is present and not the exact genotype.*

column1: Order Manager: Link Colony Strains to OM Strains
column34:
How it is now
-----------------
A user creates a strain in colony manager and a strain in the quick order site.
The Change
----------------
These strains need to be linked for purposes or ordering genotyping services through the colony application and sending orders to the transnetyx system
Business Impact
---------------------
This change allow colony users to easily place orders from their mice and gives the organization a method to start removing Labfinity from supported applications.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
A strain in CM should be able to be linked to a strain in QO provided necessary requirements are met.

*Requirements*:
From the Strain dashboard, provide a transnetyx strain link option. The colony strain will need to be linked before allowing the mutations combinations to be linked to probes. This will shorten the list for users when linking probes.

What account are the strains linked to?
Sub ticket potential changes for order manager group accounts.

When linking strains to transnetyx:
At all times in the linking wizard the customer support email and phone number should be easily accessible and a reminder that if they need help we have a team that can assist them.

Scenario 1:
Strain has no mutations in colony but Tyx strain has probes

Allow link but prompt user on gene mutation section that mutations need to be added to the colony strain.
Ideally we would allow the user to add mutations in this section but for R1.1 we can instruct them to add mutations from the genotype settings then edit the mutation to return to this step.

Scenario 2:
Strain has mutations in colony but 0 Tyx strain has 0 probes

Prompt the user to add probes to the Tyx strain with a link to the correct location in quick order to accomplish the task. Alert the user they will have to refresh to page after adding probes to Tyx strain.

Scenario 3: 
Strain in colony has 0 mutations and Tyx strain has 0 probes

Combination of 1 and 2 needs to happen here. Instruct the user to the correct locations to add mutations and probes and then they can return to this step by editing the mutation link

*Linking drop down of strains also needs to list the probes per strain for easy identification of the strain*

*Rules for linking a strain*
The strain must be setup:
_Must have 1 mutation_
*To place an order with a linked strain:*
_The mutation must be linked to a probe(s)_

----
h3. *Technical Design:*
Both systems will track the strain ID of the other on a per linked strain basis.
OrderManager interop code will be housed in its own assembly withing CM to allow for future conversion to WebAPI methods.

* refer to attached picture *AlleleToProbe_DB_ERD* for new database table "StrainGeneAlleleProbes".
* New Enum *DetectionMethods* needs to be added with these values:
** Unknown
** Transnetyx
** Southern Blot
** Realtime PCR
** PCR
** Other

column153:
06/Sep/17 9:14 AM;rwilliams;Adding a Technical Design note:
In the Order Manager database, we need to create a junction table with OMStrainId, ColonyStrainId, and DateLinked. 

We need this sort of solution because a OM Strain can be linked to more than one Colony Strain. Here is a potential issue if we just put DateLinked on the Strains table: IF there is an OM Strain that has more than one Colony Strain connected to it, and if someone does something in OM/QO that breaks the link to that Strain, then that link is broken for all Colony Strains that are linked to that OM Strain which is good. However, as soon as one user goes in and fixes just one of Colony Strain links, the system would then consider all of the Colony Strain links valid again instead of forcing all of the links to be re-linked.
column154:
07/Sep/17 3:26 PM;rwilliams;Info from Russell on querying OM DB for Strains and Probes:

For Strain I do not think the status matters, EXCEPT for “Deleted” status.
We also probably do not want to allow users to Link “Disabled” Strains, since in Quick Order it does not allow Users to make an Order with a “Disabled” strain.

Strain Query

{code:java}
SELECT *  -- (or whatever you need)
FROM 
       OrderManager.dbo.Strains as s
       INNER JOIN OrderManager.dbo.Users as u on s.UserId = u.UserId
WHERE 
       s.StrainStatusId <> 13  -- 13 is “Deleted”
       AND s.Disabled = 0
       AND (u.UserId = @LeaderUserId 
       OR u.ParentUserId = @LeaderUserId)
{code}


----

For Probes, we just want to EXCLUDE any “Hidden” Probes from being linked… It does not matter if the probe “IsActive” or not because this just means enabled or disabled in the website and either of those can be added to an order.

Probe Query

{code:java}
SELECT *  -- (or whatever you need)
FROM 
       OrderManager.dbo.Probes
WHERE 
       StrainId = @StrainId
       AND IsHidden = 0
{code}

08/Jan/18 5:38 PM;rwilliams;OK – I think I might understand the issue. The problem is that you can’t link a strain until you add it to colony . I think it was a mistake to add the “Link Strain” button to this “Add Strain” dialog. At the point that the dialog is open there is no strain created yet. If we want the user to be able to link this newly created strain I suggest we remove that button and we add a “Save and Link” button so that on that click we can save the strain in Colony and then redirect the user to the Link Wizard. I remember seeing that Link button a while back and thinking that will never work there, but I forgot where I had seen it. I believe it was a ticket that Brad completed and I would bet that the requirements called for adding it there.

Richard
column161:
10/Jan/18 11:41 AM;bwinter;[~tpatterson] I think the UI/UX needs to be revisited ASAP for linking strains in colony.  There are two places where the user is presented with an opportunity to link strains prior to gene and mutations being created for / added to the strain in Colony.  
 
Starting the Strain Link Wizard before genes and mutations have been set up creates a blocker at Step 2 (Link Probes) of the Strain Link Wizard.  Probes cannot be linked if no gene mutations have been created for / add to the strain.

Two places where Strain Linking presented prior to gene / mutations created:

1. Add new strain
2. Strain Details > Strain Settings\*

\* Note that Strain Settings appears before Genotype Settings in the Strain Details page.

CC: [~jmedlock][~qevans][~rwilliams]
column162:
10/Jan/18 12:23 PM;jmedlock;[~bwinter][~tpatterson][~qevans][~rwilliams]

From a process point of view, orders can be created in Quick Order that do not have probes on a strain. Unless we restrict Colony users to wait until the QO strain is completed in assay design, we would want to remove the ability to link a colony strain and quick order strain. Otherwise, we can allow the user to place the order with a strain that is linked but has 0 probes. 
This may require change in the link process(wizard) AND a change in the order process. For the initial release AND prior to building a single location for colony and quick order to reference 1 strain instead of 2 strains linked in software, we could hide the link options until the genes/mutations are present on the strain.
I will get a business decision on that today.

Thanks,
Jim

column1: Well plate Ordering UI: Samples List - Skip Well / Empty Wells
column34:
Users like to leave empty wells some times to separate different strains on the plate, either for easier loading or just to differentiate between samples easily.

From the samples list:
The first sample of a strain group needs a menu option: Add empty well above
The last sample of a strain group needs a menu option: Add empty well below

Adding empty wells should be allowed before and after samples have been assigned to a well position. If adding empty wells after wellplate assignment, the add empty well function should re-arrange sample locations automatically.

*Adding an empty well will need to be calculated when loading the plate.*

column1: Well plate Ordering UI: Samples List - Control samples
column34:
Each sample should be allowed to be a control sample. The max control samples that are free per strain group in our current ordering system is 5.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
From each sample:
a  check box should be presented to mark each sample as control
The tool tip for the check box should indicate to the user that a max of 5 controls per strain will be free of charge.

*_When samples are added to the plate controls should also be added to the plate_*

*When samples are selected for controls, allow the user to enter the result for the control.* The results the user will add will be the probe results. 

----

h1. SQA Notes
Created 01/22/2018 by Bryan Winter

+Feature+: _Marks samples as control_

_As a user, I want to mark samples in a wellplate as control, so that I can verify that the Transnetyx genotyping results matches my own._

_As the Transnetyx CEO, I want the customers to have 5 free control samples per strain -per wellplate order-, so that Transnetyx can get prospect customers to give Transnetyx a try for each of their strains._

_As the Transnetyx CEO,  I want customers to pay for every control sample beyond the 5th control sample, so that we are not giving samples away for free._

*Note:* 
* Users who submit samples marked as control presumably already know that that samples genotype and want to use the control samples to verify Transnetyx's process.
* Currently, customers get 5 free samples per strain per order.
* Soon this logic will change to a threshold.
* {color:#59afe1}*This logic has changed as of April 18, 2018 to 5 free control samples per strain (ever), and this logic will likely change again after this code is release to PROD.*{color}

+Scenario+: _Mark a sample as control one-by-one_
*Given* that I am at the wellplate order page
*When* I mark a sample as control
*Then* I can see that that sample is marked as control.

+Scenario+: _Mark all samples in a strain as control_
*Given* that I am at the wellplate order page
*When* I mark all samples in a strain as control
*Then* I can see that all the samples in that strain are marked as control

+Scenario+: _Do not charge for the first 5 control samples per strain -per order-_
*Given* that I have a strain on the wellplate order page with {{<probes>}} number of probes and {{<samples>}} number of samples with {{<controls>}} marked control
*When* I finalize and submit my wellplate order
*Then* I can see on the finalization page in Colony that I am charged {{<strain total>}} for that strain
*And* from Quick Order, I can see the strain in my order was charged {{<strain total>}} for that strain

+Examples+: _5 or less controls_

|| {{probes}} || {{samples}} || {{controls}} || {{strain total}} ||
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{0}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 0) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{1}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 1) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{2}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 2) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{3}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 3) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{4}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 4) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{5}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 5) x price)}} |

+Scenario+: _Do charge for every control sample after 5 per strain -per order-_
*Given* that I have a strain on the wellplate order page with {{<probes>}} number of probes and {{<samples>}} number of samples with {{<controls>}} marked control
*When* I finalize and submit my wellplate order
*Then* I can see on the finalization page in Colony that I am charged {{<strain total>}} for that strain
*And* from Quick Order, I can see the strain in my order was charged {{<strain total>}} for that strain

+Examples+: _6 or more controls_

|| {{probes}} || {{samples}} || {{controls}} || {{strain total}} ||
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{6}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 5) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{7}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 5) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{8}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 5) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{9}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 5) x price)}} |
| {{1}} | {{10}} | {{10}} | {{$ (1 x (10 - 5) x price)}} |

column1: Well plate Ordering UI: Sample List - Omit Samples
column34:
From the samples list UI:

Each strain group should be allowed to be omitted from a check box/menu item. Omit can be allowed before and after the plate has been loaded. 

From the strain header on samples list:
Check box with text "Omit"
Once selected all samples in the strain group are marked/flagged as omitted for the current well plate/order

Each sample should be allowed to be omitted from a check box/menu item
Check box with omit next to each sample
once selected, the sample is marked/flagged as omitted for the current well plate/order

*_When samples are added to the plate, omitted samples should also be added to the plate._*

----

h1. SQA Notes
Created 01/23/2018 by Bryan Winter

+Feature+: _Marks samples as omit_

_As a user, I want to omit samples in a wellplate for storage, so that I can have Transnetyx store the sample for a period of time for whatever reason._

_As the Transnetyx CEO, I want samples marked omit to be free to the customer and to have no assays run against them._

*Note:* 
* Users who submit samples marked as omit do not want any genotyping done on those samples, and since we do not charge them, we (Transnetyx) also do not want to genotype them to save money and time.

+Scenario+: _Mark a sample as omit one-by-one_
*Given* that I am at the wellplate order page
*When* I mark a sample as omit
*Then* I can see that that sample is marked as omit.

+Scenario+: _Mark all samples in a strain as omit_
*Given* that I am at the wellplate order page
*When* I mark all samples in a strain as omit
*Then* I can see that all the samples in that strain are marked as omit.

+Scenario+: _Do not test for omit samples_
*Given* that I have submitted an order with omit samples
*When* I finalize and submit my wellplate order
*Then* from Quick Order, I can see that the samples marked omit do not have probes ordered for them.

+Scenario+: _Do not charge for omit samples_
*Given* that I have a strain on the wellplate order page with {{<probes>}} number of probes and {{<samples>}} number of samples with {{<omit>}} marked omit
*When* I finalize and submit my wellplate order
*Then* I can see on the finalization page in Colony that I am charged {{<strain total>}} for that strain
*And* from Quick Order, I can see the strain in my order was charged {{<strain total>}} for that strain

+Examples+:

column1: Litter Workbench: Add to cart
column34:
From the litter workbench, when a user ID/Biopsies their samples, then there should be an option to -"Send to Transnetyx"- "Add to Cart"

This option will place the pups that are being biopsied into an area that can be loaded into a Transnetyx plate.

The current idea of staging samples for validation (shopping cart) may be revisited. 

How it is now
-----------------
Currently the litter workbench only allows save and cancel
The Change
----------------
Add a button "Send to Transnetyx" that allows the selected biopsy samples to be prepared for a transnetyx order
The send to transnetyx button should use the data provided from the customer regarding date biopsied, tissue type
ID = Sample ID
Submit Work date = Biopsy date
Tissue Type = Tissue Type
Business Impact
---------------------
Easily order Transnetyx genotyping from the litter workbench
Stakeholder
--------------
Team

column1: Ordering: Sample Validation - Prior to plate view
column34:
*Sample Validation - Technical Ordering Requirements*
Placing an order in quick order requires:
* Strain IDs linked from Order manager ==> Lims *Colony Manager Strains must be linked to a strain that exists in OM and is available in LIMS*
* Unique sample ID across the *same* strain on *same* order
* Tissue Type (Currently this is by plate but long term needs to be by sample) *Do we validate tissue type?* *For Release 1 of Ordering and Results, tissue type should be related to the plate. Tissue Type changes to be related to samples would need to be changes in Order manager first.*
* Alleles on Strain are linked to a probe in QuickOrder

*Can LIMS handle tissue type by sample?*
LIMS does not care where tissue type is located i.e. on sample level, strain level, order level.

How it is now
-----------------
No validation or preparation of samples step is included in Colony manager
The Change
----------------
After a user selects samples for genotyping, then a sample validation step needs to occur. This full screen "shopping cart" area should display samples on the order and objects that need to be corrected before the order can be placed. For objects that need significat correction, such as strain cannot be linked to Tyx before ordering, there needs to be a remove sample/samples option as well.
Business Impact
---------------------
Creates a way to validate data that will create an order in Transnetyx quick order and reduces support needed on these orders.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
Each sample should be validated against the listed requirements above before the order can progress to plate building.

column1: Order Manager: First User Review of results
column34:
How it is now
-----------------
When a user access the results from a genotyping order for the first time, they should need to review the suggested conversion from colony app and approve the genotypes to be assigned to mice. This feature is a new feature to Colony.
The Change
----------------
From the results notification UI (COMA-1303), the users should be able to access results. If the first time viewing results the user should be presented an option to make the genotypes from the the conversions the genotype of the mice that were sent as samples.
Business Impact
---------------------
This change allow colony users to easily place orders from their mice and gives the organization a method to start removing Labfinity from supported applications.
Stakeholder
--------------
Team
Acceptance Criteria:
-------------------------
When the user accesses results from an order for the first time, the conversion (translations) from results to genoytpes should be presented to the user and a genotype these animals selection should be available.

*Confirmed: We need to have the user review the results in Colony before the genotypes are assigned to the mouse.*

*The genotypes applied to mice from the result to genotype conversions from Transnetyx results should be clear to the user. Specifically a user applied genotype and a transnetyx result should be separate entries on the mouse and a genotype history should be available.*




*Requirements*:
_Retesting? CIR? PDF export ? XML?_ _*All these features should be available in Quick Order for release 1.1, there needs to be a link from Colony to Quick Order that does not force the user to log in meaning the accounts are the same. That directs them to results for the order.*_
column151: 13/Nov/17 12:59 PM;bkoch;[~jmedlock], does this mean that after the results screen is viewed once, we should not let them set genotypes to the mice on subsequent viewings?  Or is the "only able to apply the genotype results to mice during the first review" not applicable anymore?  I will still add the ability to apply the genotypes to the mice by selecting the checkbox, but want to make sure whether or not we want to enforce the "during first time viewing results".
column152:
14/Nov/17 10:24 AM;jmedlock;[~bkoch] I think this should be a 1 time thing. Once the user applies the genotype from the order, they would need to set genotypes for this list of mice a different way.

The only thing that makes me think the other way is the event of retests. In this case, which I am not sure we are handling in the colony order process yet, the user would need to manually apply a genotype. We may need to investigate this asap to determine how to handle it. I will get an answer for this.

Thanks,
Jim
column153:
14/Nov/17 12:04 PM;jmedlock;[~bkoch] The 1 time review should mean this:
Once a user views the results the first time AND applies the genotypes to the mice, then the ability to apply those same genotypes to the mice should not be present. If the user does not apply the genotypes from the "Apply Genotypes" button, then the ability should persist until the user chooses to apply them.

This will only not be the case in the scenario involving retests or partial completed orders that complete in multiple stages. We need a ticket to handle these scenarios, i will start working on that ticket.

Thanks,
Jim

*the results tab should be the default tab shown on this screen.*

The colony manager Mouse details and list view will be modified to display relevant genotyping result information as results information becomes available in the system.

* A graphical indicator of the presence of new results information must be displayed in the main navigation bar of Colony Manager, with an indication of the number of order results pending review, providing link based navigation to the order management view(s).

column1: Colony Manager User Account Management
column34:
To reliably enable user order submission via Colony Manager, the application will require an integrated user account management module. This will ensure that a users Colony Manager credentials provides access to Address, Payment, and other account data necessary to process genotyping orders which are stored in QuickOrder/OrderManager.

* The UserProvider database will be the system of record for all Colony Manager Users.

* An Account Creation page will either be created in a themed Colony Manager set of views, or seamless pass-through to the existing registration page(s) will be developed such that Colony Manager users can access, enter, and manager pertinent ordering specific metadata.

* The intended state will be that all Colony Manager users will also be QuickOrder users, and will have full access to their account metadata through integration or pass through navigation.

* In pass through scenarios, modification to the QuickOrder/OrderManager application will be required allow the correct user workflow and navigation based on origin, with links returning users to their correct landing pages, etc.

* Synchronization of QuickOrder user account will be developed such that existing QuickOrder customers who wish to utilize the Colony Manager application will require no steps other than login and group setup.

* At a minimum, group owner / member management must developed to allow organizational users to be added, removed, or modified by a central account authority.

* Analysis is required to determine if a permissions system should be in place to allow non-owner users to have management functionality and/or ordering capability from the Colony Manager application (delegate account scenario).
----

*Technical Design Notes:*

Colony Account owners will have the ability to specify whether their account is linked to their QuickOrder account via the individuals Account Management page.
The system will generate a single use bearer token (backed by new schema, TransnetyxUserProvider.[dbo].[AuthorizationTokenRequests]. Tokens are issued on account update when no redeemed token is found for the specified user and purpose.

[Identity bearer tokens are hashed by the Purpose string, so the authorization tokens can be issued for anything we need in the future. TwoFactor will probably be the next usecase]

The token is sent via email, and then authenticated as part of the messages link payload. This flags the account as linked, which the order submission methods check before allowing QuickOrder data access (Strain Linking, Order Placement, etc).

For example, consider a Colony User is invited to someone's Active Group.  The Active Group owner has *not* linked their Colony account to Quick Order.  The current UX implementation suggests that the problem is with the Colony user invited to the Active Group.  This user will receive a message similar to "Your account is not linked to QO." column1: Propogation of Results from QuickOrder to ColonyManager (ORMA Integration)
column34:
When genotyping has been completed for an order that originated from Colony Manager, processing of results information must recognize the result set's origination and branch to custom code that will deliver the results to the Colony Manager results WebAPI service .

* Based on metadata added to the QuickOrder records, the post-results processor will transmit results data to the CM application. (ORMA Integration Point)

* A WebAPI method must be created to accept the inbound results payload, transform the data into datasource compatible rows, and update the appropriate Colony Manager  order and mice objects to indicate the genotyping outcome on a per-mouse basis.
* Once results are picked up by the colony app, the conversions to genotypes should occur. These genotypes should not be applied directly tot he mouse until the user accepts that they need to be applied. See COMA-1304


----
Results data will be processed and applied to sample child rows for the individual mice. Additional DB infrastructure is not required. This will facilitate biopsy/result history per mouse without duplicating OM's functionality.

column1: Order Finalization, Pricing, and Submission
column34:
This feature facilitates the submission of an order created in the Wellplate order creation UI's (COMA-1298) to Transnetyx Quick Order. 

* From the Wellplate Order Creation UI, the user is presented with the option to Submit the order.
* Navigation to an order summary page (new code?) will be performed, and pricing data for the order will be calculated using the existing QuickOrder pricing mechanisms , accounts, addresses (or a custom adapter written to gain access to said functionality).
* Normalization of the order data will be performed such that it can be correctly submitted into the QuickOrder system,.
* -Order submission / confirmation user interfaces will be in place via pass-through to the existing Quick Order UI to finish the order submission workflow.-

h2. Technical Info

[~rjonakin] added 2 files below for the Colony to QuickOrder *Data Contract* for submitting an order. One file is suggested XML (Can be changed as needed) and the other file is just Notes of information needed to form the XML.

Order3.Finalize.aspx needs to be modified such that users cannot navigate (back) to step 2 during the order submission process

column1: Well plate Ordering UI: Samples List and Plate
column34:
After validation of samples area complete and user has processed all errors that would prevent a successful order COMA-1735, then the user should be directed to the sample list with well plate UI.

*Sample List features*
* Omit Samples -- COMA-1817
* Control samples -- COMA-1818
* Empty Wells -- COMA-1822
* Sample IDs -- COMA-1839
* Allele/Probe on/off feature -- COMA-1840
* Select Biopsy - COMA-1841
* Tissue Type selection per sample - COMA-1842

*Sample Information displayed*
* Well plate well location
* Sample ID (mouse ID) - *Unique across strain for each order*
* Create Biopsy/Select Biopsy (defaulted to create new biopsy)
* Tissue Type (defaulted to mouse tissue type in system)
* Strain color
* Strain name as header allow
-CageID-
-Room/Rack/Location-

*Samples UI funtionality*
* Drag/Drop strain groups to plate to set starting well and ending well for that group of samples
* -Manual enter wellplate well location on first sample in strain group to set starting location, this should calculate ending location-
* Auto populate plate in order of sample list
* -Drag strain groups up and down list for quick re-order of the strain groups-
* Assign plate to user or Save/Print PDF report -- COMA-1843



 !SampleWellplate-Draft.png|thumbnail! 
 !Controls-Language.png|thumbnail!
column44: The amount of time spent testing the features in this ticket do not accurately reflect the amount of hours spent testing this ticket.  In fact, numerous team members have tested the well plate plate in numerous situations. ;29/Mar/18 9:48 PM;bwinter;300
column151:
04/May/17 12:24 PM;jmedlock;@Chris changing this ticket to be more developer ready. copying original contents here:
This feature will allow the user to designate the sample layout of genotyping material in a wellplate drag and drop UI paradigm.
The user logs in to the system and navigates to a Mouse, Litter or Cage editor view.
From the selected view, the user is presented an option to initiate the order process with the given the mouse/mice/pups in context.
A Colony Manager order record is created, and wellplate records are generated based on the samples assigned from each mouse.
If an existing partial order exists for the wellplate number assigned, prompt the user to reconcile that problem.
The main navigation bar will display an item in the cart for the order until the order has been finalized and the submission process has been followed (See Order Submission ticket)
*
Steps we must account for
Wellplate Barcode Name MUST be added to the plate (Important: This should be first Step)
Applying Alleles to test for on a given sample(s) – (This covers turning probes on or off)
For the first release of orders and results, we need to mirror Quick Order. Turning on/off probes(Alleles) for the strain group and not the individual mouse.
Allow ability to mark samples as Control Samples (Current Quick Order language needs to be present regarding 5 free controls) Controls-Language.png
Allow ability to mark samples as Omitted
Allow ability to Skip Wells (a.k.a “Empty Wells”)
What we can infer dragging a mouse a well location:
Mouse Name (Mouse ID) – aka Sample Name in TYX.
This IS REQUIRED
This MUST be a unique name across the strain across the order.
Ampersands (&), Single and Double quotes are not allowed in sample names.
Strain for the mouse sample
With strain we get Alleles (Probes)
Well location of the Sample (Obvious, but it is needed data info)
The rest of the needed order info can be delegated to Quick Order Step 3 of the order process.

column1: Create Group Level Strain Settings
column34:
_As a user, I want to be able to set default settings from the group level._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* Users can access a settings screen which allows them to modify default new strain settings.
* The user can change those default values and they will be reflected for the next strain created.
* Changing the default settings does not affect any existing strains.
* (Litter settings) \-[inherit from]\-> (Breeding settings) \-[inherit from]\-> (Strain settings) \-[inherit from]\-> (Group settings)


+Elements, Valid Values and Defaults+:
* Toggle: Will ID - Default as True
* Dropdown: ID Method *[Show if 'Will ID' is True]*
** Tattoo - Default
** Ear Tag
** Ear Notch
** Microchip
** None
** Toe Clip

* Slider or Input: ID by *[Show if 'Will ID' is True]*
** Age in Days (Default of 14 days)
* ID
** Female Icon (radio button)
** Male Icon (radio button)
* Auto-serialize (Toggle with ID on/off by default)
** Continue Strain numbering
** Continue Group numbering

* Toggle: Will be biopsied - Default as True
* Dropdown: Biopsy Method *[Show if 'Will be biopsied' is True]*
** ES Cells
** Fin
** Tail - Default
** N/A
** Embryo
** Blood
** Ear Punch
** Toe

* Slider or Input: Biopsy by *[Show if 'Will be biopsied' is True]*
** Age in Days (Default of 14)

* Toggle: Will be weaned - Default as True
* Slider or Input: Wean by *[Show if 'Will be weaned' is True]*
** Age in Days (Default of 21)

* Special litter instructions - Toggle on/off
* Toggled on should display a text input box. With instructions "Enter your special instructions here"
column151:
19/Sep/16 12:30 PM;ryan yanase;# Discussion - Should this just be default settings for Add Strain for MVP?

For example, giving just the group admin access to the feature and later allowing for individuals to change their own, or giving everyone access and later adding a preference where group admin is the only one who can edit the default.

column1: Hyperlink counts in Strains to Filtered Lists based on what is being Counted
column34:
_As a user, when I see {{<object>}} counts in the Strains listed on the dashboard, I want to click on the counts to be taken to a filtered list of those {{<objects>}}, so that my effort is reduced._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* When I click on a count of {{<objects>}}, then I am taken to an auto-filtered list that is filtered by criteria self-evident in {{<objects>}}.  (See screenshot dashboard.jpg)
* When viewing a specific Strain on the Strain Dashboard, the counts for Mice, Cages, Breedings, and Litters take me to an auto-filtered list that is filtered by the criteria used to generate these counts.  (See screenshot strainsdashboard.jpg)

+Examples+:

|| {{objects}} ||

| {{mice filtered by strain}} |
| {{cages filtered by  strain}} |
| {{breedings filtered by strain}} |
| {{litters filtered by  strain}} |


+Scenario+: _Clicking counts inside bar strain panels_
*Given* I am at my Colony Dashboard
*When* I click the {{<object>}} count in the *strain* panel
*Then* I am taken to the {{<object>}} page filtered by *strain* of the *strain* panel

+Examples+:

|| {{object}} ||
| {{mice}} |
| {{cages}} |
| {{breedings}} |
| {{litters}} |

+Scenario+: _Clicking counts inside count boxes inside Strain Dashboard_
*Given* I am at my the Strain Dashboard for a strain
*When* I click the {{<object>}} count box in the *strain* name banner
*Then* I am taken to the {{<object>}} page filtered by *strain* of the *strain* name banner

+Examples+:

|| {{object}} ||
| {{mice}} |
| {{cages}} |
| {{breedings}} |
| {{litters}} |
