column1: Litter Sample Validation Giving False Validation (When the litter/parents has been marked dead from iOS)
column34:
When a user adds a litter to the cart that was synced from iOS then they mark dead that litter and parents in iOS, the litter will remain in the cart in Colony but now requires a biopsy and ID even though they had both already prior to deletion.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a litter in iOS
2. ID and Biopsy litter
3. Sync iOS
4. Add litter to cart in Colony
5. In iOS go to cage with litter and litter parents, mark all dead and accept to delete cage.
6. Sync iOS
7. View litter sample in Colony (ID and Biopsy now required)
column145:
1. Create a litter in iOS
2. ID and Biopsy litter
3. Sync iOS
4. Add litter to cart in Colony
5. In iOS go to cage with litter and litter parents, mark all dead and accept to delete cage.
6. Sync iOS
7. View litter sample in Colony (ID and Biopsy now required)
column151:
14/Aug/18 10:27 AM;jstrickland;The problem is that currently there is no 'mark a litter as dead' option in iOS.  We only mark each mouse as dead and take the litter out of the cage when doing a Bulk Mark Dead.  There are no deathDate and deathType fields in the litter entity for iOS.  So on the web side the cart does not know that the litter is dead and it stays in the cart and has the missing info icons.

I just now noticed that this problem exists on master as well so its not a problem with this new build.  This is a bug with "Bulk Mark Dead" for cages.

CMI-50 adds a new 'Mark Entire Litter as Dead' menu option but adding this in on its own still won't fix this ticket since it doesn't deal with cages.  

I would prefer to push this off until the next release if possible.  We should add CMI-50 to that release as well since it is related.
column152:
28/Aug/18 9:05 AM;jstrickland;[~fdobjenschi] . Please see CMI-50 for more info but I've combined CMI-50 and this ticket into the CMI-298 branch.  This should be ready for review now.

Carrie's suggestions were to:
Mark all mice dead and any litters completely contained in this cage as dead.  If any litters are partially contained in this cage prompt the user:
"Cage X contains some litters that have pups that are not in this cage.  Mark those pups/litters dead as well?"

Yes does it and No does not mark any pups/litters outside of the cage as dead.  The pups in the cage and litters completely contained in the cage are still marked dead though.  

If you have any questions please let me know.

column1: Colony web app is requesting biopsy in the cart for mice already biopsied in iOS app
column34:
h1. What happened:
# Biopsy new litter in iOS app
# Sync iOS
# Login to web app
# Add litter to the cart for a new order
# Beaker icon appeared, meaning that all of the mice do not show as biopsied <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
# The quantity on the Shopping Cart is also off, +1 <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
 
h1. What I expected to happen:
When I biopsy mice in the iOS app and sync the app, I expect the beaker icon not to appear in the cart for these mice since they have already been biopsied. The quantity count should also match the number of samples (adds one).
column151:
06/Aug/18 11:24 AM;wwyatt;[~jstrickland], when I biopsied litters containing more than 2 mice, I ran into this issue and the quantity was off by +1.

CC: [~jcox], [~cleduc]
column152: 08/Aug/18 1:32 PM;jstrickland;So should be correct now.  Tested with litters up to 55 pups and every sample was sent (no beaker image) and pup count is correct as well now.  Will send to [~fdobjenschi] for review.
column153: 21/Aug/18 1:46 PM;wwyatt;Tested and Passed!

column1: Problem with not every mouse biopsied having a sample sent in the sync sometimes.
column34: Sometimes not all mice biopsied will have an associated sample sent in the sync.   Usually happens on larger litters.
column145: Might be tricky to test but it seems to work fine with litters of two mice being biopsied (which is primarily what I tested unfortunately).  I noticed that sometimes it would not send all samples in the sync when I was testing litters with 3 or 4 mice in them.  To verify that all samples were sent you will have to verify on the web and add that newly biopsied litter to the shopping cart.  You should not see a beaker (meaning that its lacking a sample).
column151: 02/Aug/18 12:27 PM;jstrickland;this has already been peer reviewed by [~fdobjenschi] and is ready for QA
column152: 08/Aug/18 2:23 PM;jstrickland;Should be ready to review again

column1: Problem with Sample name being blank or null causing sync errors
column34: There is a restriction on the sync api that the sample name has to be non-null and not empty.  This causes problems because we allow mice names to be null and empty.  This will be fixed in the api at a later date but this is to prevent these sync errors from happening in the meantime.
column38: this has already been peer reviewed by [~fdobjenschi] and is ready for QA;02/Aug/18 12:26 PM;jstrickland;10800
column145:
Select a litter to biopsy that has mice without names in it.  Needs to be a blank (empty) name not a name consisting of just spaces since that is actually valid.  You can just backspace out the name and hit Save.
If you can get a null mouse name too that would be good but not sure how you could.  The fix should handle nulls as well.
column151: 02/Aug/18 12:26 PM;jstrickland;this has already been peer reviewed by [~fdobjenschi] and is ready for QA

column1: Disable "Remove sample from well plate" option in sample 3-dot menu
column34:
_As a product owner, I want to disable/remove the "remove sample from well plate" feature so that iOS features are in-line with Web features._

Web does not have a "remove sample from well plate" feature for a sample in the Samples List on the Well Plate page.

+Acceptance Criteria+:

* When the user clicks the 3-dot menu for a sample in the Samples List, s/he does not see the "Remove sample from well plate" as an option to select.
* When the user is viewing the Sample List, s/he cannot remove a sample from the well plate.

column1: Changing gender of pups in litter by only clicking gender images does not keep gender info
column34: Clicking the images to change the pup genders results in the pup gender still being unknown.  It reads the genders from the section above where you enter these in manually which is incorrect in this case.
column38: This is on its own branch and in develop.  If you have any questions please let me know;18/Jul/18 3:53 PM;jstrickland;10800
column145:
Select a litter to be biopsied and select Edit Offspring.  Under the Offspring section click the gender images to change the genders of each pup to be Male or Female (just not Unknown) and hit Save.  Do not enter them in manually at the top. 

The Litter card screen will not display the new selected genders of the pups since they are still Unknown.

column1: Syncing from iOS shows incorrect number of pups in cage view
column34:
h1. What happened

# Create a new litter with 2 pups on iOS
# Sync and verify litter on Web
# ID litter on iOS to enter sex for each pup
# On iOS, manually enter sex (instead of clicking sex icon) for both pups AND uncheck Perform Biopsy Now
# Sync and verify litter on Web
# Web shows 3 pups in the Cage View <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen

I expected that sex'ing pups on iOS would not change pup count on Web.

h1. DEV Notes

h2. From [~jstrickland]:

So I’ve been going thru the cage counts stuff and hit a totally unrelated error I think.  Wasn’t sure if there was a ticket on it or not but here’s the info.  

I only made changes on iOS and verified them on the web after syncing each step.

So on iOS I created a new litter w/2 pups (synced and verified on the web).  Then I assigned a sex to both pups (1 M/1 F if that matters) and no biopsy.  I verified 2 pups were showing on iOS and that 2 mice (1M/1F) were sent in the sync.  Synced and 3 pups are showing on the web side in the cage view.  Happens consistently on both dev and qa.

I double checked the sync and its definitely only sending 2 mice up.  That would be the obvious problem but that’s not it.

h2. Comment from [~jstrickland] on 07/13/2018

Two mice were assigned a sex and two are sent in the sync but the litter pupCountAtBirth is set to 3 instead of 2. The web side will show 3 Pups since this data is incorrect causing the discrepancy.

h2. Comment from [~jstrickland] on 07/16/2018

This was pretty difficult to pin down. Sometimes when you manually entered a pup's sex (instead of clicking the sex icon) the pup count would be one too many in the sync.

Moved the calculation for IDing number of pups to updateOffspring and added additional logic to didPressSaveButton since adding pups after a litter was ID'ed was affected.

This should be ready for review and is on its own branch.
column38:

column1: Long Genotype Names on Workbench
column34:
_As a user, I need to be able to read the full genotype name at the workbench to be sure I'm working with the right mice._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* User is able to see full genotype name on the workbench.
** Presumably we switch to using dynamic font size, but admittedly there are only so many pixels on the screen so there will be a point where the name is too long for proper display.

column151:
10/Jul/18 1:48 PM;jstrickland;Some additional info from emails:



From their message:

When weaning a litter, (already at the workbench stage), long genotypes are cut off. Clicking on the mouse for details yields another screen where long genotypes are cut off. Then you must click edit, and yet again click in the genotypes window to finally view the full genotype. This is WAY too deep to be able to quickly compare mouse to mouse. Some solution needs to exist where a full genotype can be viewed without diving so deep into submenus and clicks.


Then Tyler responded:

Right now, the mouse cell does not handle super long genotypes. However, the mouse card does and the mouse card is now the default window that appears when you tap the mouse cell from the workbench. Previously it was not.


But they are not satisfied:

UAT not approved \- full genotypes need to be visible from the workbench view because often users may be looking at the genotypes to determine how they assign the mice to cages. If they have to click on every single mouse to view the genotypes before they move each mouse one by one this adds unnecessary time to the weaning process.

column1: Changing cage number removes rack position
column34:
h1. What happened:

* Cages > Cage 3-dot menu > Add to Workbench
* Cage 3-dot menu > Edit
* Scan in a new barcode for Cage ID > Save > Dond
* Cage no longer in Cage Map of Rack <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
* Cage has lost its rack position but still has Room and Rack <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen:
I expected the cage rack location to remain with a new cage ID.
column38: Just editing the cage name and hitting save will lose the rack position information.  This can be done in the simulator without using the barcode scanner.  See if my fix is ok please.;21/Jun/18 10:11 AM;jstrickland;7200

column1: Biopsying litter on iOS still shows litter as NOT biopsied when placing genotyping order for that litter
column34:
h1. What happened

# Biopsied litter from iOS > Litters to Biopsy > Select Litter > 3-dot menu > Biopsy > Save
# Litter marked biopsied in iOS
# Go to Colony web app
# Add that litter to shopping cart
# _Need Biopsy_ icon triggers in Shopping Cart <- {color:red}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen

Whenever a litter is biopsied from iOS (or web app), I expect the _Need Biopsy_ icon to NOT show in Required Action column of shopping cart.

h1. Note to Dev

This bug only occurs when litters are biopsied from iOS.

column1: Cage map icons display strain colors in unexpected ways.
column34:
h1. Scenario 1

h2. What happend

# Log into *staging* environment as _tyxadmin_
# Open Allen group
# Cages > Map > Room CV-592 > Rack 1
# *Cage icon* at *G4* shows an additional Strain color for Offspring Strain but there is NO _*active*_ litter <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
# *Cage icon* at *G5* does the same thing <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}

h2. What I expected to happen

I expected the cage icon to only have the Parent Strain color and not have the Offspring Strain color present unless there is an _*active*_ litter in the cage card.  If there are past litters that were in the cage, do not show the Offspring Strain color.

h2. Note to DEV

The web version does not show the Offspring strain color if there is not an active litter, but will bring up those cages if filtered by the Offspring Strain due to past breedings.

h1. Scenario 2

h2. What happened

# Log into *staging* environment as _tyxadmin_
# Open Allen group
# Cages > Map > Room CV-592 > Rack 4
# *Cage icons* at *C2* shows an additional Strain color that does not belong to any of the females in the cage <- {color:#d04437}UNEXPECTED{color}
# NOTE: None of these females are breeding and do not appear to be apart of past breedings or mothers of past litters.

h2. What I expected to happen

I expected there to be only one Strain Color for Cage *C2*, since all the females have the same Strain and do not appear to be past mother of litters or past breeders.

If they filter by offspring strain they will see cages which can produce the strain of interest but the color would still indicate the strain of the breeders. Thoughts?

column1: CLONE - Sync failing because RackIndex is null AND RackId is NOT null
column34:
h1. Background

We thought this bug had been resolved but apparently it can still be reproduced.  This is a clone the original ticket to track the new effort to resolve the issue.  Original ticket text below...

Even though we made some recent changes to the CageDetails edit form to prevent RackId from being set and RackIndex from being null, it is happening elsewhere in the app. I suspect that perhaps when a litter is weaned possibly, that the room/rack is copied from the parent cage but the RackIndex is left null.

If it isn't there, then perhaps some dragging and dropping in the cage map? 

We just need to prevent the scenario from occurring. 

h1. What happened:

# Log out of iOS
# Log into iOS
# Open group with more than 1 room
# Cages > select a cage > 3 dot menu > Edit (OR Add to Workbench > Edit)
# Select a new Room 
# Click Save without choosing a Rack
# No warning thrown <- UNEXPECTED
# Try to Sync changes > Fails with Rack ID or Rack Index error <- {color:red}UNEXPECTED{color}

h1. What I expected to happen:

I expected that iOS would not allow me to move cage to a Room without also choosing a Rack (which should avoid the sync fail error).
column151:
12/Jun/18 3:20 PM;jstrickland;To recreate this problem make sure you have just signed in (this is key) and immediately change Rooms for a Cage:
1 - select Cages
2 - click on 3 dot menu for cage
3 - Edit or Add to Workbench then Edit
4 - Select Room and pick a new Room
5 - click Save and notice that there isn't a warning box but should be
6 - go try to sync and it should fail with that rack Id or rack Index error 

[~fdobjenschi]
added fix on branch CMI-267 different approach and should be ready to review
column152:
13/Jun/18 7:13 AM;fdobjenschi;[~jstrickland]
Very good you managed to find the issue , seems the bug can be reproduced on every cage that has a location on it.
Your solution seems to working fine , my recommendation is to push a quick fix on all environments as soon as possible so will not receive anymore  sync fails .

column1: Populate DateTransferred on Litter
column34:
_As a user, when I transfer a litter, I need the litter record to remember the transfer date as well as any pups in the litter._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* The litter record stores a DateTransferred field that is populated at the time of transfer, regardless of whether or not any pup records were created.
* Any pups associated with that litter have their individual DateTransferred fields updated as well.

column1: CLONE - Keep Dates consistent between iOS and Web
column34:
_As a user, I want dates displayed consistently between the web and iOS._

+Acceptance Criteria:+
* User always sees dates relative to their Group's timezone and those dates should match between web and iOS.
* Include timezone identifier whenever datetimes are shown.
* For example, currently if a user saves data on the web after 6 PM central on 1/11/2018, then it gets recorded as 1/12/2018 UTC, and then presented to the user moving forward as 1/12/2018.

column157: 05/Jun/18 2:01 PM;rwilliams;[~fdobjenschi] [~jstrickland] I looked into this issue reported by [~bwinter]. !IMG_1132.JPG|thumbnail!
column160: 06/Jun/18 10:11 AM;fdobjenschi;[~rwilliams]   Thanks for info !
column161:
06/Jun/18 10:14 AM;rwilliams;Here is a query of the data for the database... if you run this against QA it actually references the Strain and Genes that Bryan is referring to.

{code:sql}
DECLARE @strainId uniqueidentifier = '3f16a62d-bc19-43c3-9f4f-8362ce365ed0',
	@geneId  uniqueidentifier = '9A76DC4B-AED6-40B9-AFF9-13DD3B6148AB';

SELECT sg.GeneId, g.Name, g.AlternateTranslatedResult, g.AbbreviatedName, g.IsTransgene, g.TrackTransgenicZygosity, *
FROM StrainGenes sg
	JOIN Genes g ON sg.GeneId = g.GeneId
WHERE sg.StrainGeneId IN
		(SELECT DISTINCT sga.StrainGeneId
		FROM StrainGeneAlleles sga 
			JOIN StrainGenes sg ON sga.StrainGeneId = sg.StrainGeneId 
		WHERE sg.StrainId = @strainId
		AND sga.DateDeleted IS NULL)

{code}
column162:
06/Jun/18 2:04 PM;fdobjenschi;[~rwilliams] Thanks for help . I think i fixed the issue after quite some struggle :).
We have pice of code in place that remove the relationship on a Entity that has dateDeleted != NULL so i had no relationship from StrainGene to StrainGeneAlleles to check for dateDeleted , this was the reason for asking about schema  :)

As far as i checked every not deleted StrainGene has a StrainGeneAllele relation on it , so now i made a check if StrainGene has no StrainGeneAllele relationship then is deleted and in this way is prevented to be showed . 
I tested for a while on [~bwinter] group Federation of Ricks and it's working fine , but i need confirmation from [~bwinter] for this.
Also [~jstrickland] please review the changes and tell me if it's ok  .
The code is on dev .
If a build is needed please ask [~jstrickland] or i will do it tomorrow .

column1: Fetch List of Groups on First Sync
column34:
Related to CMI-257

# On first sync, instead of just fetching ALL sync data since 1970, the sync operation should first fetch a list of groups/userGroups that the logged in user is a member of. 
# Fetch the full sync data for the first (maybe sorted by group.name? alphabetically) group. 
# Once the user has 1 group worth of sync data processed, show the user the dashboard for that 1 group.
# For the first sync only - fetch each additional group's full sync data maybe 1 or 5 groups at a time (we can play with this number to see what makes the most sense)
# We will need to modify the list of Groups UI
## To indicate that a given group is currently being synced for the first time
## To indicate that a given group has not yet been synced ever
## To NOT allow a user to select a group that has not completed its first sync completely.


Note: For all other subsequent sync operations, we will sync ALL groups since the amount of data is relatively small at this time.

01/Jun/18 8:37 AM;bwinter;[~fdobjenschi]  ,  [~jstrickland]  I was able to trip the Colony iOS to use the old sync loader.  Is this a problem? 

!IMG_0045.PNG|thumbnail!

h1. Steps to Reproduce:

# Sign into iOS app
# Wait for sync to process on big group
# Kill app (long press Home and swipe)
# Start app - sync continues
# Kill app (long press Home and swipe)
# Start app - sync continues
# Sign out of app
# Sign back into app -> Old Sync Loader pops up
# After old sync loader finishes, it throws an error then starts new sync loader.

 !IMG_0047.PNG|thumbnail! 

h1. Work around

If the user wanted to exit out of old sync loader and get back to new loader, she could quit app and open it back up.  Upon opening back up the new sync loader starts (or continues in background).  At least this was my observation on my device.

column152:
01/Mar/18 8:00 AM;tposchel;[~jcox] This is quite cluttered looking (not because of the specific implementation but because of the feature request). +What is the workflow/use case for adding this information?+ I could get behind the idea of showing it on mouse-over/hover for the web but I don't think it is necessary here though perhaps I could be persuaded. I know know we spent countless hours on some of these initial designs to make sure we had the absolute minimum information necessary on these views and we never had a use case for needing to see the cage IDs at that level. It was unlikely, in our minds, that the user was going to pull up the cage map and just scan their eyes over the whole thing until they found the cage ID they wanted. 

The primary reasons for going to the cage map were to (1) get a quick estimate of rack and cage density and (2) see a rough location of a cage that I already searched/filtered/navigated to from a litter/mouse/breeding.  When needing to go to a specific cage you will be coming from a litter, breeding, or mouse list. Those flows were coming from the mouse list (searching for breeders), litters list (clicking on a specific litter), or from the breeding card. The location of the cage (Room/Rack/Position) is visible via navigation from all of those places in iOS.

column1: Litter HasLivingOffspring Filter Broken
column34:
Scenario: when a litter has numberOfPups > 0 but does not have any offspring generated yet.

Currently the filter (HasLivingOffspring == YES) is excluding these litters even though it should not be.

I've narrowed the issue to line 534 in ColonyAPIManager+Predicate, "NSPredicate *foundDeadMissingPredicate" and it is because we can't perform addition inside the predicate (foundDeadCount + missingCount) < numberOfPups). 

I thought about taking the ColonyAPIQueryParamHasLivingOffspring out of the NSPredicate and just performing some filtering afterwards on the list of litters, but we have tightly integrated everything to be performed at the time of the request.

If we had a way to perform some 'post fetch filtering' that might help.
column151: 06/Feb/18 10:08 AM;tposchel;[~fdobjenschi] This is something I'd like you to look at tomorrow morning ahead of Ordering and results. If you can fix the query, that would be great, but I'll be surprised if you can since it seems impossible based upon my searching and testing this morning. It might be nice if we could do some filtering AFTER the query executes. I have a couple ideas about how to do that.
column152:
08/Feb/18 5:01 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
Now the filtering is working as expected .
I made some new predicates and compound predicates and no after query filtering is needed .
column153: 14/Feb/18 4:04 PM;tposchel;[~fdobjenschi] I added a unit test for this filter but am struggling mightily to make the test pass. Will you please pull my latest commit and tweak the unit test to validate this feature change? I had it running the tests without crashing but then I changed something and now it crashes every time. I can't figure out why.
column154:
23/Feb/18 11:00 AM;jmedlock;At first this seems to work but then adding pups to the litter breaks the filter until changes are made to the litter again.

Reproduction steps:
Go to cages view add litter to cage with 0 pups born
Add pups to litter ( i used 4 male 5 female 1 unknown.)
The total pup count updated to 10
The litters list shows the litter as active (haslivingoffspring == yes)
Then go to dashboard and back to litters list
The same litter disappears
Add another pup to the litter of any type
The litter shows back up on the list.
column155:
26/Feb/18 2:47 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
For fixing the issue that [~jmedlock] found we have to update variable nrOfPups with the sum of males + females + unknown when user edit this field .
I looked into the web and they have a validation here "combined counts cannot exceed Number of pups  ".
column156: 26/Feb/18 8:09 AM;tposchel;That's fine. You can add that additional validation.
column157:
26/Feb/18 8:37 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
After i looked better i realised we don't need any validation because when user is adding pups or ID them we don't have the nr of pups slider so now i update the numberOfPups property from litter offspring.count ...

column1: Updating Wean Dates
column34:
_As a user, when I set a wean date on a litter I want all pups of that litter to receive the same wean date._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* On the Litter Edit form, setting the wean date applies to all living pups of the litter.
* If the user sets the wean date to null, do not update any of the pups wean dates with null.
* If the user updates the date back from null to an actual date, then apply that date to all living mice in the litter.
column151: 02/Feb/18 4:54 PM;tposchel;[~fdobjenschi] If you could do this on a separate branch from ordering/results that would be good. I think it will be a quick fix so go ahead and work on it first thing Monday.
column152:
05/Feb/18 2:16 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
Checkout feature/CMI-245 branch .
column153: 05/Feb/18 9:36 AM;tposchel;[~fdobjenschi] I'm confused. The commit you made in ColonyAPIManager+Business is not at all related to this story. You need to back out all the changes you made there because they are not correct. This story is talking about the litter edit form where we allow the user to change the 'Date Weaned' property. Navigate to a litter, tap to reveal the litter card, tap 'Edit' in the top right to see the simple Litter Edit form. Scroll all the way to the bottom and you will see a section called 'Additional Details' with 3 date fields. This story deals with editing the 'Date Weaned' value.
column154:
05/Feb/18 10:57 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
Sorry for misunderstanding , i committed the right code now .

column1: Show all Gender Symbols on the Cage Map
column34:
_As an iOS user, I want to see all gender symbols on the cage map._

+Acceptance Criteria+:
* User is able to see the gender breakdown of the mice in a cage on the cage map.  (See attached screenshot of how this looks on the web.)

Note: Currently, the iOS does NOT show unknown (?) gender icon along side other icons. It also shows an interesting male/female hybrid icon, but we can get away from that and just use individual male and female icons.
column151: 22/Feb/18 8:37 AM;tposchel;I see a bunch of cages with '0' but they actually have mice in them.
column152: 22/Feb/18 8:40 AM;fdobjenschi;Fixed , 0 shows on cages with only males inside , now should be ok

column1: Cage map shadow causing frozen overlay
column34:
From the cage map, when a cage is tapped, the cage card is animated to the foreground and a dark shadow is applied over the entire background. When the screen is tapped to dismiss this cage card most of the time the shadow goes away. However there have been multiple reports that this dark screen/shadow appears and stays on the screen and there is no way to interact without the app unless the app is killed.


Way to reproduce: 
# Remove location from at least 1 cage
# From the cage map, make sure that you see the cage in the bottom of the cage map in the 'Unspecified Location' section.
# Tap the cage card
# Edit the position of the cage and save
# When the view refreshes it will be frozen
column151: 26/Jan/18 7:59 AM;tposchel;[~fdobjenschi] I have seen this issue myself once. Please take a look and fix it on Monday morning.

29/Jan/18 2:11 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]

I tried to reproduce the issue but with no success do you have some steps for this ?
column153: 29/Jan/18 6:42 AM;tposchel;[~fdobjenschi]  I did it on iPhone. Customer did on iPad. I remember that all I did was tap some cage cards from the cage map... I can try doing more later.

I'm trying to fix it !

29/Jan/18 8:22 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]

Now is not scrolling anymore if a cagecard is presented.
I think after scrolling the CageCardView is getting deallocated with the cell because of UICollectionView reuse system (The CageCardView is showed in the cell).

column1: Failed to Save Litter?
column34:
From Clare:

my breeding cage contained 3 females and one male. I had moved two pregnant females from this cage into a new cage to prevent overcrowding. They had a litter...but when I tried to add a litter to the cage that only contained 2 females, I got an error message, see screenshot. I don't know whether this is because theres no male in the cage?
column151: 10/Jan/18 4:21 PM;tposchel;Florin I think you already fixed this perhaps? Can you confirm and then write a very brief summary of the fix?
column152:
11/Jan/18 3:33 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
Yes, i fixed that .
The problem was : when a cage was new created by drag and drop a mouse the context was not saved and the cage will not exists on the new context from add litter and fail the save.
Now after drag and drop the context is saved and works as expected .

column1: Process Sync Data in Background when app is not in foreground
column34: For some accounts, the amount of sync data on first load is extremely large and takes a significant amount of processing time (~10 minutes). The user currently is forced to keep the app open on the screen to continue processing. We would like to allow the user to put the app in the background and have the sync continue processing.
column151: 22/Feb/18 12:21 PM;tposchel;[~fdobjenschi] Will you merge this into master? I attempted to, but there were conflicts and I feel better if you resolved it.
column152: 22/Feb/18 12:24 PM;tposchel;Note: The app will now send a local notification on FIRST sync success if the app is running in the background. To test:  Sign in, while it is processing the first sync payload, press home button and go to do something else on your device. Wait for the notification to tell you that your data is available. Also, if sync fails at any point while the app is in the background, a notification will be displayed as well.
column153:
23/Feb/18 2:42 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
The merge is done .

column1: All Transgene Options listed as Unlikely Genotypes
column34:
From Cynthia:

All transgene options listed as unlikely genotypes for a given litter.

Repro steps:
Select the Allen group
From the dashboard go to "litters to wean"
Select the litter from Hy10 Hc & Lc DOB 9/14
From the menu select "add genotypes"
Click "genotype" for any of the offspring
Look at the options under "transgene insertion 5, Jason G Cyster"

Result:
All 3 options (including inconclusive) are listed as "unlikely."  In this case all 3 are possible options.  I could not find any instances of this anywhere else, only when entering the genotypes for this litter.
column151: 22/Nov/17 8:05 AM;tposchel;I need to figure out how to determine unlikely for transgenes.
column152: 08/Jan/18 12:00 PM;jmedlock;[~tposchel] Are we doing this in the web? [~rwilliams] We need to make sure the apps are doing it the same way. I thought we have the unlikely feature in web also already.
column153: 08/Jan/18 4:30 PM;tposchel;We do have the unlikely feature in the iOS app already, but apparently it is yielding incorrect results for transgenes. It does work for non-transgenes.
column154: 09/Jan/18 8:07 AM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] I'm not sure that I understand the issue here. Is the issue that Colony generated 3 GeneResult records for a Transgene and all 3 of them were created with the name of "Unlikely"? What environment is this in? I found an "Allen Lab" group in production, but it appears to have no strains.
column155: 09/Jan/18 8:23 AM;rwilliams;[~jmedlock] OK - I found "Allen Lab" group in Staging with strain data in it. I have looked at all of the GeneResults and I find none with a TranslatedResult that is "Unlikely". I looked at all of the "Inconclusive" GeneResults and I don't find that any Gene has any more that one of those. I know I am missing something here...
column156: 10/Jan/18 9:58 AM;tposchel;[~rwilliams] "Unlikely" is not a TranslatedResult. It is some logic performed at the app level to determine if a given TranslatedResult is possible given the parents of a mouse. If the mom is WT/WT and the dad is WT/WT for a given gene, then the offspring have no choice but to be WT/WT. It wouldn't be possible for WT/MUT or MUT/MUT. So, the iOS app puts a little text next to WT/MUT and MUT/MUT that indicates "Unlikely". Apparently this logic works correctly for non transgenes but we need to re-evaluate the transgene "IsUnlikely" logic.
column157: 10/Jan/18 10:28 AM;rwilliams;[~tposchel] Thanks for the clarification. Now that you bring that up I think I have seen that somewhere, maybe in the Colony app. I didn't realize that was what was going on, but that makes sense.
column158: 15/Jan/18 11:29 AM;tposchel;I figured out all the issues. For transgenes that are NOT detecting zygosity (so presence and absence only) -- all choices are ALWAYS possible. Take the following example: mom (+) and dad (+). Both are present for a given transgene, BUT they could both be HETs and therefore even (-) is possible. That changes when you look at tracking zygosity.

column151: 31/Aug/17 2:03 PM;tposchel;Issue #2 appears to be an iOS issue where we are sending the same OffspringSettings object twice. I'm investigating. I don't know what the issue with Issue#1 is yet.
column152:
31/Aug/17 3:35 PM;rwilliams;[~tposchel] I went through the payload information for litters and litter parents. There appear to be litter parents for SIX litters, but there are only FIVE litters included in the payload and the missing litter is not already in the database. See the last attachment for the litter and litter parent information organized by litter id. Below are the litter parents that don't have a litter to be able to join to. Is it possible that the iOS app didn't create a litter record when it should have? Let me know what you think. At this point I don't think that the issue is with the sync unless we want it to work differently in situations like this.

"litterId" : "01F630B0-5E07-4D67-9A0E-05C01ACD3F66",

# this litterId doesn't already exist in the database

    {

column1: Incorrect 'unsynced changes' count
column34:
There have been several customers who have mentioned that their 'unsynced changes' counts are reporting values but that they never go away and do not report any errors in the sync.

2 possibilities:
# We are actually sending a record in the JSON and the web is either ignoring it or processing it and then returning an empty JSON response, so we don't remove it from the LocalChanges table. This happened a while back with MouseGeneResults. We would send multiple MouseGeneResults and only one would be returned in the response.
# We are calculating the number of changes incorrectly. This was also an issue where we were saving "local changes" even when the user tapped "Cancel' and deleted the records. Then the LocalChanges table thought that we had a record, but then when the JSON was created, it was empty because no actual records existed.

We need to be sure that when we display those changes, that they ACTUALLY exist. Also, we might should report a sync error if we include records in the JSON request and then do not receive them in the response... Or at least track them.
column151:
12/Dec/17 5:40 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
This is still an issue ?
column152: 12/Dec/17 9:51 AM;tposchel;I need to confirm, but I'm almost certain that it is still happening some.
column153:
20/Mar/18 6:42 AM;fdobjenschi;[~tposchel]
When trying to find out why an MouseGeneResultEntity was in email payload without a mouse i found and fixed this issue .
Steps to reproduce :
1.Edit mouse
2.Change Mouse Genotype
3.Press save
4.Without sync edit same mouse again
5.Change Mouse Genotype
6.Press save.
7.Sync changes from settings
8.After sync , unSynced changes number is populated and not going away .

All this because we don't delete the related localChanges for that entity when performing hard-delete .

column1: Improve sync parsing performance
column34: We have several accounts with > 10k Mice records. These accounts take forever to process on the iOS device. We need to improve performance of deserializing objects into Core Data.
column151:
20/Oct/17 3:59 PM;tposchel;A quick run through instruments revealed that a large percentage of time (23%) is used converting date strings (yxcu_dateFromISO8601String) to dates. I found a pretty good article that discusses performance options: http://jordansmith.io/performant-date-parsing/

Basically, our primary option to improve here is to have the web send us numbers of seconds since epoch instead of formatted date strings. Another option might be to save the string value into Core Data and then have accessor methods on each YXBaseEntity for fetching those dates. For example, "dateCreated" would be stored as a string in CD under perhaps "dateCreatedStr". Then whenever you reference "dateCreated" it returns the converted date. It would slow down individual calls but should improve performance greatly.
column152:
20/Oct/17 9:00 PM;tposchel;I take that back - apparently NSDateFormatter is WAY faster than our current solution - maybe 50 times faster based off my estimates from a separate project. We still have other performance bottlenecks, but now this isn't one of them. 

!mapEntityWithInfo_After.png|thumbnail!  !mapEntityWithInfo_Before.png|thumbnail!
column153: 20/Oct/17 10:51 PM;tposchel;[~fdobjenschi] I made some more performance changes to addRelationshipsToInfo and now it seems quite a bit faster. I don't have a good overall speed increase yet, but I did successfully sync tyxadmin account in under 2 minutes on my Mac.

column1: Mice list: filter by DOB feature
column34:
The iOS app currently allows the mouse list to be filtered by Age (in weeks). This is useful for finding breeders. However, when attempting to get statistics for number of mice born between given dates (for reporting purposes) it is impossible to do.

This story would like to add "Date of Birth" as a filter for the mouse list. The implementation should be similar to the 'Age' filter, where a toggle is required to turn it off and on, and then have 'From' and 'To' date pickers.

Whenever someone modifies From or To (in weeks) modify the date field. If someone modifies the date field, modify the age field.

column1: Mark entire litter dead function
column34:
We want the ability to mark an entire litter as dead, even if they haven't been added as offspring yet. However, if the user already put an initial litter count, then we will have already created pup records I believe.

1.	Add 'Mark dead' action menu on litter cell
2.	If there are already pups, then this is the same as a bulk mice mark dead option. Set mouse.deathDate and mouse.deathTypeId
3.	If there are no pups already, then possibly update litter.deathType and litter.deathDate (those properties likely do not exist yet)

28/Aug/18 8:57 AM;jstrickland;[~fdobjenschi]  Added Carrie’s suggestions and this ticket should be ready to review again (sorry\!).  I combined this and CMI‌-298 together into the CMI‌-298 branch so it can be reviewed there.  They overlapped way too much.

Her suggestions were when marking an entire litter as dead:  

* if all mice in this litter are in the same location (in one cage or no cage at all) mark the pups and this litter dead.
* If some mice in this litter are not all in the same location (meaning some in a cage and some possibly not in a cage or in several different cages) then prompt the user:  “Litter X contains pups that are not all in the same cage.  Mark all of these pups and this litter as dead?“.  Yes does it, No does not mark any pups or the litter as dead.

Again this is on the CMI‌-298 branch and not on CMI‌-50 any more.
